COM-Express I2C Stack  1.0
Type-safe string-based I/O for I2C registers.

32 #include <algorithm> // all_of, copy, fill, find, for_each, none_of, remove, reverse, transform
33 #include <array> // array
34 #include <cassert> // assert
35 #include <ciso646> // and, not, or
36 #include <clocale> // lconv, localeconv
37 #include <cmath> // isfinite, labs, ldexp, signbit
38 #include <cstddef> // nullptr_t, ptrdiff_t, size_t
39 #include <cstdint> // int64_t, uint64_t

42 #include <forward_list> // forward_list

45 #include <iomanip> // hex
46 #include <iosfwd> // istream, ostream
47 #include <iterator> // advance, begin, back_inserter, bidirectional_iterator_tag, distance, end, inserter, iterator, iterator_traits, next, random_access_iterator_tag, reverse_iterator
48 #include <limits> // numeric_limits

52 #include <numeric> // accumulate
53 #include <sstream> // stringstream
54 #include <string> // getline, stoi, string, to_string

56 #include <utility> // declval, forward, make_pair, move, pair, swap

58 
59 // exclude unsupported compilers
60 #if defined(__clang__)
61  #if (__clang_major__ * 10000 + __clang_minor__ * 100 + __clang_patchlevel__) < 30400
62  #error "unsupported Clang version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
63  #endif
64 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
65  #if (__GNUC__ * 10000 + __GNUC_MINOR__ * 100 + __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__) < 40900
66  #error "unsupported GCC version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
67  #endif
68 #endif
69 
70 // disable float-equal warnings on GCC/clang
71 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
72  #pragma GCC diagnostic push
73  #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal"
74 #endif
75 
76 // disable documentation warnings on clang
77 #if defined(__clang__)
78  #pragma GCC diagnostic push
79  #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wdocumentation"
80 #endif
81 
82 // allow for portable deprecation warnings
83 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
84  #define JSON_DEPRECATED __attribute__((deprecated))
85 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
86  #define JSON_DEPRECATED __declspec(deprecated)
87 #else
88  #define JSON_DEPRECATED
89 #endif
90 
91 // allow to disable exceptions
92 #if (defined(__cpp_exceptions) || defined(__EXCEPTIONS) || defined(_CPPUNWIND)) && not defined(JSON_NOEXCEPTION)
93  #define JSON_THROW(exception) throw exception
94  #define JSON_TRY try
95  #define JSON_CATCH(exception) catch(exception)
96 #else
97  #define JSON_THROW(exception) std::abort()
98  #define JSON_TRY if(true)
99  #define JSON_CATCH(exception) if(false)
100 #endif
101 
102 // manual branch prediction
103 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
104  #define JSON_LIKELY(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x), 1)
105  #define JSON_UNLIKELY(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x), 0)
106 #else
107  #define JSON_LIKELY(x) x
108  #define JSON_UNLIKELY(x) x
109 #endif
110 
116 namespace nlohmann
117 {
118 template<typename = void, typename = void>
119 struct adl_serializer;
120 
121 // forward declaration of basic_json (required to split the class)
122 template<template<typename U, typename V, typename... Args> class ObjectType =
123  std::map,
124  template<typename U, typename... Args> class ArrayType = std::vector,
125  class StringType = std::string, class BooleanType = bool,
126  class NumberIntegerType = std::int64_t,
127  class NumberUnsignedType = std::uint64_t,
128  class NumberFloatType = double,
129  template<typename U> class AllocatorType = std::allocator,
130  template<typename T, typename SFINAE = void> class JSONSerializer =
131  adl_serializer>
132 class basic_json;
133 
134 // Ugly macros to avoid uglier copy-paste when specializing basic_json
135 // This is only temporary and will be removed in 3.0
136 
137 #define NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION \
138  template<template<typename, typename, typename...> class ObjectType, \
139  template<typename, typename...> class ArrayType, \
140  class StringType, class BooleanType, class NumberIntegerType, \
141  class NumberUnsignedType, class NumberFloatType, \
142  template<typename> class AllocatorType, \
143  template<typename, typename = void> class JSONSerializer>
144 
145 #define NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL \
146  basic_json<ObjectType, ArrayType, StringType, BooleanType, \
147  NumberIntegerType, NumberUnsignedType, NumberFloatType, \
148  AllocatorType, JSONSerializer>

159 namespace detail
160 {
162 // exceptions //
164 
177 class exception : public std::exception
178 {
179  public:
181  const char* what() const noexcept override
182  {
183  return m.what();
184  }
185 
187  const int id;
188 
189  protected:
190  exception(int id_, const char* what_arg) : id(id_), m(what_arg) {}
191 
192  static std::string name(const std::string& ename, int id)
193  {
194  return "[json.exception." + ename + "." + std::to_string(id) + "] ";
195  }
196 
197  private:
199  std::runtime_error m;
200 };
201 
235 class parse_error : public exception
236 {
237  public:
246  static parse_error create(int id, std::size_t byte_, const std::string& what_arg)
247  {
248  std::string w = exception::name("parse_error", id) + "parse error" +
249  (byte_ != 0 ? (" at " + std::to_string(byte_)) : "") +
250  ": " + what_arg;
251  return parse_error(id, byte_, w.c_str());
252  }
253 
263  const std::size_t byte;
264 
265  private:
266  parse_error(int id_, std::size_t byte_, const char* what_arg)
267  : exception(id_, what_arg), byte(byte_) {}
268 };
269 
294 class invalid_iterator : public exception
295 {
296  public:
297  static invalid_iterator create(int id, const std::string& what_arg)
298  {
299  std::string w = exception::name("invalid_iterator", id) + what_arg;
300  return invalid_iterator(id, w.c_str());
301  }
302 
303  private:
304  invalid_iterator(int id_, const char* what_arg)
305  : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
306 };
307 
332 class type_error : public exception
333 {
334  public:
335  static type_error create(int id, const std::string& what_arg)
336  {
337  std::string w = exception::name("type_error", id) + what_arg;
338  return type_error(id, w.c_str());
339  }
340 
341  private:
342  type_error(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
343 };
344 
361 class out_of_range : public exception
362 {
363  public:
364  static out_of_range create(int id, const std::string& what_arg)
365  {
366  std::string w = exception::name("out_of_range", id) + what_arg;
367  return out_of_range(id, w.c_str());
368  }
369 
370  private:
371  out_of_range(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
372 };
373 
386 class other_error : public exception
387 {
388  public:
389  static other_error create(int id, const std::string& what_arg)
390  {
391  std::string w = exception::name("other_error", id) + what_arg;
392  return other_error(id, w.c_str());
393  }
394 
395  private:
396  other_error(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
397 };

399 
400 
402 // JSON type enumeration //
404 
429 enum class value_t : uint8_t
430 {
431  null,
432  object,
433  array,
434  string,
435  boolean,
436  number_integer,
437  number_unsigned,
438  number_float,
439  discarded
440 };
441 
451 inline bool operator<(const value_t lhs, const value_t rhs) noexcept
452 {
453  static constexpr std::array<uint8_t, 8> order = {{
454  0, // null
455  3, // object
456  4, // array
457  5, // string
458  1, // boolean
459  2, // integer
460  2, // unsigned
461  2, // float
462  }
463  };
464 
465  // discarded values are not comparable
466  if (lhs == value_t::discarded or rhs == value_t::discarded)
467  {
468  return false;
469  }
470 
471  return order[static_cast<std::size_t>(lhs)] <
472  order[static_cast<std::size_t>(rhs)];
473 }
474 
475 
477 // helpers //
479 
480 template<typename> struct is_basic_json : std::false_type {};
481 
482 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
483 struct is_basic_json<NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL> : std::true_type {};
484 
485 // alias templates to reduce boilerplate
486 template<bool B, typename T = void>
487 using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<B, T>::type;
488 
489 template<typename T>
490 using uncvref_t = typename std::remove_cv<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::type;
491 
492 // implementation of C++14 index_sequence and affiliates
493 // source: https://stackoverflow.com/a/32223343
494 template<std::size_t... Ints>
495 struct index_sequence
496 {
497  using type = index_sequence;
498  using value_type = std::size_t;
499  static constexpr std::size_t size() noexcept
500  {
501  return sizeof...(Ints);
502  }
503 };
504 
505 template<class Sequence1, class Sequence2>
506 struct merge_and_renumber;
507 
508 template<std::size_t... I1, std::size_t... I2>
509 struct merge_and_renumber<index_sequence<I1...>, index_sequence<I2...>>
510  : index_sequence < I1..., (sizeof...(I1) + I2)... >
511  {};
512 
513 template<std::size_t N>
514 struct make_index_sequence
515  : merge_and_renumber < typename make_index_sequence < N / 2 >::type,
516  typename make_index_sequence < N - N / 2 >::type >
517 {};
518 
519 template<> struct make_index_sequence<0> : index_sequence<> { };
520 template<> struct make_index_sequence<1> : index_sequence<0> { };
521 
522 template<typename... Ts>
523 using index_sequence_for = make_index_sequence<sizeof...(Ts)>;
524 
525 /*
526 Implementation of two C++17 constructs: conjunction, negation. This is needed
527 to avoid evaluating all the traits in a condition
528 
529 For example: not std::is_same<void, T>::value and has_value_type<T>::value
530 will not compile when T = void (on MSVC at least). Whereas
531 conjunction<negation<std::is_same<void, T>>, has_value_type<T>>::value will
532 stop evaluating if negation<...>::value == false
533 
534 Please note that those constructs must be used with caution, since symbols can
535 become very long quickly (which can slow down compilation and cause MSVC
536 internal compiler errors). Only use it when you have to (see example ahead).
537 */
538 template<class...> struct conjunction : std::true_type {};
539 template<class B1> struct conjunction<B1> : B1 {};
540 template<class B1, class... Bn>
541 struct conjunction<B1, Bn...> : std::conditional<bool(B1::value), conjunction<Bn...>, B1>::type {};
542 
543 template<class B> struct negation : std::integral_constant < bool, !B::value > {};
544 
545 // dispatch utility (taken from ranges-v3)
546 template<unsigned N> struct priority_tag : priority_tag < N - 1 > {};
547 template<> struct priority_tag<0> {};
548 
549 
551 // constructors //
553 
554 template<value_t> struct external_constructor;
555 
556 template<>
557 struct external_constructor<value_t::boolean>
558 {
559  template<typename BasicJsonType>
560  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t b) noexcept
561  {
562  j.m_type = value_t::boolean;
563  j.m_value = b;
564  j.assert_invariant();
565  }
566 };
567 
568 template<>
569 struct external_constructor<value_t::string>
570 {
571  template<typename BasicJsonType>
572  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::string_t& s)
573  {
574  j.m_type = value_t::string;
575  j.m_value = s;
576  j.assert_invariant();
577  }
578 
579  template<typename BasicJsonType>
580  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::string_t&& s)
581  {
582  j.m_type = value_t::string;
583  j.m_value = std::move(s);
584  j.assert_invariant();
585  }
586 };
587 
588 template<>
589 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_float>
590 {
591  template<typename BasicJsonType>
592  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t val) noexcept
593  {
594  j.m_type = value_t::number_float;
595  j.m_value = val;
596  j.assert_invariant();
597  }
598 };
599 
600 template<>
601 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_unsigned>
602 {
603  template<typename BasicJsonType>
604  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t val) noexcept
605  {
606  j.m_type = value_t::number_unsigned;
607  j.m_value = val;
608  j.assert_invariant();
609  }
610 };
611 
612 template<>
613 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>
614 {
615  template<typename BasicJsonType>
616  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t val) noexcept
617  {
618  j.m_type = value_t::number_integer;
619  j.m_value = val;
620  j.assert_invariant();
621  }
622 };
623 
624 template<>
625 struct external_constructor<value_t::array>
626 {
627  template<typename BasicJsonType>
628  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::array_t& arr)
629  {
630  j.m_type = value_t::array;
631  j.m_value = arr;
632  j.assert_invariant();
633  }
634 
635  template<typename BasicJsonType>
636  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t&& arr)
637  {
638  j.m_type = value_t::array;
639  j.m_value = std::move(arr);
640  j.assert_invariant();
641  }
642 
643  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
644  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<CompatibleArrayType,
645  typename BasicJsonType::array_t>::value,
646  int> = 0>
647  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleArrayType& arr)
648  {
649  using std::begin;
650  using std::end;
651  j.m_type = value_t::array;
652  j.m_value.array = j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::array_t>(begin(arr), end(arr));
653  j.assert_invariant();
654  }
655 
656  template<typename BasicJsonType>
657  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const std::vector<bool>& arr)
658  {
659  j.m_type = value_t::array;
660  j.m_value = value_t::array;
661  j.m_value.array->reserve(arr.size());
662  for (bool x : arr)
663  {
664  j.m_value.array->push_back(x);
665  }
666  j.assert_invariant();
667  }
668 };
669 
670 template<>
671 struct external_constructor<value_t::object>
672 {
673  template<typename BasicJsonType>
674  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::object_t& obj)
675  {
676  j.m_type = value_t::object;
677  j.m_value = obj;
678  j.assert_invariant();
679  }
680 
681  template<typename BasicJsonType>
682  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::object_t&& obj)
683  {
684  j.m_type = value_t::object;
685  j.m_value = std::move(obj);
686  j.assert_invariant();
687  }
688 
689  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
690  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<CompatibleObjectType,
691  typename BasicJsonType::object_t>::value, int> = 0>
692  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleObjectType& obj)
693  {
694  using std::begin;
695  using std::end;
696 
697  j.m_type = value_t::object;
698  j.m_value.object = j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::object_t>(begin(obj), end(obj));
699  j.assert_invariant();
700  }
701 };
702 
703 
705 // has_/is_ functions //
707 
718 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(type) \
719  template<typename T> struct has_##type { \
720  private: \
721  template<typename U, typename = typename U::type> \
722  static int detect(U &&); \
723  static void detect(...); \
724  public: \
725  static constexpr bool value = \
726  std::is_integral<decltype(detect(std::declval<T>()))>::value; \
727  }
728 
729 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(mapped_type);
730 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(key_type);
731 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(value_type);
732 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(iterator);
733 
734 #undef NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER
735 
736 
737 template<bool B, class RealType, class CompatibleObjectType>
738 struct is_compatible_object_type_impl : std::false_type {};
739 
740 template<class RealType, class CompatibleObjectType>
741 struct is_compatible_object_type_impl<true, RealType, CompatibleObjectType>
742 {
743  static constexpr auto value =
744  std::is_constructible<typename RealType::key_type, typename CompatibleObjectType::key_type>::value and
745  std::is_constructible<typename RealType::mapped_type, typename CompatibleObjectType::mapped_type>::value;
746 };
747 
748 template<class BasicJsonType, class CompatibleObjectType>
749 struct is_compatible_object_type
750 {
751  static auto constexpr value = is_compatible_object_type_impl <
752  conjunction<negation<std::is_same<void, CompatibleObjectType>>,
753  has_mapped_type<CompatibleObjectType>,
754  has_key_type<CompatibleObjectType>>::value,
755  typename BasicJsonType::object_t, CompatibleObjectType >::value;
756 };
757 
758 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
759 struct is_basic_json_nested_type
760 {
761  static auto constexpr value = std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::iterator>::value or
762  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::const_iterator>::value or
763  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::reverse_iterator>::value or
764  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::const_reverse_iterator>::value;
765 };
766 
767 template<class BasicJsonType, class CompatibleArrayType>
768 struct is_compatible_array_type
769 {
770  static auto constexpr value =
771  conjunction<negation<std::is_same<void, CompatibleArrayType>>,
772  negation<is_compatible_object_type<
773  BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>>,
774  negation<std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t,
775  CompatibleArrayType>>,
776  negation<is_basic_json_nested_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>>,
777  has_value_type<CompatibleArrayType>,
778  has_iterator<CompatibleArrayType>>::value;
779 };
780 
781 template<bool, typename, typename>
782 struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl : std::false_type {};
783 
784 template<typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
785 struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl<true, RealIntegerType, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
786 {
787  // is there an assert somewhere on overflows?
788  using RealLimits = std::numeric_limits<RealIntegerType>;
789  using CompatibleLimits = std::numeric_limits<CompatibleNumberIntegerType>;
790 
791  static constexpr auto value =
792  std::is_constructible<RealIntegerType, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value and
793  CompatibleLimits::is_integer and
794  RealLimits::is_signed == CompatibleLimits::is_signed;
795 };
796 
797 template<typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
798 struct is_compatible_integer_type
799 {
800  static constexpr auto value =
801  is_compatible_integer_type_impl <
802  std::is_integral<CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value and
803  not std::is_same<bool, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value,
804  RealIntegerType, CompatibleNumberIntegerType > ::value;
805 };
806 
807 
808 // trait checking if JSONSerializer<T>::from_json(json const&, udt&) exists
809 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
810 struct has_from_json
811 {
812  private:
813  // also check the return type of from_json
814  template<typename U, typename = enable_if_t<std::is_same<void, decltype(uncvref_t<U>::from_json(
815  std::declval<BasicJsonType>(), std::declval<T&>()))>::value>>
816  static int detect(U&&);
817  static void detect(...);
818 
819  public:
820  static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(
821  detect(std::declval<typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>>()))>::value;
822 };
823 
824 // This trait checks if JSONSerializer<T>::from_json(json const&) exists
825 // this overload is used for non-default-constructible user-defined-types
826 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
827 struct has_non_default_from_json
828 {
829  private:
830  template <
831  typename U,
832  typename = enable_if_t<std::is_same<
833  T, decltype(uncvref_t<U>::from_json(std::declval<BasicJsonType>()))>::value >>
834  static int detect(U&&);
835  static void detect(...);
836 
837  public:
838  static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(detect(
839  std::declval<typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>>()))>::value;
840 };
841 
842 // This trait checks if BasicJsonType::json_serializer<T>::to_json exists
843 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
844 struct has_to_json
845 {
846  private:
847  template<typename U, typename = decltype(uncvref_t<U>::to_json(
848  std::declval<BasicJsonType&>(), std::declval<T>()))>
849  static int detect(U&&);
850  static void detect(...);
851 
852  public:
853  static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(detect(
854  std::declval<typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>>()))>::value;
855 };
856 
857 
859 // to_json //
861 
862 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T, enable_if_t<
863  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value, int> = 0>
864 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, T b) noexcept
865 {
866  external_constructor<value_t::boolean>::construct(j, b);
867 }
868 
869 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleString,
870  enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t,
871  CompatibleString>::value, int> = 0>
872 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleString& s)
873 {
874  external_constructor<value_t::string>::construct(j, s);
875 }
876 
877 template <typename BasicJsonType>
878 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::string_t&& s)
879 {
880  external_constructor<value_t::string>::construct(j, std::move(s));
881 }
882 
883 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename FloatType,
884  enable_if_t<std::is_floating_point<FloatType>::value, int> = 0>
885 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, FloatType val) noexcept
886 {
887  external_constructor<value_t::number_float>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t>(val));
888 }
889 
890 template <
891  typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleNumberUnsignedType,
892  enable_if_t<is_compatible_integer_type<typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t,
893  CompatibleNumberUnsignedType>::value, int> = 0 >
894 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleNumberUnsignedType val) noexcept
895 {
896  external_constructor<value_t::number_unsigned>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t>(val));
897 }
898 
899 template <
900  typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType,
901  enable_if_t<is_compatible_integer_type<typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t,
902  CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value, int> = 0 >
903 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleNumberIntegerType val) noexcept
904 {
905  external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t>(val));
906 }
907 
908 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename EnumType,
909  enable_if_t<std::is_enum<EnumType>::value, int> = 0>
910 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, EnumType e) noexcept
911 {
912  using underlying_type = typename std::underlying_type<EnumType>::type;
913  external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>::construct(j, static_cast<underlying_type>(e));
914 }
915 
916 template<typename BasicJsonType>
917 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::vector<bool>& e)
918 {
919  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, e);
920 }
921 
922 template <
923  typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
924  enable_if_t <
925  is_compatible_array_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>::value or
926  std::is_same<typename BasicJsonType::array_t, CompatibleArrayType>::value,
927  int > = 0 >
928 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleArrayType& arr)
929 {
930  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, arr);
931 }
932 
933 template <typename BasicJsonType>
934 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t&& arr)
935 {
936  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, std::move(arr));
937 }
938 
939 template <
940  typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
941  enable_if_t<is_compatible_object_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleObjectType>::value,
942  int> = 0 >
943 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleObjectType& obj)
944 {
945  external_constructor<value_t::object>::construct(j, obj);
946 }
947 
948 template <typename BasicJsonType>
949 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::object_t&& obj)
950 {
951  external_constructor<value_t::object>::construct(j, std::move(obj));
952 }
953 
954 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T, std::size_t N,
955  enable_if_t<not std::is_constructible<
956  typename BasicJsonType::string_t, T (&)[N]>::value,
957  int> = 0>
958 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, T (&arr)[N])
959 {
960  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, arr);
961 }
962 
963 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename... Args>
964 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::pair<Args...>& p)
965 {
966  j = {p.first, p.second};
967 }
968 
969 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename Tuple, std::size_t... Idx>
970 void to_json_tuple_impl(BasicJsonType& j, const Tuple& t, index_sequence<Idx...>)
971 {
972  j = {std::get<Idx>(t)...};
973 }
974 
975 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename... Args>
976 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::tuple<Args...>& t)
977 {
978  to_json_tuple_impl(j, t, index_sequence_for<Args...> {});
979 }
980 
982 // from_json //
984 
985 // overloads for basic_json template parameters
986 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ArithmeticType,
987  enable_if_t<std::is_arithmetic<ArithmeticType>::value and
988  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType,
989  typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value,
990  int> = 0>
991 void get_arithmetic_value(const BasicJsonType& j, ArithmeticType& val)
992 {
993  switch (static_cast<value_t>(j))
994  {
995  case value_t::number_unsigned:
996  {
997  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t*>());
998  break;
999  }
1000  case value_t::number_integer:
1001  {
1002  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t*>());
1003  break;
1004  }
1005  case value_t::number_float:
1006  {
1007  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t*>());
1008  break;
1009  }
1010  default:
1011  {
1012  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be number, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1013  }
1014  }
1015 }
1016 
1017 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1018 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t& b)
1019 {
1020  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_boolean()))
1021  {
1022  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be boolean, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1023  }
1024  b = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t*>();
1025 }
1026 
1027 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1028 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::string_t& s)
1029 {
1030  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_string()))
1031  {
1032  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be string, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1033  }
1034  s = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::string_t*>();
1035 }
1036 
1037 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1038 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t& val)
1039 {
1040  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1041 }
1042 
1043 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1044 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t& val)
1045 {
1046  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1047 }
1048 
1049 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1050 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t& val)
1051 {
1052  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1053 }
1054 
1055 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename EnumType,
1056  enable_if_t<std::is_enum<EnumType>::value, int> = 0>
1057 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, EnumType& e)
1058 {
1059  typename std::underlying_type<EnumType>::type val;
1060  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1061  e = static_cast<EnumType>(val);
1062 }
1063 
1064 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1065 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t& arr)
1066 {
1067  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1068  {
1069  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1070  }
1071  arr = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::array_t*>();
1072 }
1073 
1074 // forward_list doesn't have an insert method
1075 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T, typename Allocator,
1076  enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<BasicJsonType, T>::value, int> = 0>
1077 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::forward_list<T, Allocator>& l)
1078 {
1079  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1080  {
1081  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1082  }
1083 
1084  for (auto it = j.rbegin(), end = j.rend(); it != end; ++it)
1085  {
1086  l.push_front(it->template get<T>());
1087  }
1088 }
1089 
1090 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType>
1091 void from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleArrayType& arr, priority_tag<0> /*unused*/)
1092 {
1093  using std::end;
1094 
1095  std::transform(j.begin(), j.end(),
1096  std::inserter(arr, end(arr)), [](const BasicJsonType & i)
1097  {
1098  // get<BasicJsonType>() returns *this, this won't call a from_json
1099  // method when value_type is BasicJsonType
1100  return i.template get<typename CompatibleArrayType::value_type>();
1101  });
1102 }
1103 
1104 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType>
1105 auto from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleArrayType& arr, priority_tag<1> /*unused*/)
1106 -> decltype(
1107  arr.reserve(std::declval<typename CompatibleArrayType::size_type>()),
1108  void())
1109 {
1110  using std::end;
1111 
1112  arr.reserve(j.size());
1113  std::transform(j.begin(), j.end(),
1114  std::inserter(arr, end(arr)), [](const BasicJsonType & i)
1115  {
1116  // get<BasicJsonType>() returns *this, this won't call a from_json
1117  // method when value_type is BasicJsonType
1118  return i.template get<typename CompatibleArrayType::value_type>();
1119  });
1120 }
1121 
1122 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T, std::size_t N>
1123 void from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, std::array<T, N>& arr, priority_tag<2> /*unused*/)
1124 {
1125  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < N; ++i)
1126  {
1127  arr[i] = j.at(i).template get<T>();
1128  }
1129 }
1130 
1131 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
1132  enable_if_t<is_compatible_array_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>::value and
1133  std::is_convertible<BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType::value_type>::value and
1134  not std::is_same<typename BasicJsonType::array_t, CompatibleArrayType>::value, int> = 0>
1135 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleArrayType& arr)
1136 {
1137  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1138  {
1139  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1140  }
1141 
1142  from_json_array_impl(j, arr, priority_tag<2> {});
1143 }
1144 
1145 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
1146  enable_if_t<is_compatible_object_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleObjectType>::value, int> = 0>
1147 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleObjectType& obj)
1148 {
1149  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_object()))
1150  {
1151  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be object, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1152  }
1153 
1154  auto inner_object = j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::object_t*>();
1155  using value_type = typename CompatibleObjectType::value_type;
1156  std::transform(
1157  inner_object->begin(), inner_object->end(),
1158  std::inserter(obj, obj.begin()),
1159  [](typename BasicJsonType::object_t::value_type const & p)
1160  {
1161  return value_type(p.first, p.second.template get<typename CompatibleObjectType::mapped_type>());
1162  });
1163 }
1164 
1165 // overload for arithmetic types, not chosen for basic_json template arguments
1166 // (BooleanType, etc..); note: Is it really necessary to provide explicit
1167 // overloads for boolean_t etc. in case of a custom BooleanType which is not
1168 // an arithmetic type?
1169 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ArithmeticType,
1170  enable_if_t <
1171  std::is_arithmetic<ArithmeticType>::value and
1172  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t>::value and
1173  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t>::value and
1174  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t>::value and
1175  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value,
1176  int> = 0>
1177 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, ArithmeticType& val)
1178 {
1179  switch (static_cast<value_t>(j))
1180  {
1181  case value_t::number_unsigned:
1182  {
1183  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t*>());
1184  break;
1185  }
1186  case value_t::number_integer:
1187  {
1188  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t*>());
1189  break;
1190  }
1191  case value_t::number_float:
1192  {
1193  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t*>());
1194  break;
1195  }
1196  case value_t::boolean:
1197  {
1198  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t*>());
1199  break;
1200  }
1201  default:
1202  {
1203  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be number, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1204  }
1205  }
1206 }
1207 
1208 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename... Args>
1209 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::pair<Args...>& p)
1210 {
1211  p = {j.at(0), j.at(1)};
1212 }
1213 
1214 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename Tuple, std::size_t... Idx>
1215 void from_json_tuple_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, Tuple& t, index_sequence<Idx...>)
1216 {
1217  t = std::make_tuple(j.at(Idx)...);
1218 }
1219 
1220 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename... Args>
1221 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::tuple<Args...>& t)
1222 {
1223  from_json_tuple_impl(j, t, index_sequence_for<Args...> {});
1224 }
1225 
1226 struct to_json_fn
1227 {
1228  private:
1229  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1230  auto call(BasicJsonType& j, T&& val, priority_tag<1> /*unused*/) const noexcept(noexcept(to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val))))
1231  -> decltype(to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val)), void())
1232  {
1233  return to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val));
1234  }
1235 
1236  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1237  void call(BasicJsonType& /*unused*/, T&& /*unused*/, priority_tag<0> /*unused*/) const noexcept
1238  {
1239  static_assert(sizeof(BasicJsonType) == 0,
1240  "could not find to_json() method in T's namespace");
1241  }
1242 
1243  public:
1244  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1245  void operator()(BasicJsonType& j, T&& val) const
1246  noexcept(noexcept(std::declval<to_json_fn>().call(j, std::forward<T>(val), priority_tag<1> {})))
1247  {
1248  return call(j, std::forward<T>(val), priority_tag<1> {});
1249  }
1250 };
1251 
1252 struct from_json_fn
1253 {
1254  private:
1255  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1256  auto call(const BasicJsonType& j, T& val, priority_tag<1> /*unused*/) const
1257  noexcept(noexcept(from_json(j, val)))
1258  -> decltype(from_json(j, val), void())
1259  {
1260  return from_json(j, val);
1261  }
1262 
1263  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1264  void call(const BasicJsonType& /*unused*/, T& /*unused*/, priority_tag<0> /*unused*/) const noexcept
1265  {
1266  static_assert(sizeof(BasicJsonType) == 0,
1267  "could not find from_json() method in T's namespace");
1268  }
1269 
1270  public:
1271  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1272  void operator()(const BasicJsonType& j, T& val) const
1273  noexcept(noexcept(std::declval<from_json_fn>().call(j, val, priority_tag<1> {})))
1274  {
1275  return call(j, val, priority_tag<1> {});
1276  }
1277 };
1278 
1279 // taken from ranges-v3
1280 template<typename T>
1281 struct static_const
1282 {
1283  static constexpr T value{};
1284 };
1285 
1286 template<typename T>
1287 constexpr T static_const<T>::value;
1288 
1290 // input adapters //
1292 
1294 struct input_adapter_protocol
1295 {
1296  virtual int get_character() = 0;
1297  virtual std::string read(std::size_t offset, std::size_t length) = 0;
1298  virtual ~input_adapter_protocol() = default;
1299 };
1300 
1302 using input_adapter_t = std::shared_ptr<input_adapter_protocol>;
1303 
1305 template<std::size_t BufferSize>
1306 class cached_input_stream_adapter : public input_adapter_protocol
1307 {
1308  public:
1309  explicit cached_input_stream_adapter(std::istream& i)
1310  : is(i), start_position(is.tellg())
1311  {
1312  fill_buffer();
1313 
1314  // skip byte order mark
1315  if (fill_size >= 3 and buffer[0] == '\xEF' and buffer[1] == '\xBB' and buffer[2] == '\xBF')
1316  {
1317  buffer_pos += 3;
1318  processed_chars += 3;
1319  }
1320  }
1321 
1322  ~cached_input_stream_adapter() override
1323  {
1324  // clear stream flags
1325  is.clear();
1326  // We initially read a lot of characters into the buffer, and we may
1327  // not have processed all of them. Therefore, we need to "rewind" the
1328  // stream after the last processed char.
1329  is.seekg(start_position);
1330  is.ignore(static_cast<std::streamsize>(processed_chars));
1331  // clear stream flags
1332  is.clear();
1333  }
1334 
1335  int get_character() override
1336  {
1337  // check if refilling is necessary and possible
1338  if (buffer_pos == fill_size and not eof)
1339  {
1340  fill_buffer();
1341 
1342  // check and remember that filling did not yield new input
1343  if (fill_size == 0)
1344  {
1345  eof = true;
1346  return std::char_traits<char>::eof();
1347  }
1348 
1349  // the buffer is ready
1350  buffer_pos = 0;
1351  }
1352 
1353  ++processed_chars;
1354  assert(buffer_pos < buffer.size());
1355  return buffer[buffer_pos++] & 0xFF;
1356  }
1357 
1358  std::string read(std::size_t offset, std::size_t length) override
1359  {
1360  // create buffer
1361  std::string result(length, '\0');
1362 
1363  // save stream position
1364  const auto current_pos = is.tellg();
1365  // save stream flags
1366  const auto flags = is.rdstate();
1367 
1368  // clear stream flags
1369  is.clear();
1370  // set stream position
1371  is.seekg(static_cast<std::streamoff>(offset));
1372  // read bytes
1373  is.read(&result[0], static_cast<std::streamsize>(length));
1374 
1375  // reset stream position
1376  is.seekg(current_pos);
1377  // reset stream flags
1378  is.setstate(flags);
1379 
1380  return result;
1381  }
1382 
1383  private:
1384  void fill_buffer()
1385  {
1386  // fill
1387  is.read(buffer.data(), static_cast<std::streamsize>(buffer.size()));
1388  // store number of bytes in the buffer
1389  fill_size = static_cast<size_t>(is.gcount());
1390  }
1391 
1393  std::istream& is;
1394 
1396  std::size_t processed_chars = 0;
1398  std::size_t buffer_pos = 0;
1399 
1401  bool eof = false;
1403  std::size_t fill_size = 0;
1404 
1406  const std::streampos start_position;
1407 
1409  std::array<char, BufferSize> buffer{{}};
1410 };
1411 
1413 class input_buffer_adapter : public input_adapter_protocol
1414 {
1415  public:
1416  input_buffer_adapter(const char* b, const std::size_t l)
1417  : cursor(b), limit(b + l), start(b)
1418  {
1419  // skip byte order mark
1420  if (l >= 3 and b[0] == '\xEF' and b[1] == '\xBB' and b[2] == '\xBF')
1421  {
1422  cursor += 3;
1423  }
1424  }
1425 
1426  // delete because of pointer members
1427  input_buffer_adapter(const input_buffer_adapter&) = delete;
1428  input_buffer_adapter& operator=(input_buffer_adapter&) = delete;
1429 
1430  int get_character() noexcept override
1431  {
1432  if (JSON_LIKELY(cursor < limit))
1433  {
1434  return *(cursor++) & 0xFF;
1435  }
1436 
1437  return std::char_traits<char>::eof();
1438  }
1439 
1440  std::string read(std::size_t offset, std::size_t length) override
1441  {
1442  // avoid reading too many characters
1443  const auto max_length = static_cast<size_t>(limit - start);
1444  return std::string(start + offset, (std::min)(length, max_length - offset));
1445  }
1446 
1447  private:
1449  const char* cursor;
1451  const char* limit;
1453  const char* start;
1454 };
1455 
1456 class input_adapter
1457 {
1458  public:
1459  // native support
1460 
1462  input_adapter(std::istream& i)
1463  : ia(std::make_shared<cached_input_stream_adapter<16384>>(i)) {}
1464 
1466  input_adapter(std::istream&& i)
1467  : ia(std::make_shared<cached_input_stream_adapter<16384>>(i)) {}
1468 
1470  template<typename CharT,
1471  typename std::enable_if<
1472  std::is_pointer<CharT>::value and
1473  std::is_integral<
1474  typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type>::value and
1475  sizeof(typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type) == 1,
1476  int>::type = 0>
1477  input_adapter(CharT b, std::size_t l)
1478  : ia(std::make_shared<input_buffer_adapter>(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b), l)) {}
1479 
1480  // derived support
1481 
1483  template<typename CharT,
1484  typename std::enable_if<
1485  std::is_pointer<CharT>::value and
1486  std::is_integral<
1487  typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type>::value and
1488  sizeof(typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type) == 1,
1489  int>::type = 0>
1490  input_adapter(CharT b)
1491  : input_adapter(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b),
1492  std::strlen(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b))) {}
1493 
1495  template<class IteratorType,
1496  typename std::enable_if<
1497  std::is_same<typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category,
1498  std::random_access_iterator_tag>::value,
1499  int>::type = 0>
1500  input_adapter(IteratorType first, IteratorType last)
1501  {
1502  // assertion to check that the iterator range is indeed contiguous,
1503  // see http://stackoverflow.com/a/35008842/266378 for more discussion
1504  assert(std::accumulate(
1505  first, last, std::pair<bool, int>(true, 0),
1506  [&first](std::pair<bool, int> res, decltype(*first) val)
1507  {
1508  res.first &= (val == *(std::next(std::addressof(*first), res.second++)));
1509  return res;
1510  }).first);
1511 
1512  // assertion to check that each element is 1 byte long
1513  static_assert(
1514  sizeof(typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::value_type) == 1,
1515  "each element in the iterator range must have the size of 1 byte");
1516 
1517  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(first, last));
1518  if (JSON_LIKELY(len > 0))
1519  {
1520  // there is at least one element: use the address of first
1521  ia = std::make_shared<input_buffer_adapter>(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(&(*first)), len);
1522  }
1523  else
1524  {
1525  // the address of first cannot be used: use nullptr
1526  ia = std::make_shared<input_buffer_adapter>(nullptr, len);
1527  }
1528  }
1529 
1531  template<class T, std::size_t N>
1532  input_adapter(T (&array)[N])
1533  : input_adapter(std::begin(array), std::end(array)) {}
1534 
1536  template <
1537  class ContiguousContainer,
1538  typename std::enable_if <
1539  not std::is_pointer<ContiguousContainer>::value and
1540  std::is_base_of<std::random_access_iterator_tag,
1541  typename std::iterator_traits<decltype(std::begin(std::declval<ContiguousContainer const>()))>::iterator_category>::value,
1542  int >::type = 0 >
1543  input_adapter(const ContiguousContainer& c)
1544  : input_adapter(std::begin(c), std::end(c)) {}
1545 
1546  operator input_adapter_t()
1547  {
1548  return ia;
1549  }
1550 
1551  private:
1553  input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
1554 };
1555 
1557 // lexer and parser //
1559 
1565 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1566 class lexer
1567 {
1568  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
1569  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
1570  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
1571 
1572  public:
1574  enum class token_type
1575  {
1576  uninitialized,
1577  literal_true,
1578  literal_false,
1579  literal_null,
1580  value_string,
1581  value_unsigned,
1582  value_integer,
1583  value_float,
1584  begin_array,
1585  begin_object,
1586  end_array,
1587  end_object,
1588  name_separator,
1589  value_separator,
1590  parse_error,
1591  end_of_input,
1592  literal_or_value
1593  };
1594 
1596  static const char* token_type_name(const token_type t) noexcept
1597  {
1598  switch (t)
1599  {
1600  case token_type::uninitialized:
1601  return "<uninitialized>";
1602  case token_type::literal_true:
1603  return "true literal";
1604  case token_type::literal_false:
1605  return "false literal";
1606  case token_type::literal_null:
1607  return "null literal";
1608  case token_type::value_string:
1609  return "string literal";
1610  case lexer::token_type::value_unsigned:
1611  case lexer::token_type::value_integer:
1612  case lexer::token_type::value_float:
1613  return "number literal";
1614  case token_type::begin_array:
1615  return "'['";
1616  case token_type::begin_object:
1617  return "'{'";
1618  case token_type::end_array:
1619  return "']'";
1620  case token_type::end_object:
1621  return "'}'";
1622  case token_type::name_separator:
1623  return "':'";
1624  case token_type::value_separator:
1625  return "','";
1626  case token_type::parse_error:
1627  return "<parse error>";
1628  case token_type::end_of_input:
1629  return "end of input";
1630  case token_type::literal_or_value:
1631  return "'[', '{', or a literal";
1632  default:
1633  {
1634  // catch non-enum values
1635  return "unknown token"; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
1636  }
1637  }
1638  }
1639 
1640  explicit lexer(detail::input_adapter_t adapter)
1641  : ia(adapter), decimal_point_char(get_decimal_point()) {}
1642 
1643  // delete because of pointer members
1644  lexer(const lexer&) = delete;
1645  lexer& operator=(lexer&) = delete;
1646 
1647  private:
1649  // locales
1651 
1653  static char get_decimal_point() noexcept
1654  {
1655  const auto loc = localeconv();
1656  assert(loc != nullptr);
1657  return (loc->decimal_point == nullptr) ? '.' : loc->decimal_point[0];
1658  }
1659 
1661  // scan functions
1663 
1679  int get_codepoint()
1680  {
1681  // this function only makes sense after reading `\u`
1682  assert(current == 'u');
1683  int codepoint = 0;
1684 
1685  for (int factor = 12; factor >= 0; factor -= 4)
1686  {
1687  get();
1688 
1689  if (current >= '0' and current <= '9')
1690  {
1691  codepoint += ((current - 0x30) << factor);
1692  }
1693  else if (current >= 'A' and current <= 'F')
1694  {
1695  codepoint += ((current - 0x37) << factor);
1696  }
1697  else if (current >= 'a' and current <= 'f')
1698  {
1699  codepoint += ((current - 0x57) << factor);
1700  }
1701  else
1702  {
1703  return -1;
1704  }
1705  }
1706 
1707  assert(0x0000 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0xFFFF);
1708  return codepoint;
1709  }
1710 
1720  bool next_byte_in_range(std::initializer_list<int> ranges)
1721  {
1722  assert(ranges.size() == 2 or ranges.size() == 4 or ranges.size() == 6);
1723  add(current);
1724 
1725  for (auto range = ranges.begin(); range != ranges.end(); ++range)
1726  {
1727  get();
1728  if (JSON_LIKELY(*range <= current and current <= *(++range)))
1729  {
1730  add(current);
1731  }
1732  else
1733  {
1734  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
1735  return false;
1736  }
1737  }
1738 
1739  return true;
1740  }
1741 
1756  token_type scan_string()
1757  {
1758  // reset yytext (ignore opening quote)
1759  reset();
1760 
1761  // we entered the function by reading an open quote
1762  assert(current == '\"');
1763 
1764  while (true)
1765  {
1766  // get next character
1767  switch (get())
1768  {
1769  // end of file while parsing string
1770  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
1771  {
1772  error_message = "invalid string: missing closing quote";
1773  return token_type::parse_error;
1774  }
1775 
1776  // closing quote
1777  case '\"':
1778  {
1779  // terminate yytext
1780  add('\0');
1781  --yylen;
1782  return token_type::value_string;
1783  }
1784 
1785  // escapes
1786  case '\\':
1787  {
1788  switch (get())
1789  {
1790  // quotation mark
1791  case '\"':
1792  add('\"');
1793  break;
1794  // reverse solidus
1795  case '\\':
1796  add('\\');
1797  break;
1798  // solidus
1799  case '/':
1800  add('/');
1801  break;
1802  // backspace
1803  case 'b':
1804  add('\b');
1805  break;
1806  // form feed
1807  case 'f':
1808  add('\f');
1809  break;
1810  // line feed
1811  case 'n':
1812  add('\n');
1813  break;
1814  // carriage return
1815  case 'r':
1816  add('\r');
1817  break;
1818  // tab
1819  case 't':
1820  add('\t');
1821  break;
1822 
1823  // unicode escapes
1824  case 'u':
1825  {
1826  int codepoint;
1827  const int codepoint1 = get_codepoint();
1828 
1829  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint1 == -1))
1830  {
1831  error_message = "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by 4 hex digits";
1832  return token_type::parse_error;
1833  }
1834 
1835  // check if code point is a high surrogate
1836  if (0xD800 <= codepoint1 and codepoint1 <= 0xDBFF)
1837  {
1838  // expect next \uxxxx entry
1839  if (JSON_LIKELY(get() == '\\' and get() == 'u'))
1840  {
1841  const int codepoint2 = get_codepoint();
1842 
1843  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint2 == -1))
1844  {
1845  error_message = "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by 4 hex digits";
1846  return token_type::parse_error;
1847  }
1848 
1849  // check if codepoint2 is a low surrogate
1850  if (JSON_LIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint2 and codepoint2 <= 0xDFFF))
1851  {
1852  codepoint =
1853  // high surrogate occupies the most significant 22 bits
1854  (codepoint1 << 10)
1855  // low surrogate occupies the least significant 15 bits
1856  + codepoint2
1857  // there is still the 0xD800, 0xDC00 and 0x10000 noise
1858  // in the result so we have to subtract with:
1859  // (0xD800 << 10) + DC00 - 0x10000 = 0x35FDC00
1860  - 0x35FDC00;
1861  }
1862  else
1863  {
1864  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF";
1865  return token_type::parse_error;
1866  }
1867  }
1868  else
1869  {
1870  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF";
1871  return token_type::parse_error;
1872  }
1873  }
1874  else
1875  {
1876  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint1 and codepoint1 <= 0xDFFF))
1877  {
1878  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must follow U+D800..U+DBFF";
1879  return token_type::parse_error;
1880  }
1881 
1882  // only work with first code point
1883  codepoint = codepoint1;
1884  }
1885 
1886  // result of the above calculation yields a proper codepoint
1887  assert(0x00 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0x10FFFF);
1888 
1889  // translate code point to bytes
1890  if (codepoint < 0x80)
1891  {
1892  // 1-byte characters: 0xxxxxxx (ASCII)
1893  add(codepoint);
1894  }
1895  else if (codepoint <= 0x7ff)
1896  {
1897  // 2-byte characters: 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx
1898  add(0xC0 | (codepoint >> 6));
1899  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
1900  }
1901  else if (codepoint <= 0xffff)
1902  {
1903  // 3-byte characters: 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
1904  add(0xE0 | (codepoint >> 12));
1905  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
1906  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
1907  }
1908  else
1909  {
1910  // 4-byte characters: 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
1911  add(0xF0 | (codepoint >> 18));
1912  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 12) & 0x3F));
1913  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
1914  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
1915  }
1916 
1917  break;
1918  }
1919 
1920  // other characters after escape
1921  default:
1922  error_message = "invalid string: forbidden character after backslash";
1923  return token_type::parse_error;
1924  }
1925 
1926  break;
1927  }
1928 
1929  // invalid control characters
1930  case 0x00:
1931  case 0x01:
1932  case 0x02:
1933  case 0x03:
1934  case 0x04:
1935  case 0x05:
1936  case 0x06:
1937  case 0x07:
1938  case 0x08:
1939  case 0x09:
1940  case 0x0a:
1941  case 0x0b:
1942  case 0x0c:
1943  case 0x0d:
1944  case 0x0e:
1945  case 0x0f:
1946  case 0x10:
1947  case 0x11:
1948  case 0x12:
1949  case 0x13:
1950  case 0x14:
1951  case 0x15:
1952  case 0x16:
1953  case 0x17:
1954  case 0x18:
1955  case 0x19:
1956  case 0x1a:
1957  case 0x1b:
1958  case 0x1c:
1959  case 0x1d:
1960  case 0x1e:
1961  case 0x1f:
1962  {
1963  error_message = "invalid string: control character must be escaped";
1964  return token_type::parse_error;
1965  }
1966 
1967  // U+0020..U+007F (except U+0022 (quote) and U+005C (backspace))
1968  case 0x20:
1969  case 0x21:
1970  case 0x23:
1971  case 0x24:
1972  case 0x25:
1973  case 0x26:
1974  case 0x27:
1975  case 0x28:
1976  case 0x29:
1977  case 0x2a:
1978  case 0x2b:
1979  case 0x2c:
1980  case 0x2d:
1981  case 0x2e:
1982  case 0x2f:
1983  case 0x30:
1984  case 0x31:
1985  case 0x32:
1986  case 0x33:
1987  case 0x34:
1988  case 0x35:
1989  case 0x36:
1990  case 0x37:
1991  case 0x38:
1992  case 0x39:
1993  case 0x3a:
1994  case 0x3b:
1995  case 0x3c:
1996  case 0x3d:
1997  case 0x3e:
1998  case 0x3f:
1999  case 0x40:
2000  case 0x41:
2001  case 0x42:
2002  case 0x43:
2003  case 0x44:
2004  case 0x45:
2005  case 0x46:
2006  case 0x47:
2007  case 0x48:
2008  case 0x49:
2009  case 0x4a:
2010  case 0x4b:
2011  case 0x4c:
2012  case 0x4d:
2013  case 0x4e:
2014  case 0x4f:
2015  case 0x50:
2016  case 0x51:
2017  case 0x52:
2018  case 0x53:
2019  case 0x54:
2020  case 0x55:
2021  case 0x56:
2022  case 0x57:
2023  case 0x58:
2024  case 0x59:
2025  case 0x5a:
2026  case 0x5b:
2027  case 0x5d:
2028  case 0x5e:
2029  case 0x5f:
2030  case 0x60:
2031  case 0x61:
2032  case 0x62:
2033  case 0x63:
2034  case 0x64:
2035  case 0x65:
2036  case 0x66:
2037  case 0x67:
2038  case 0x68:
2039  case 0x69:
2040  case 0x6a:
2041  case 0x6b:
2042  case 0x6c:
2043  case 0x6d:
2044  case 0x6e:
2045  case 0x6f:
2046  case 0x70:
2047  case 0x71:
2048  case 0x72:
2049  case 0x73:
2050  case 0x74:
2051  case 0x75:
2052  case 0x76:
2053  case 0x77:
2054  case 0x78:
2055  case 0x79:
2056  case 0x7a:
2057  case 0x7b:
2058  case 0x7c:
2059  case 0x7d:
2060  case 0x7e:
2061  case 0x7f:
2062  {
2063  add(current);
2064  break;
2065  }
2066 
2067  // U+0080..U+07FF: bytes C2..DF 80..BF
2068  case 0xc2:
2069  case 0xc3:
2070  case 0xc4:
2071  case 0xc5:
2072  case 0xc6:
2073  case 0xc7:
2074  case 0xc8:
2075  case 0xc9:
2076  case 0xca:
2077  case 0xcb:
2078  case 0xcc:
2079  case 0xcd:
2080  case 0xce:
2081  case 0xcf:
2082  case 0xd0:
2083  case 0xd1:
2084  case 0xd2:
2085  case 0xd3:
2086  case 0xd4:
2087  case 0xd5:
2088  case 0xd6:
2089  case 0xd7:
2090  case 0xd8:
2091  case 0xd9:
2092  case 0xda:
2093  case 0xdb:
2094  case 0xdc:
2095  case 0xdd:
2096  case 0xde:
2097  case 0xdf:
2098  {
2099  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0xBF})))
2100  {
2101  return token_type::parse_error;
2102  }
2103  break;
2104  }
2105 
2106  // U+0800..U+0FFF: bytes E0 A0..BF 80..BF
2107  case 0xe0:
2108  {
2109  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0xA0, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
2110  {
2111  return token_type::parse_error;
2112  }
2113  break;
2114  }
2115 
2116  // U+1000..U+CFFF: bytes E1..EC 80..BF 80..BF
2117  // U+E000..U+FFFF: bytes EE..EF 80..BF 80..BF
2118  case 0xe1:
2119  case 0xe2:
2120  case 0xe3:
2121  case 0xe4:
2122  case 0xe5:
2123  case 0xe6:
2124  case 0xe7:
2125  case 0xe8:
2126  case 0xe9:
2127  case 0xea:
2128  case 0xeb:
2129  case 0xec:
2130  case 0xee:
2131  case 0xef:
2132  {
2133  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
2134  {
2135  return token_type::parse_error;
2136  }
2137  break;
2138  }
2139 
2140  // U+D000..U+D7FF: bytes ED 80..9F 80..BF
2141  case 0xed:
2142  {
2143  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0x9F, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
2144  {
2145  return token_type::parse_error;
2146  }
2147  break;
2148  }
2149 
2150  // U+10000..U+3FFFF F0 90..BF 80..BF 80..BF
2151  case 0xf0:
2152  {
2153  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x90, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
2154  {
2155  return token_type::parse_error;
2156  }
2157  break;
2158  }
2159 
2160  // U+40000..U+FFFFF F1..F3 80..BF 80..BF 80..BF
2161  case 0xf1:
2162  case 0xf2:
2163  case 0xf3:
2164  {
2165  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
2166  {
2167  return token_type::parse_error;
2168  }
2169  break;
2170  }
2171 
2172  // U+100000..U+10FFFF F4 80..8F 80..BF 80..BF
2173  case 0xf4:
2174  {
2175  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0x8F, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
2176  {
2177  return token_type::parse_error;
2178  }
2179  break;
2180  }
2181 
2182  // remaining bytes (80..C1 and F5..FF) are ill-formed
2183  default:
2184  {
2185  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
2186  return token_type::parse_error;
2187  }
2188  }
2189  }
2190  }
2191 
2192  static void strtof(float& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
2193  {
2194  f = std::strtof(str, endptr);
2195  }
2196 
2197  static void strtof(double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
2198  {
2199  f = std::strtod(str, endptr);
2200  }
2201 
2202  static void strtof(long double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
2203  {
2204  f = std::strtold(str, endptr);
2205  }
2206 
2247  token_type scan_number()
2248  {
2249  // reset yytext to store the number's bytes
2250  reset();
2251 
2252  // the type of the parsed number; initially set to unsigned; will be
2253  // changed if minus sign, decimal point or exponent is read
2254  token_type number_type = token_type::value_unsigned;
2255 
2256  // state (init): we just found out we need to scan a number
2257  switch (current)
2258  {
2259  case '-':
2260  {
2261  add(current);
2262  goto scan_number_minus;
2263  }
2264 
2265  case '0':
2266  {
2267  add(current);
2268  goto scan_number_zero;
2269  }
2270 
2271  case '1':
2272  case '2':
2273  case '3':
2274  case '4':
2275  case '5':
2276  case '6':
2277  case '7':
2278  case '8':
2279  case '9':
2280  {
2281  add(current);
2282  goto scan_number_any1;
2283  }
2284 
2285  default:
2286  {
2287  // all other characters are rejected outside scan_number()
2288  assert(false); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
2289  }
2290  }
2291 
2292 scan_number_minus:
2293  // state: we just parsed a leading minus sign
2294  number_type = token_type::value_integer;
2295  switch (get())
2296  {
2297  case '0':
2298  {
2299  add(current);
2300  goto scan_number_zero;
2301  }
2302 
2303  case '1':
2304  case '2':
2305  case '3':
2306  case '4':
2307  case '5':
2308  case '6':
2309  case '7':
2310  case '8':
2311  case '9':
2312  {
2313  add(current);
2314  goto scan_number_any1;
2315  }
2316 
2317  default:
2318  {
2319  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '-'";
2320  return token_type::parse_error;
2321  }
2322  }
2323 
2324 scan_number_zero:
2325  // state: we just parse a zero (maybe with a leading minus sign)
2326  switch (get())
2327  {
2328  case '.':
2329  {
2330  add(decimal_point_char);
2331  goto scan_number_decimal1;
2332  }
2333 
2334  case 'e':
2335  case 'E':
2336  {
2337  add(current);
2338  goto scan_number_exponent;
2339  }
2340 
2341  default:
2342  {
2343  goto scan_number_done;
2344  }
2345  }
2346 
2347 scan_number_any1:
2348  // state: we just parsed a number 0-9 (maybe with a leading minus sign)
2349  switch (get())
2350  {
2351  case '0':
2352  case '1':
2353  case '2':
2354  case '3':
2355  case '4':
2356  case '5':
2357  case '6':
2358  case '7':
2359  case '8':
2360  case '9':
2361  {
2362  add(current);
2363  goto scan_number_any1;
2364  }
2365 
2366  case '.':
2367  {
2368  add(decimal_point_char);
2369  goto scan_number_decimal1;
2370  }
2371 
2372  case 'e':
2373  case 'E':
2374  {
2375  add(current);
2376  goto scan_number_exponent;
2377  }
2378 
2379  default:
2380  {
2381  goto scan_number_done;
2382  }
2383  }
2384 
2385 scan_number_decimal1:
2386  // state: we just parsed a decimal point
2387  number_type = token_type::value_float;
2388  switch (get())
2389  {
2390  case '0':
2391  case '1':
2392  case '2':
2393  case '3':
2394  case '4':
2395  case '5':
2396  case '6':
2397  case '7':
2398  case '8':
2399  case '9':
2400  {
2401  add(current);
2402  goto scan_number_decimal2;
2403  }
2404 
2405  default:
2406  {
2407  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '.'";
2408  return token_type::parse_error;
2409  }
2410  }
2411 
2412 scan_number_decimal2:
2413  // we just parsed at least one number after a decimal point
2414  switch (get())
2415  {
2416  case '0':
2417  case '1':
2418  case '2':
2419  case '3':
2420  case '4':
2421  case '5':
2422  case '6':
2423  case '7':
2424  case '8':
2425  case '9':
2426  {
2427  add(current);
2428  goto scan_number_decimal2;
2429  }
2430 
2431  case 'e':
2432  case 'E':
2433  {
2434  add(current);
2435  goto scan_number_exponent;
2436  }
2437 
2438  default:
2439  {
2440  goto scan_number_done;
2441  }
2442  }
2443 
2444 scan_number_exponent:
2445  // we just parsed an exponent
2446  number_type = token_type::value_float;
2447  switch (get())
2448  {
2449  case '+':
2450  case '-':
2451  {
2452  add(current);
2453  goto scan_number_sign;
2454  }
2455 
2456  case '0':
2457  case '1':
2458  case '2':
2459  case '3':
2460  case '4':
2461  case '5':
2462  case '6':
2463  case '7':
2464  case '8':
2465  case '9':
2466  {
2467  add(current);
2468  goto scan_number_any2;
2469  }
2470 
2471  default:
2472  {
2473  error_message =
2474  "invalid number; expected '+', '-', or digit after exponent";
2475  return token_type::parse_error;
2476  }
2477  }
2478 
2479 scan_number_sign:
2480  // we just parsed an exponent sign
2481  switch (get())
2482  {
2483  case '0':
2484  case '1':
2485  case '2':
2486  case '3':
2487  case '4':
2488  case '5':
2489  case '6':
2490  case '7':
2491  case '8':
2492  case '9':
2493  {
2494  add(current);
2495  goto scan_number_any2;
2496  }
2497 
2498  default:
2499  {
2500  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after exponent sign";
2501  return token_type::parse_error;
2502  }
2503  }
2504 
2505 scan_number_any2:
2506  // we just parsed a number after the exponent or exponent sign
2507  switch (get())
2508  {
2509  case '0':
2510  case '1':
2511  case '2':
2512  case '3':
2513  case '4':
2514  case '5':
2515  case '6':
2516  case '7':
2517  case '8':
2518  case '9':
2519  {
2520  add(current);
2521  goto scan_number_any2;
2522  }
2523 
2524  default:
2525  {
2526  goto scan_number_done;
2527  }
2528  }
2529 
2530 scan_number_done:
2531  // unget the character after the number (we only read it to know that
2532  // we are done scanning a number)
2533  --chars_read;
2534  next_unget = true;
2535 
2536  // terminate token
2537  add('\0');
2538  --yylen;
2539 
2540  // try to parse integers first and fall back to floats
2541  if (number_type == token_type::value_unsigned)
2542  {
2543  char* endptr = nullptr;
2544  errno = 0;
2545  const auto x = std::strtoull(yytext.data(), &endptr, 10);
2546 
2547  // we checked the number format before
2548  assert(endptr == yytext.data() + yylen);
2549 
2550  if (errno == 0)
2551  {
2552  value_unsigned = static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(x);
2553  if (value_unsigned == x)
2554  {
2555  return token_type::value_unsigned;
2556  }
2557  }
2558  }
2559  else if (number_type == token_type::value_integer)
2560  {
2561  char* endptr = nullptr;
2562  errno = 0;
2563  const auto x = std::strtoll(yytext.data(), &endptr, 10);
2564 
2565  // we checked the number format before
2566  assert(endptr == yytext.data() + yylen);
2567 
2568  if (errno == 0)
2569  {
2570  value_integer = static_cast<number_integer_t>(x);
2571  if (value_integer == x)
2572  {
2573  return token_type::value_integer;
2574  }
2575  }
2576  }
2577 
2578  // this code is reached if we parse a floating-point number or if an
2579  // integer conversion above failed
2580  strtof(value_float, yytext.data(), nullptr);
2581  return token_type::value_float;
2582  }
2583 
2589  token_type scan_literal(const char* literal_text, const std::size_t length,
2590  token_type return_type)
2591  {
2592  assert(current == literal_text[0]);
2593  for (std::size_t i = 1; i < length; ++i)
2594  {
2595  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(get() != literal_text[i]))
2596  {
2597  error_message = "invalid literal";
2598  return token_type::parse_error;
2599  }
2600  }
2601  return return_type;
2602  }
2603 
2605  // input management
2607 
2609  void reset() noexcept
2610  {
2611  yylen = 0;
2612  start_pos = chars_read - 1;
2613  }
2614 
2616  int get()
2617  {
2618  ++chars_read;
2619  return next_unget ? (next_unget = false, current)
2620  : (current = ia->get_character());
2621  }
2622 
2624  void add(int c)
2625  {
2626  // resize yytext if necessary; this condition is deemed unlikely,
2627  // because we start with a 1024-byte buffer
2628  if (JSON_UNLIKELY((yylen + 1 > yytext.capacity())))
2629  {
2630  yytext.resize(2 * yytext.capacity(), '\0');
2631  }
2632  assert(yylen < yytext.size());
2633  yytext[yylen++] = static_cast<char>(c);
2634  }
2635 
2636  public:
2638  // value getters
2640 
2642  constexpr number_integer_t get_number_integer() const noexcept
2643  {
2644  return value_integer;
2645  }
2646 
2648  constexpr number_unsigned_t get_number_unsigned() const noexcept
2649  {
2650  return value_unsigned;
2651  }
2652 
2654  constexpr number_float_t get_number_float() const noexcept
2655  {
2656  return value_float;
2657  }
2658 
2660  const std::string get_string()
2661  {
2662  // yytext cannot be returned as char*, because it may contain a null
2663  // byte (parsed as "\u0000")
2664  return std::string(yytext.data(), yylen);
2665  }
2666 
2668  // diagnostics
2670 
2672  constexpr std::size_t get_position() const noexcept
2673  {
2674  return chars_read;
2675  }
2676 
2678  std::string get_token_string() const
2679  {
2680  // get the raw byte sequence of the last token
2681  std::string s = ia->read(start_pos, chars_read - start_pos);
2682 
2683  // escape control characters
2684  std::string result;
2685  for (auto c : s)
2686  {
2687  if (c == '\0' or c == std::char_traits<char>::eof())
2688  {
2689  // ignore EOF
2690  continue;
2691  }
2692  else if ('\x00' <= c and c <= '\x1f')
2693  {
2694  // escape control characters
2695  std::stringstream ss;
2696  ss << "<U+" << std::setw(4) << std::uppercase << std::setfill('0')
2697  << std::hex << static_cast<int>(c) << ">";
2698  result += ss.str();
2699  }
2700  else
2701  {
2702  // add character as is
2703  result.append(1, c);
2704  }
2705  }
2706 
2707  return result;
2708  }
2709 
2711  constexpr const char* get_error_message() const noexcept
2712  {
2713  return error_message;
2714  }
2715 
2717  // actual scanner
2719 
2720  token_type scan()
2721  {
2722  // read next character and ignore whitespace
2723  do
2724  {
2725  get();
2726  }
2727  while (current == ' ' or current == '\t' or current == '\n' or current == '\r');
2728 
2729  switch (current)
2730  {
2731  // structural characters
2732  case '[':
2733  return token_type::begin_array;
2734  case ']':
2735  return token_type::end_array;
2736  case '{':
2737  return token_type::begin_object;
2738  case '}':
2739  return token_type::end_object;
2740  case ':':
2741  return token_type::name_separator;
2742  case ',':
2743  return token_type::value_separator;
2744 
2745  // literals
2746  case 't':
2747  return scan_literal("true", 4, token_type::literal_true);
2748  case 'f':
2749  return scan_literal("false", 5, token_type::literal_false);
2750  case 'n':
2751  return scan_literal("null", 4, token_type::literal_null);
2752 
2753  // string
2754  case '\"':
2755  return scan_string();
2756 
2757  // number
2758  case '-':
2759  case '0':
2760  case '1':
2761  case '2':
2762  case '3':
2763  case '4':
2764  case '5':
2765  case '6':
2766  case '7':
2767  case '8':
2768  case '9':
2769  return scan_number();
2770 
2771  // end of input (the null byte is needed when parsing from
2772  // string literals)
2773  case '\0':
2774  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
2775  return token_type::end_of_input;
2776 
2777  // error
2778  default:
2779  error_message = "invalid literal";
2780  return token_type::parse_error;
2781  }
2782  }
2783 
2784  private:
2786  detail::input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
2787 
2789  int current = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
2790 
2792  bool next_unget = false;
2793 
2795  std::size_t chars_read = 0;
2797  std::size_t start_pos = 0;
2798 
2800  std::vector<char> yytext = std::vector<char>(1024, '\0');
2802  std::size_t yylen = 0;
2803 
2805  const char* error_message = "";
2806 
2807  // number values
2808  number_integer_t value_integer = 0;
2809  number_unsigned_t value_unsigned = 0;
2810  number_float_t value_float = 0;
2811 
2813  const char decimal_point_char = '.';
2814 };
2815 
2821 template<typename BasicJsonType>
2822 class parser
2823 {
2824  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
2825  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
2826  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
2827  using lexer_t = lexer<BasicJsonType>;
2828  using token_type = typename lexer_t::token_type;
2829 
2830  public:
2831  enum class parse_event_t : uint8_t
2832  {
2834  object_start,
2836  object_end,
2838  array_start,
2840  array_end,
2842  key,
2844  value
2845  };
2846 
2847  using parser_callback_t =
2848  std::function<bool(int depth, parse_event_t event, BasicJsonType& parsed)>;
2849 
2851  explicit parser(detail::input_adapter_t adapter,
2852  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
2853  const bool allow_exceptions_ = true)
2854  : callback(cb), m_lexer(adapter),
2855  allow_exceptions(allow_exceptions_)
2856  {}
2857 
2868  void parse(const bool strict, BasicJsonType& result)
2869  {
2870  // read first token
2871  get_token();
2872 
2873  parse_internal(true, result);
2874  result.assert_invariant();
2875 
2876  // in strict mode, input must be completely read
2877  if (strict)
2878  {
2879  get_token();
2880  expect(token_type::end_of_input);
2881  }
2882 
2883  // in case of an error, return discarded value
2884  if (errored)
2885  {
2886  result = value_t::discarded;
2887  return;
2888  }
2889 
2890  // set top-level value to null if it was discarded by the callback
2891  // function
2892  if (result.is_discarded())
2893  {
2894  result = nullptr;
2895  }
2896  }
2897 
2904  bool accept(const bool strict = true)
2905  {
2906  // read first token
2907  get_token();
2908 
2909  if (not accept_internal())
2910  {
2911  return false;
2912  }
2913 
2914  if (strict and get_token() != token_type::end_of_input)
2915  {
2916  return false;
2917  }
2918 
2919  return true;
2920  }
2921 
2922  private:
2929  void parse_internal(bool keep, BasicJsonType& result)
2930  {
2931  // never parse after a parse error was detected
2932  assert(not errored);
2933 
2934  // start with a discarded value
2935  if (not result.is_discarded())
2936  {
2937  result.m_value.destroy(result.m_type);
2938  result.m_type = value_t::discarded;
2939  }
2940 
2941  switch (last_token)
2942  {
2943  case token_type::begin_object:
2944  {
2945  if (keep and (not callback or ((keep = callback(depth++, parse_event_t::object_start, result)))))
2946  {
2947  // explicitly set result to object to cope with {}
2948  result.m_type = value_t::object;
2949  result.m_value = value_t::object;
2950  }
2951 
2952  // read next token
2953  get_token();
2954 
2955  // closing } -> we are done
2956  if (last_token == token_type::end_object)
2957  {
2958  if (keep and callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::object_end, result))
2959  {
2960  result.m_value.destroy(result.m_type);
2961  result.m_type = value_t::discarded;
2962  }
2963  break;
2964  }
2965 
2966  // parse values
2967  std::string key;
2968  BasicJsonType value;
2969  while (true)
2970  {
2971  // store key
2972  if (not expect(token_type::value_string))
2973  {
2974  return;
2975  }
2976  key = m_lexer.get_string();
2977 
2978  bool keep_tag = false;
2979  if (keep)
2980  {
2981  if (callback)
2982  {
2983  BasicJsonType k(key);
2984  keep_tag = callback(depth, parse_event_t::key, k);
2985  }
2986  else
2987  {
2988  keep_tag = true;
2989  }
2990  }
2991 
2992  // parse separator (:)
2993  get_token();
2994  if (not expect(token_type::name_separator))
2995  {
2996  return;
2997  }
2998 
2999  // parse and add value
3000  get_token();
3001  value.m_value.destroy(value.m_type);
3002  value.m_type = value_t::discarded;
3003  parse_internal(keep, value);
3004 
3005  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(errored))
3006  {
3007  return;
3008  }
3009 
3010  if (keep and keep_tag and not value.is_discarded())
3011  {
3012  result.m_value.object->emplace(std::move(key), std::move(value));
3013  }
3014 
3015  // comma -> next value
3016  get_token();
3017  if (last_token == token_type::value_separator)
3018  {
3019  get_token();
3020  continue;
3021  }
3022 
3023  // closing }
3024  if (not expect(token_type::end_object))
3025  {
3026  return;
3027  }
3028  break;
3029  }
3030 
3031  if (keep and callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::object_end, result))
3032  {
3033  result.m_value.destroy(result.m_type);
3034  result.m_type = value_t::discarded;
3035  }
3036  break;
3037  }
3038 
3039  case token_type::begin_array:
3040  {
3041  if (keep and (not callback or ((keep = callback(depth++, parse_event_t::array_start, result)))))
3042  {
3043  // explicitly set result to object to cope with []
3044  result.m_type = value_t::array;
3045  result.m_value = value_t::array;
3046  }
3047 
3048  // read next token
3049  get_token();
3050 
3051  // closing ] -> we are done
3052  if (last_token == token_type::end_array)
3053  {
3054  if (callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::array_end, result))
3055  {
3056  result.m_value.destroy(result.m_type);
3057  result.m_type = value_t::discarded;
3058  }
3059  break;
3060  }
3061 
3062  // parse values
3063  BasicJsonType value;
3064  while (true)
3065  {
3066  // parse value
3067  value.m_value.destroy(value.m_type);
3068  value.m_type = value_t::discarded;
3069  parse_internal(keep, value);
3070 
3071  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(errored))
3072  {
3073  return;
3074  }
3075 
3076  if (keep and not value.is_discarded())
3077  {
3078  result.m_value.array->push_back(std::move(value));
3079  }
3080 
3081  // comma -> next value
3082  get_token();
3083  if (last_token == token_type::value_separator)
3084  {
3085  get_token();
3086  continue;
3087  }
3088 
3089  // closing ]
3090  if (not expect(token_type::end_array))
3091  {
3092  return;
3093  }
3094  break;
3095  }
3096 
3097  if (keep and callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::array_end, result))
3098  {
3099  result.m_value.destroy(result.m_type);
3100  result.m_type = value_t::discarded;
3101  }
3102  break;
3103  }
3104 
3105  case token_type::literal_null:
3106  {
3107  result.m_type = value_t::null;
3108  break;
3109  }
3110 
3111  case token_type::value_string:
3112  {
3113  result.m_type = value_t::string;
3114  result.m_value = m_lexer.get_string();
3115  break;
3116  }
3117 
3118  case token_type::literal_true:
3119  {
3120  result.m_type = value_t::boolean;
3121  result.m_value = true;
3122  break;
3123  }
3124 
3125  case token_type::literal_false:
3126  {
3127  result.m_type = value_t::boolean;
3128  result.m_value = false;
3129  break;
3130  }
3131 
3132  case token_type::value_unsigned:
3133  {
3134  result.m_type = value_t::number_unsigned;
3135  result.m_value = m_lexer.get_number_unsigned();
3136  break;
3137  }
3138 
3139  case token_type::value_integer:
3140  {
3141  result.m_type = value_t::number_integer;
3142  result.m_value = m_lexer.get_number_integer();
3143  break;
3144  }
3145 
3146  case token_type::value_float:
3147  {
3148  result.m_type = value_t::number_float;
3149  result.m_value = m_lexer.get_number_float();
3150 
3151  // throw in case of infinity or NAN
3152  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not std::isfinite(result.m_value.number_float)))
3153  {
3154  if (allow_exceptions)
3155  {
3156  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(406, "number overflow parsing '" +
3157  m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'"));
3158  }
3159  else
3160  {
3161  expect(token_type::uninitialized);
3162  }
3163  }
3164  break;
3165  }
3166 
3167  case token_type::parse_error:
3168  {
3169  // using "uninitialized" to avoid "expected" message
3170  if (not expect(token_type::uninitialized))
3171  {
3172  return;
3173  }
3174  break; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
3175  }
3176 
3177  default:
3178  {
3179  // the last token was unexpected; we expected a value
3180  if (not expect(token_type::literal_or_value))
3181  {
3182  return;
3183  }
3184  break; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
3185  }
3186  }
3187 
3188  if (keep and callback and not callback(depth, parse_event_t::value, result))
3189  {
3190  result.m_type = value_t::discarded;
3191  }
3192  }
3193 
3204  bool accept_internal()
3205  {
3206  switch (last_token)
3207  {
3208  case token_type::begin_object:
3209  {
3210  // read next token
3211  get_token();
3212 
3213  // closing } -> we are done
3214  if (last_token == token_type::end_object)
3215  {
3216  return true;
3217  }
3218 
3219  // parse values
3220  while (true)
3221  {
3222  // parse key
3223  if (last_token != token_type::value_string)
3224  {
3225  return false;
3226  }
3227 
3228  // parse separator (:)
3229  get_token();
3230  if (last_token != token_type::name_separator)
3231  {
3232  return false;
3233  }
3234 
3235  // parse value
3236  get_token();
3237  if (not accept_internal())
3238  {
3239  return false;
3240  }
3241 
3242  // comma -> next value
3243  get_token();
3244  if (last_token == token_type::value_separator)
3245  {
3246  get_token();
3247  continue;
3248  }
3249 
3250  // closing }
3251  return (last_token == token_type::end_object);
3252  }
3253  }
3254 
3255  case token_type::begin_array:
3256  {
3257  // read next token
3258  get_token();
3259 
3260  // closing ] -> we are done
3261  if (last_token == token_type::end_array)
3262  {
3263  return true;
3264  }
3265 
3266  // parse values
3267  while (true)
3268  {
3269  // parse value
3270  if (not accept_internal())
3271  {
3272  return false;
3273  }
3274 
3275  // comma -> next value
3276  get_token();
3277  if (last_token == token_type::value_separator)
3278  {
3279  get_token();
3280  continue;
3281  }
3282 
3283  // closing ]
3284  return (last_token == token_type::end_array);
3285  }
3286  }
3287 
3288  case token_type::value_float:
3289  {
3290  // reject infinity or NAN
3291  return std::isfinite(m_lexer.get_number_float());
3292  }
3293 
3294  case token_type::literal_false:
3295  case token_type::literal_null:
3296  case token_type::literal_true:
3297  case token_type::value_integer:
3298  case token_type::value_string:
3299  case token_type::value_unsigned:
3300  {
3301  return true;
3302  }
3303 
3304  default:
3305  {
3306  // the last token was unexpected
3307  return false;
3308  }
3309  }
3310  }
3311 
3313  token_type get_token()
3314  {
3315  return (last_token = m_lexer.scan());
3316  }
3317 
3321  bool expect(token_type t)
3322  {
3323  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(t != last_token))
3324  {
3325  errored = true;
3326  expected = t;
3327  if (allow_exceptions)
3328  {
3329  throw_exception();
3330  }
3331  else
3332  {
3333  return false;
3334  }
3335  }
3336 
3337  return true;
3338  }
3339 
3340  [[noreturn]] void throw_exception() const
3341  {
3342  std::string error_msg = "syntax error - ";
3343  if (last_token == token_type::parse_error)
3344  {
3345  error_msg += std::string(m_lexer.get_error_message()) + "; last read: '" +
3346  m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'";
3347  }
3348  else
3349  {
3350  error_msg += "unexpected " + std::string(lexer_t::token_type_name(last_token));
3351  }
3352 
3353  if (expected != token_type::uninitialized)
3354  {
3355  error_msg += "; expected " + std::string(lexer_t::token_type_name(expected));
3356  }
3357 
3358  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(), error_msg));
3359  }
3360 
3361  private:
