3363  int depth = 0;
3365  const parser_callback_t callback = nullptr;
3367  token_type last_token = token_type::uninitialized;
3369  lexer_t m_lexer;
3371  bool errored = false;
3373  token_type expected = token_type::uninitialized;
3375  const bool allow_exceptions = true;
3376 };
3377 
3379 // iterators //
3381 
3391 class primitive_iterator_t
3392 {
3393  public:
3394  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
3395 
3396  constexpr difference_type get_value() const noexcept
3397  {
3398  return m_it;
3399  }
3400 
3402  void set_begin() noexcept
3403  {
3404  m_it = begin_value;
3405  }
3406 
3408  void set_end() noexcept
3409  {
3410  m_it = end_value;
3411  }
3412 
3414  constexpr bool is_begin() const noexcept
3415  {
3416  return (m_it == begin_value);
3417  }
3418 
3420  constexpr bool is_end() const noexcept
3421  {
3422  return (m_it == end_value);
3423  }
3424 
3425  friend constexpr bool operator==(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
3426  {
3427  return (lhs.m_it == rhs.m_it);
3428  }
3429 
3430  friend constexpr bool operator!=(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
3431  {
3432  return not(lhs == rhs);
3433  }
3434 
3435  friend constexpr bool operator<(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
3436  {
3437  return lhs.m_it < rhs.m_it;
3438  }
3439 
3440  friend constexpr bool operator<=(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
3441  {
3442  return lhs.m_it <= rhs.m_it;
3443  }
3444 
3445  friend constexpr bool operator>(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
3446  {
3447  return lhs.m_it > rhs.m_it;
3448  }
3449 
3450  friend constexpr bool operator>=(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
3451  {
3452  return lhs.m_it >= rhs.m_it;
3453  }
3454 
3455  primitive_iterator_t operator+(difference_type i)
3456  {
3457  auto result = *this;
3458  result += i;
3459  return result;
3460  }
3461 
3462  friend constexpr difference_type operator-(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
3463  {
3464  return lhs.m_it - rhs.m_it;
3465  }
3466 
3467  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, primitive_iterator_t it)
3468  {
3469  return os << it.m_it;
3470  }
3471 
3472  primitive_iterator_t& operator++()
3473  {
3474  ++m_it;
3475  return *this;
3476  }
3477 
3478  primitive_iterator_t operator++(int)
3479  {
3480  auto result = *this;
3481  m_it++;
3482  return result;
3483  }
3484 
3485  primitive_iterator_t& operator--()
3486  {
3487  --m_it;
3488  return *this;
3489  }
3490 
3491  primitive_iterator_t operator--(int)
3492  {
3493  auto result = *this;
3494  m_it--;
3495  return result;
3496  }
3497 
3498  primitive_iterator_t& operator+=(difference_type n)
3499  {
3500  m_it += n;
3501  return *this;
3502  }
3503 
3504  primitive_iterator_t& operator-=(difference_type n)
3505  {
3506  m_it -= n;
3507  return *this;
3508  }
3509 
3510  private:
3511  static constexpr difference_type begin_value = 0;
3512  static constexpr difference_type end_value = begin_value + 1;
3513 
3515  difference_type m_it = std::numeric_limits<std::ptrdiff_t>::denorm_min();
3516 };
3517 
3524 template<typename BasicJsonType> struct internal_iterator
3525 {
3527  typename BasicJsonType::object_t::iterator object_iterator {};
3529  typename BasicJsonType::array_t::iterator array_iterator {};
3531  primitive_iterator_t primitive_iterator {};
3532 };
3533 
3534 template<typename IteratorType> class iteration_proxy;
3535 
3555 template<typename BasicJsonType>
3556 class iter_impl : public std::iterator<std::random_access_iterator_tag, BasicJsonType>
3557 {
3559  friend iter_impl<typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value, typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type, const BasicJsonType>::type>;
3560  friend BasicJsonType;
3561  friend iteration_proxy<iter_impl>;
3562 
3563  using object_t = typename BasicJsonType::object_t;
3564  using array_t = typename BasicJsonType::array_t;
3565  // make sure BasicJsonType is basic_json or const basic_json
3566  static_assert(is_basic_json<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>::value,
3567  "iter_impl only accepts (const) basic_json");
3568 
3569  public:
3571  using value_type = typename BasicJsonType::value_type;
3573  using difference_type = typename BasicJsonType::difference_type;
3575  using pointer = typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value,
3576  typename BasicJsonType::const_pointer,
3577  typename BasicJsonType::pointer>::type;
3579  using reference =
3580  typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value,
3581  typename BasicJsonType::const_reference,
3582  typename BasicJsonType::reference>::type;
3584  using iterator_category = std::bidirectional_iterator_tag;
3585 
3587  iter_impl() = default;
3588 
3595  explicit iter_impl(pointer object) noexcept : m_object(object)
3596  {
3597  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3598 
3599  switch (m_object->m_type)
3600  {
3601  case value_t::object:
3602  {
3603  m_it.object_iterator = typename object_t::iterator();
3604  break;
3605  }
3606 
3607  case value_t::array:
3608  {
3609  m_it.array_iterator = typename array_t::iterator();
3610  break;
3611  }
3612 
3613  default:
3614  {
3615  m_it.primitive_iterator = primitive_iterator_t();
3616  break;
3617  }
3618  }
3619  }
3620 
3635  iter_impl(const iter_impl<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>& other) noexcept
3636  : m_object(other.m_object), m_it(other.m_it) {}
3637 
3644  iter_impl& operator=(const iter_impl<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>& other) noexcept
3645  {
3646  m_object = other.m_object;
3647  m_it = other.m_it;
3648  return *this;
3649  }
3650 
3651  private:
3656  void set_begin() noexcept
3657  {
3658  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3659 
3660  switch (m_object->m_type)
3661  {
3662  case value_t::object:
3663  {
3664  m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->begin();
3665  break;
3666  }
3667 
3668  case value_t::array:
3669  {
3670  m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->begin();
3671  break;
3672  }
3673 
3674  case value_t::null:
3675  {
3676  // set to end so begin()==end() is true: null is empty
3677  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
3678  break;
3679  }
3680 
3681  default:
3682  {
3683  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_begin();
3684  break;
3685  }
3686  }
3687  }
3688 
3693  void set_end() noexcept
3694  {
3695  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3696 
3697  switch (m_object->m_type)
3698  {
3699  case value_t::object:
3700  {
3701  m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->end();
3702  break;
3703  }
3704 
3705  case value_t::array:
3706  {
3707  m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->end();
3708  break;
3709  }
3710 
3711  default:
3712  {
3713  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
3714  break;
3715  }
3716  }
3717  }
3718 
3719  public:
3724  reference operator*() const
3725  {
3726  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3727 
3728  switch (m_object->m_type)
3729  {
3730  case value_t::object:
3731  {
3732  assert(m_it.object_iterator != m_object->m_value.object->end());
3733  return m_it.object_iterator->second;
3734  }
3735 
3736  case value_t::array:
3737  {
3738  assert(m_it.array_iterator != m_object->m_value.array->end());
3739  return *m_it.array_iterator;
3740  }
3741 
3742  case value_t::null:
3743  {
3744  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
3745  }
3746 
3747  default:
3748  {
3749  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()))
3750  {
3751  return *m_object;
3752  }
3753 
3754  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
3755  }
3756  }
3757  }
3758 
3763  pointer operator->() const
3764  {
3765  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3766 
3767  switch (m_object->m_type)
3768  {
3769  case value_t::object:
3770  {
3771  assert(m_it.object_iterator != m_object->m_value.object->end());
3772  return &(m_it.object_iterator->second);
3773  }
3774 
3775  case value_t::array:
3776  {
3777  assert(m_it.array_iterator != m_object->m_value.array->end());
3778  return &*m_it.array_iterator;
3779  }
3780 
3781  default:
3782  {
3783  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()))
3784  {
3785  return m_object;
3786  }
3787 
3788  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
3789  }
3790  }
3791  }
3792 
3797  iter_impl operator++(int)
3798  {
3799  auto result = *this;
3800  ++(*this);
3801  return result;
3802  }
3803 
3808  iter_impl& operator++()
3809  {
3810  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3811 
3812  switch (m_object->m_type)
3813  {
3814  case value_t::object:
3815  {
3816  std::advance(m_it.object_iterator, 1);
3817  break;
3818  }
3819 
3820  case value_t::array:
3821  {
3822  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, 1);
3823  break;
3824  }
3825 
3826  default:
3827  {
3828  ++m_it.primitive_iterator;
3829  break;
3830  }
3831  }
3832 
3833  return *this;
3834  }
3835 
3840  iter_impl operator--(int)
3841  {
3842  auto result = *this;
3843  --(*this);
3844  return result;
3845  }
3846 
3851  iter_impl& operator--()
3852  {
3853  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3854 
3855  switch (m_object->m_type)
3856  {
3857  case value_t::object:
3858  {
3859  std::advance(m_it.object_iterator, -1);
3860  break;
3861  }
3862 
3863  case value_t::array:
3864  {
3865  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, -1);
3866  break;
3867  }
3868 
3869  default:
3870  {
3871  --m_it.primitive_iterator;
3872  break;
3873  }
3874  }
3875 
3876  return *this;
3877  }
3878 
3883  bool operator==(const iter_impl& other) const
3884  {
3885  // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
3886  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(m_object != other.m_object))
3887  {
3888  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(212, "cannot compare iterators of different containers"));
3889  }
3890 
3891  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3892 
3893  switch (m_object->m_type)
3894  {
3895  case value_t::object:
3896  {
3897  return (m_it.object_iterator == other.m_it.object_iterator);
3898  }
3899 
3900  case value_t::array:
3901  {
3902  return (m_it.array_iterator == other.m_it.array_iterator);
3903  }
3904 
3905  default:
3906  {
3907  return (m_it.primitive_iterator == other.m_it.primitive_iterator);
3908  }
3909  }
3910  }
3911 
3916  bool operator!=(const iter_impl& other) const
3917  {
3918  return not operator==(other);
3919  }
3920 
3925  bool operator<(const iter_impl& other) const
3926  {
3927  // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
3928  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(m_object != other.m_object))
3929  {
3930  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(212, "cannot compare iterators of different containers"));
3931  }
3932 
3933  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3934 
3935  switch (m_object->m_type)
3936  {
3937  case value_t::object:
3938  {
3939  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(213, "cannot compare order of object iterators"));
3940  }
3941 
3942  case value_t::array:
3943  {
3944  return (m_it.array_iterator < other.m_it.array_iterator);
3945  }
3946 
3947  default:
3948  {
3949  return (m_it.primitive_iterator < other.m_it.primitive_iterator);
3950  }
3951  }
3952  }
3953 
3958  bool operator<=(const iter_impl& other) const
3959  {
3960  return not other.operator < (*this);
3961  }
3962 
3967  bool operator>(const iter_impl& other) const
3968  {
3969  return not operator<=(other);
3970  }
3971 
3976  bool operator>=(const iter_impl& other) const
3977  {
3978  return not operator<(other);
3979  }
3980 
3985  iter_impl& operator+=(difference_type i)
3986  {
3987  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3988 
3989  switch (m_object->m_type)
3990  {
3991  case value_t::object:
3992  {
3993  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(209, "cannot use offsets with object iterators"));
3994  }
3995 
3996  case value_t::array:
3997  {
3998  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, i);
3999  break;
4000  }
4001 
4002  default:
4003  {
4004  m_it.primitive_iterator += i;
4005  break;
4006  }
4007  }
4008 
4009  return *this;
4010  }
4011 
4016  iter_impl& operator-=(difference_type i)
4017  {
4018  return operator+=(-i);
4019  }
4020 
4025  iter_impl operator+(difference_type i) const
4026  {
4027  auto result = *this;
4028  result += i;
4029  return result;
4030  }
4031 
4036  friend iter_impl operator+(difference_type i, const iter_impl& it)
4037  {
4038  auto result = it;
4039  result += i;
4040  return result;
4041  }
4042 
4047  iter_impl operator-(difference_type i) const
4048  {
4049  auto result = *this;
4050  result -= i;
4051  return result;
4052  }
4053 
4058  difference_type operator-(const iter_impl& other) const
4059  {
4060  assert(m_object != nullptr);
4061 
4062  switch (m_object->m_type)
4063  {
4064  case value_t::object:
4065  {
4066  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(209, "cannot use offsets with object iterators"));
4067  }
4068 
4069  case value_t::array:
4070  {
4071  return m_it.array_iterator - other.m_it.array_iterator;
4072  }
4073 
4074  default:
4075  {
4076  return m_it.primitive_iterator - other.m_it.primitive_iterator;
4077  }
4078  }
4079  }
4080 
4085  reference operator[](difference_type n) const
4086  {
4087  assert(m_object != nullptr);
4088 
4089  switch (m_object->m_type)
4090  {
4091  case value_t::object:
4092  {
4093  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(208, "cannot use operator[] for object iterators"));
4094  }
4095 
4096  case value_t::array:
4097  {
4098  return *std::next(m_it.array_iterator, n);
4099  }
4100 
4101  case value_t::null:
4102  {
4103  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
4104  }
4105 
4106  default:
4107  {
4108  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_it.primitive_iterator.get_value() == -n))
4109  {
4110  return *m_object;
4111  }
4112 
4113  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
4114  }
4115  }
4116  }
4117 
4122  typename object_t::key_type key() const
4123  {
4124  assert(m_object != nullptr);
4125 
4126  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_object->is_object()))
4127  {
4128  return m_it.object_iterator->first;
4129  }
4130 
4131  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(207, "cannot use key() for non-object iterators"));
4132  }
4133 
4138  reference value() const
4139  {
4140  return operator*();
4141  }
4142 
4143  private:
4145  pointer m_object = nullptr;
4147  internal_iterator<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type> m_it = {};
4148 };
4149 
4151 template<typename IteratorType> class iteration_proxy
4152 {
4153  private:
4155  class iteration_proxy_internal
4156  {
4157  private:
4159  IteratorType anchor;
4161  std::size_t array_index = 0;
4162 
4163  public:
4164  explicit iteration_proxy_internal(IteratorType it) noexcept : anchor(it) {}
4165 
4167  iteration_proxy_internal& operator*()
4168  {
4169  return *this;
4170  }
4171 
4173  iteration_proxy_internal& operator++()
4174  {
4175  ++anchor;
4176  ++array_index;
4177 
4178  return *this;
4179  }
4180 
4182  bool operator!=(const iteration_proxy_internal& o) const noexcept
4183  {
4184  return anchor != o.anchor;
4185  }
4186 
4188  std::string key() const
4189  {
4190  assert(anchor.m_object != nullptr);
4191 
4192  switch (anchor.m_object->type())
4193  {
4194  // use integer array index as key
4195  case value_t::array:
4196  {
4197  return std::to_string(array_index);
4198  }
4199 
4200  // use key from the object
4201  case value_t::object:
4202  {
4203  return anchor.key();
4204  }
4205 
4206  // use an empty key for all primitive types
4207  default:
4208  {
4209  return "";
4210  }
4211  }
4212  }
4213 
4215  typename IteratorType::reference value() const
4216  {
4217  return anchor.value();
4218  }
4219  };
4220 
4222  typename IteratorType::reference container;
4223 
4224  public:
4226  explicit iteration_proxy(typename IteratorType::reference cont)
4227  : container(cont) {}
4228 
4230  iteration_proxy_internal begin() noexcept
4231  {
4232  return iteration_proxy_internal(container.begin());
4233  }
4234 
4236  iteration_proxy_internal end() noexcept
4237  {
4238  return iteration_proxy_internal(container.end());
4239  }
4240 };
4241 
4260 template<typename Base>
4261 class json_reverse_iterator : public std::reverse_iterator<Base>
4262 {
4263  public:
4264  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
4266  using base_iterator = std::reverse_iterator<Base>;
4268  using reference = typename Base::reference;
4269 
4271  json_reverse_iterator(const typename base_iterator::iterator_type& it) noexcept
4272  : base_iterator(it) {}
4273 
4275  json_reverse_iterator(const base_iterator& it) noexcept : base_iterator(it) {}
4276 
4278  json_reverse_iterator operator++(int)
4279  {
4280  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator++(1));
4281  }
4282 
4284  json_reverse_iterator& operator++()
4285  {
4286  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator&>(base_iterator::operator++());
4287  }
4288 
4290  json_reverse_iterator operator--(int)
4291  {
4292  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator--(1));
4293  }
4294 
4296  json_reverse_iterator& operator--()
4297  {
4298  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator&>(base_iterator::operator--());
4299  }
4300 
4302  json_reverse_iterator& operator+=(difference_type i)
4303  {
4304  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator&>(base_iterator::operator+=(i));
4305  }
4306 
4308  json_reverse_iterator operator+(difference_type i) const
4309  {
4310  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator+(i));
4311  }
4312 
4314  json_reverse_iterator operator-(difference_type i) const
4315  {
4316  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator-(i));
4317  }
4318 
4320  difference_type operator-(const json_reverse_iterator& other) const
4321  {
4322  return base_iterator(*this) - base_iterator(other);
4323  }
4324 
4326  reference operator[](difference_type n) const
4327  {
4328  return *(this->operator+(n));
4329  }
4330 
4332  auto key() const -> decltype(std::declval<Base>().key())
4333  {
4334  auto it = --this->base();
4335  return it.key();
4336  }
4337 
4339  reference value() const
4340  {
4341  auto it = --this->base();
4342  return it.operator * ();
4343  }
4344 };
4345 
4347 // output adapters //
4349 
4351 template<typename CharType> struct output_adapter_protocol
4352 {
4353  virtual void write_character(CharType c) = 0;
4354  virtual void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) = 0;
4355  virtual ~output_adapter_protocol() = default;
4356 };
4357 
4359 template<typename CharType>
4360 using output_adapter_t = std::shared_ptr<output_adapter_protocol<CharType>>;
4361 
4363 template<typename CharType>
4364 class output_vector_adapter : public output_adapter_protocol<CharType>
4365 {
4366  public:
4367  explicit output_vector_adapter(std::vector<CharType>& vec) : v(vec) {}
4368 
4369  void write_character(CharType c) override
4370  {
4371  v.push_back(c);
4372  }
4373 
4374  void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) override
4375  {
4376  std::copy(s, s + length, std::back_inserter(v));
4377  }
4378 
4379  private:
4380  std::vector<CharType>& v;
4381 };
4382 
4384 template<typename CharType>
4385 class output_stream_adapter : public output_adapter_protocol<CharType>
4386 {
4387  public:
4388  explicit output_stream_adapter(std::basic_ostream<CharType>& s) : stream(s) {}
4389 
4390  void write_character(CharType c) override
4391  {
4392  stream.put(c);
4393  }
4394 
4395  void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) override
4396  {
4397  stream.write(s, static_cast<std::streamsize>(length));
4398  }
4399 
4400  private:
4401  std::basic_ostream<CharType>& stream;
4402 };
4403 
4405 template<typename CharType>
4406 class output_string_adapter : public output_adapter_protocol<CharType>
4407 {
4408  public:
4409  explicit output_string_adapter(std::basic_string<CharType>& s) : str(s) {}
4410 
4411  void write_character(CharType c) override
4412  {
4413  str.push_back(c);
4414  }
4415 
4416  void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) override
4417  {
4418  str.append(s, length);
4419  }
4420 
4421  private:
4422  std::basic_string<CharType>& str;
4423 };
4424 
4425 template<typename CharType>
4426 class output_adapter
4427 {
4428  public:
4429  output_adapter(std::vector<CharType>& vec)
4430  : oa(std::make_shared<output_vector_adapter<CharType>>(vec)) {}
4431 
4432  output_adapter(std::basic_ostream<CharType>& s)
4433  : oa(std::make_shared<output_stream_adapter<CharType>>(s)) {}
4434 
4435  output_adapter(std::basic_string<CharType>& s)
4436  : oa(std::make_shared<output_string_adapter<CharType>>(s)) {}
4437 
4438  operator output_adapter_t<CharType>()
4439  {
4440  return oa;
4441  }
4442 
4443  private:
4444  output_adapter_t<CharType> oa = nullptr;
4445 };
4446 
4448 // binary reader and writer //
4450 
4454 template<typename BasicJsonType>
4455 class binary_reader
4456 {
4457  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4458  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4459 
4460  public:
4466  explicit binary_reader(input_adapter_t adapter) : ia(adapter)
4467  {
4468  assert(ia);
4469  }
4470 
4483  BasicJsonType parse_cbor(const bool get_char = true)
4484  {
4485  switch (get_char ? get() : current)
4486  {
4487  // EOF
4488  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
4489  {
4490  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(110, chars_read, "unexpected end of input"));
4491  }
4492 
4493  // Integer 0x00..0x17 (0..23)
4494  case 0x00:
4495  case 0x01:
4496  case 0x02:
4497  case 0x03:
4498  case 0x04:
4499  case 0x05:
4500  case 0x06:
4501  case 0x07:
4502  case 0x08:
4503  case 0x09:
4504  case 0x0a:
4505  case 0x0b:
4506  case 0x0c:
4507  case 0x0d:
4508  case 0x0e:
4509  case 0x0f:
4510  case 0x10:
4511  case 0x11:
4512  case 0x12:
4513  case 0x13:
4514  case 0x14:
4515  case 0x15:
4516  case 0x16:
4517  case 0x17:
4518  {
4519  return static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(current);
4520  }
4521 
4522  case 0x18: // Unsigned integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
4523  {
4524  return get_number<uint8_t>();
4525  }
4526 
4527  case 0x19: // Unsigned integer (two-byte uint16_t follows)
4528  {
4529  return get_number<uint16_t>();
4530  }
4531 
4532  case 0x1a: // Unsigned integer (four-byte uint32_t follows)
4533  {
4534  return get_number<uint32_t>();
4535  }
4536 
4537  case 0x1b: // Unsigned integer (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
4538  {
4539  return get_number<uint64_t>();
4540  }
4541 
4542  // Negative integer -1-0x00..-1-0x17 (-1..-24)
4543  case 0x20:
4544  case 0x21:
4545  case 0x22:
4546  case 0x23:
4547  case 0x24:
4548  case 0x25:
4549  case 0x26:
4550  case 0x27:
4551  case 0x28:
4552  case 0x29:
4553  case 0x2a:
4554  case 0x2b:
4555  case 0x2c:
4556  case 0x2d:
4557  case 0x2e:
4558  case 0x2f:
4559  case 0x30:
4560  case 0x31:
4561  case 0x32:
4562  case 0x33:
4563  case 0x34:
4564  case 0x35:
4565  case 0x36:
4566  case 0x37:
4567  {
4568  return static_cast<int8_t>(0x20 - 1 - current);
4569  }
4570 
4571  case 0x38: // Negative integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
4572  {
4573  // must be uint8_t !
4574  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_number<uint8_t>();
4575  }
4576 
4577  case 0x39: // Negative integer -1-n (two-byte uint16_t follows)
4578  {
4579  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_number<uint16_t>();
4580  }
4581 
4582  case 0x3a: // Negative integer -1-n (four-byte uint32_t follows)
4583  {
4584  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_number<uint32_t>();
4585  }
4586 
4587  case 0x3b: // Negative integer -1-n (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
4588  {
4589  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) -
4590  static_cast<number_integer_t>(get_number<uint64_t>());
4591  }
4592 
4593  // UTF-8 string (0x00..0x17 bytes follow)
4594  case 0x60:
4595  case 0x61:
4596  case 0x62:
4597  case 0x63:
4598  case 0x64:
4599  case 0x65:
4600  case 0x66:
4601  case 0x67:
4602  case 0x68:
4603  case 0x69:
4604  case 0x6a:
4605  case 0x6b:
4606  case 0x6c:
4607  case 0x6d:
4608  case 0x6e:
4609  case 0x6f:
4610  case 0x70:
4611  case 0x71:
4612  case 0x72:
4613  case 0x73:
4614  case 0x74:
4615  case 0x75:
4616  case 0x76:
4617  case 0x77:
4618  case 0x78: // UTF-8 string (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
4619  case 0x79: // UTF-8 string (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
4620  case 0x7a: // UTF-8 string (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
4621  case 0x7b: // UTF-8 string (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
4622  case 0x7f: // UTF-8 string (indefinite length)
4623  {
4624  return get_cbor_string();
4625  }
4626 
4627  // array (0x00..0x17 data items follow)
4628  case 0x80:
4629  case 0x81:
4630  case 0x82:
4631  case 0x83:
4632  case 0x84:
4633  case 0x85:
4634  case 0x86:
4635  case 0x87:
4636  case 0x88:
4637  case 0x89:
4638  case 0x8a:
4639  case 0x8b:
4640  case 0x8c:
4641  case 0x8d:
4642  case 0x8e:
4643  case 0x8f:
4644  case 0x90:
4645  case 0x91:
4646  case 0x92:
4647  case 0x93:
4648  case 0x94:
4649  case 0x95:
4650  case 0x96:
4651  case 0x97:
4652  {
4653  BasicJsonType result = value_t::array;
4654  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x1f);
4655  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
4656  {
4657  result.push_back(parse_cbor());
4658  }
4659  return result;
4660  }
4661 
4662  case 0x98: // array (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
4663  {
4664  BasicJsonType result = value_t::array;
4665  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint8_t>());
4666  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
4667  {
4668  result.push_back(parse_cbor());
4669  }
4670  return result;
4671  }
4672 
4673  case 0x99: // array (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
4674  {
4675  BasicJsonType result = value_t::array;
4676  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
4677  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
4678  {
4679  result.push_back(parse_cbor());
4680  }
4681  return result;
4682  }
4683 
4684  case 0x9a: // array (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
4685  {
4686  BasicJsonType result = value_t::array;
4687  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
4688  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
4689  {
4690  result.push_back(parse_cbor());
4691  }
4692  return result;
4693  }
4694 
4695  case 0x9b: // array (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
4696  {
4697  BasicJsonType result = value_t::array;
4698  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint64_t>());
4699  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
4700  {
4701  result.push_back(parse_cbor());
4702  }
4703  return result;
4704  }
4705 
4706  case 0x9f: // array (indefinite length)
4707  {
4708  BasicJsonType result = value_t::array;
4709  while (get() != 0xff)
4710  {
4711  result.push_back(parse_cbor(false));
4712  }
4713  return result;
4714  }
4715 
4716  // map (0x00..0x17 pairs of data items follow)
4717  case 0xa0:
4718  case 0xa1:
4719  case 0xa2:
4720  case 0xa3:
4721  case 0xa4:
4722  case 0xa5:
4723  case 0xa6:
4724  case 0xa7:
4725  case 0xa8:
4726  case 0xa9:
4727  case 0xaa:
4728  case 0xab:
4729  case 0xac:
4730  case 0xad:
4731  case 0xae:
4732  case 0xaf:
4733  case 0xb0:
4734  case 0xb1:
4735  case 0xb2:
4736  case 0xb3:
4737  case 0xb4:
4738  case 0xb5:
4739  case 0xb6:
4740  case 0xb7:
4741  {
4742  BasicJsonType result = value_t::object;
4743  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x1f);
4744  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
4745  {
4746  get();
4747  auto key = get_cbor_string();
4748  result[key] = parse_cbor();
4749  }
4750  return result;
4751  }
4752 
4753  case 0xb8: // map (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
4754  {
4755  BasicJsonType result = value_t::object;
4756  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint8_t>());
4757  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
4758  {
4759  get();
4760  auto key = get_cbor_string();
4761  result[key] = parse_cbor();
4762  }
4763  return result;
4764  }
4765 
4766  case 0xb9: // map (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
4767  {
4768  BasicJsonType result = value_t::object;
4769  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
4770  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
4771  {
4772  get();
4773  auto key = get_cbor_string();
4774  result[key] = parse_cbor();
4775  }
4776  return result;
4777  }
4778 
4779  case 0xba: // map (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
4780  {
4781  BasicJsonType result = value_t::object;
4782  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
4783  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
4784  {
4785  get();
4786  auto key = get_cbor_string();
4787  result[key] = parse_cbor();
4788  }
4789  return result;
4790  }
4791 
4792  case 0xbb: // map (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
4793  {
4794  BasicJsonType result = value_t::object;
4795  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint64_t>());
4796  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
4797  {
4798  get();
4799  auto key = get_cbor_string();
4800  result[key] = parse_cbor();
4801  }
4802  return result;
4803  }
4804 
4805  case 0xbf: // map (indefinite length)
4806  {
4807  BasicJsonType result = value_t::object;
4808  while (get() != 0xff)
4809  {
4810  auto key = get_cbor_string();
4811  result[key] = parse_cbor();
4812  }
4813  return result;
4814  }
4815 
4816  case 0xf4: // false
4817  {
4818  return false;
4819  }
4820 
4821  case 0xf5: // true
4822  {
4823  return true;
4824  }
4825 
4826  case 0xf6: // null
4827  {
4828  return value_t::null;
4829  }
4830 
4831  case 0xf9: // Half-Precision Float (two-byte IEEE 754)
4832  {
4833  const int byte1 = get();
4834  check_eof();
4835  const int byte2 = get();
4836  check_eof();
4837 
4838  // code from RFC 7049, Appendix D, Figure 3:
4839  // As half-precision floating-point numbers were only added
4840  // to IEEE 754 in 2008, today's programming platforms often
4841  // still only have limited support for them. It is very
4842  // easy to include at least decoding support for them even
4843  // without such support. An example of a small decoder for
4844  // half-precision floating-point numbers in the C language
4845  // is shown in Fig. 3.
4846  const int half = (byte1 << 8) + byte2;
4847  const int exp = (half >> 10) & 0x1f;
4848  const int mant = half & 0x3ff;
4849  double val;
4850  if (exp == 0)
4851  {
4852  val = std::ldexp(mant, -24);
4853  }
4854  else if (exp != 31)
4855  {
4856  val = std::ldexp(mant + 1024, exp - 25);
4857  }
4858  else
4859  {
4860  val = (mant == 0) ? std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity()
4861  : std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
4862  }
4863  return (half & 0x8000) != 0 ? -val : val;
4864  }
4865 
4866  case 0xfa: // Single-Precision Float (four-byte IEEE 754)
4867  {
4868  return get_number<float>();
4869  }
4870 
4871  case 0xfb: // Double-Precision Float (eight-byte IEEE 754)
4872  {
4873  return get_number<double>();
4874  }
4875 
4876  default: // anything else (0xFF is handled inside the other types)
4877  {
4878  std::stringstream ss;
4879  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
4880  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(112, chars_read, "error reading CBOR; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
4881  }
4882  }
4883  }
4884 
4893  BasicJsonType parse_msgpack()
4894  {
4895  switch (get())
4896  {
4897  // EOF
4898  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
4899  {
4900  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(110, chars_read, "unexpected end of input"));
4901  }
4902 
4903  // positive fixint
4904  case 0x00:
4905  case 0x01:
4906  case 0x02:
4907  case 0x03:
4908  case 0x04:
4909  case 0x05:
4910  case 0x06:
4911  case 0x07:
4912  case 0x08:
4913  case 0x09:
4914  case 0x0a:
4915  case 0x0b:
4916  case 0x0c:
4917  case 0x0d:
4918  case 0x0e:
4919  case 0x0f:
4920  case 0x10:
4921  case 0x11:
4922  case 0x12:
4923  case 0x13:
4924  case 0x14:
4925  case 0x15:
4926  case 0x16:
4927  case 0x17:
4928  case 0x18:
4929  case 0x19:
4930  case 0x1a:
4931  case 0x1b:
4932  case 0x1c:
4933  case 0x1d:
4934  case 0x1e:
4935  case 0x1f:
4936  case 0x20:
4937  case 0x21:
4938  case 0x22:
4939  case 0x23:
4940  case 0x24:
4941  case 0x25:
4942  case 0x26:
4943  case 0x27:
4944  case 0x28:
4945  case 0x29:
4946  case 0x2a:
4947  case 0x2b:
4948  case 0x2c:
4949  case 0x2d:
4950  case 0x2e:
4951  case 0x2f:
4952  case 0x30:
4953  case 0x31:
4954  case 0x32:
4955  case 0x33:
4956  case 0x34:
4957  case 0x35:
4958  case 0x36:
4959  case 0x37:
4960  case 0x38:
4961  case 0x39:
4962  case 0x3a:
4963  case 0x3b:
4964  case 0x3c:
4965  case 0x3d:
4966  case 0x3e:
4967  case 0x3f:
4968  case 0x40:
4969  case 0x41:
4970  case 0x42:
4971  case 0x43:
4972  case 0x44:
4973  case 0x45:
4974  case 0x46:
4975  case 0x47:
4976  case 0x48:
4977  case 0x49:
4978  case 0x4a:
4979  case 0x4b:
4980  case 0x4c:
4981  case 0x4d:
4982  case 0x4e:
4983  case 0x4f:
4984  case 0x50:
4985  case 0x51:
4986  case 0x52:
4987  case 0x53:
4988  case 0x54:
4989  case 0x55:
4990  case 0x56:
4991  case 0x57:
4992  case 0x58:
4993  case 0x59:
4994  case 0x5a:
4995  case 0x5b:
4996  case 0x5c:
4997  case 0x5d:
4998  case 0x5e:
4999  case 0x5f:
5000  case 0x60:
5001  case 0x61:
5002  case 0x62:
5003  case 0x63:
5004  case 0x64:
5005  case 0x65:
5006  case 0x66:
5007  case 0x67:
5008  case 0x68:
5009  case 0x69:
5010  case 0x6a:
5011  case 0x6b:
5012  case 0x6c:
5013  case 0x6d:
5014  case 0x6e:
5015  case 0x6f:
5016  case 0x70:
5017  case 0x71:
5018  case 0x72:
5019  case 0x73:
5020  case 0x74:
5021  case 0x75:
5022  case 0x76:
5023  case 0x77:
5024  case 0x78:
5025  case 0x79:
5026  case 0x7a:
5027  case 0x7b:
5028  case 0x7c:
5029  case 0x7d:
5030  case 0x7e:
5031  case 0x7f:
5032  {
5033  return static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(current);
5034  }
5035 
5036  // fixmap
5037  case 0x80:
5038  case 0x81:
5039  case 0x82:
5040  case 0x83:
5041  case 0x84:
5042  case 0x85:
5043  case 0x86:
5044  case 0x87:
5045  case 0x88:
5046  case 0x89:
5047  case 0x8a:
5048  case 0x8b:
5049  case 0x8c:
5050  case 0x8d:
5051  case 0x8e:
5052  case 0x8f:
5053  {
5054  BasicJsonType result = value_t::object;
5055  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x0f);
5056  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
5057  {
5058  get();
5059  auto key = get_msgpack_string();
5060  result[key] = parse_msgpack();
5061  }
5062  return result;
5063  }
5064 
5065  // fixarray
5066  case 0x90:
5067  case 0x91:
5068  case 0x92:
5069  case 0x93:
5070  case 0x94:
5071  case 0x95:
5072  case 0x96:
5073  case 0x97:
5074  case 0x98:
5075  case 0x99:
5076  case 0x9a:
5077  case 0x9b:
5078  case 0x9c:
5079  case 0x9d:
5080  case 0x9e:
5081  case 0x9f:
5082  {
5083  BasicJsonType result = value_t::array;
5084  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x0f);
5085  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
5086  {
5087  result.push_back(parse_msgpack());
5088  }
5089  return result;
5090  }
5091 
5092  // fixstr
5093  case 0xa0:
5094  case 0xa1:
5095  case 0xa2:
5096  case 0xa3:
5097  case 0xa4:
5098  case 0xa5:
5099  case 0xa6:
5100  case 0xa7:
5101  case 0xa8:
5102  case 0xa9:
5103  case 0xaa:
5104  case 0xab:
5105  case 0xac:
5106  case 0xad:
5107  case 0xae:
5108  case 0xaf:
5109  case 0xb0:
5110  case 0xb1:
5111  case 0xb2:
5112  case 0xb3:
5113  case 0xb4:
5114  case 0xb5:
5115  case 0xb6:
5116  case 0xb7:
5117  case 0xb8:
5118  case 0xb9:
5119  case 0xba:
5120  case 0xbb:
5121  case 0xbc:
5122  case 0xbd:
5123  case 0xbe:
5124  case 0xbf:
5125  {
5126  return get_msgpack_string();
5127  }
5128 
5129  case 0xc0: // nil
5130  {
5131  return value_t::null;
5132  }
5133 
5134  case 0xc2: // false
5135  {
5136  return false;
5137  }
5138 
5139  case 0xc3: // true
5140  {
5141  return true;
5142  }
5143 
5144  case 0xca: // float 32
5145  {
5146  return get_number<float>();
5147  }
5148 
5149  case 0xcb: // float 64
5150  {
5151  return get_number<double>();
5152  }
5153 
5154  case 0xcc: // uint 8
5155  {
5156  return get_number<uint8_t>();
5157  }
5158 
5159  case 0xcd: // uint 16
5160  {
5161  return get_number<uint16_t>();
5162  }
5163 
5164  case 0xce: // uint 32
5165  {
5166  return get_number<uint32_t>();
5167  }
5168 
5169  case 0xcf: // uint 64
5170  {
5171  return get_number<uint64_t>();
5172  }
5173 
5174  case 0xd0: // int 8
5175  {
5176  return get_number<int8_t>();
5177  }
5178 
5179  case 0xd1: // int 16
5180  {
5181  return get_number<int16_t>();
5182  }
5183 
5184  case 0xd2: // int 32
5185  {
5186  return get_number<int32_t>();
5187  }
5188 
5189  case 0xd3: // int 64
5190  {
5191  return get_number<int64_t>();
5192  }
5193 
5194  case 0xd9: // str 8
5195  case 0xda: // str 16
5196  case 0xdb: // str 32
5197  {
5198  return get_msgpack_string();
5199  }
5200 
5201  case 0xdc: // array 16
5202  {
5203  BasicJsonType result = value_t::array;
5204  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
5205  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
5206  {
5207  result.push_back(parse_msgpack());
5208  }
5209  return result;
5210  }
5211 
5212  case 0xdd: // array 32
5213  {
5214  BasicJsonType result = value_t::array;
5215  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
5216  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
5217  {
5218  result.push_back(parse_msgpack());
5219  }
5220  return result;
5221  }
5222 
5223  case 0xde: // map 16
5224  {
5225  BasicJsonType result = value_t::object;
5226  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
5227  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
5228  {
5229  get();
5230  auto key = get_msgpack_string();
5231  result[key] = parse_msgpack();
5232  }
5233  return result;
5234  }
5235 
5236  case 0xdf: // map 32
5237  {
5238  BasicJsonType result = value_t::object;
5239  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
5240  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
5241  {
5242  get();
5243  auto key = get_msgpack_string();
5244  result[key] = parse_msgpack();
5245  }
5246  return result;
5247  }
5248 
5249  // positive fixint
5250  case 0xe0:
5251  case 0xe1:
5252  case 0xe2:
5253  case 0xe3:
5254  case 0xe4:
5255  case 0xe5:
5256  case 0xe6:
5257  case 0xe7:
5258  case 0xe8:
5259  case 0xe9:
5260  case 0xea:
5261  case 0xeb:
5262  case 0xec:
5263  case 0xed:
5264  case 0xee:
5265  case 0xef:
5266  case 0xf0:
5267  case 0xf1:
5268  case 0xf2:
5269  case 0xf3:
5270  case 0xf4:
5271  case 0xf5:
5272  case 0xf6:
5273  case 0xf7:
5274  case 0xf8:
5275  case 0xf9:
5276  case 0xfa:
5277  case 0xfb:
5278  case 0xfc:
5279  case 0xfd:
5280  case 0xfe:
5281  case 0xff:
5282  {
5283  return static_cast<int8_t>(current);
5284  }
5285 
5286  default: // anything else
5287  {
5288  std::stringstream ss;
5289  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
5290  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(112, chars_read,
5291  "error reading MessagePack; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
5292  }
5293  }
5294  }
5295 
5303  static constexpr bool little_endianess(int num = 1) noexcept
5304  {
5305  return (*reinterpret_cast<char*>(&num) == 1);
5306  }
5307 
5308  private:
5318  int get()
5319  {
5320  ++chars_read;
5321  return (current = ia->get_character());
5322  }
5323 
5324  /*
5325  @brief read a number from the input
5326 
5327  @tparam NumberType the type of the number
5328 
5329  @return number of type @a NumberType
5330 
5331  @note This function needs to respect the system's endianess, because
5332  bytes in CBOR and MessagePack are stored in network order (big
5333  endian) and therefore need reordering on little endian systems.
5334 
5335  @throw parse_error.110 if input has less than `sizeof(NumberType)` bytes
5336  */
5337  template<typename NumberType> NumberType get_number()
5338  {
5339  // step 1: read input into array with system's byte order
5340  std::array<uint8_t, sizeof(NumberType)> vec;
5341  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(NumberType); ++i)
5342  {
5343  get();
5344  check_eof();
5345 
5346  // reverse byte order prior to conversion if necessary
5347  if (is_little_endian)
5348  {
5349  vec[sizeof(NumberType) - i - 1] = static_cast<uint8_t>(current);
5350  }
5351  else
5352  {
5353  vec[i] = static_cast<uint8_t>(current); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
5354  }
5355  }
5356 
5357  // step 2: convert array into number of type T and return
5358  NumberType result;
5359  std::memcpy(&result, vec.data(), sizeof(NumberType));
5360  return result;
5361  }
5362 
5376  std::string get_string(const std::size_t len)
5377  {
5378  std::string result;
5379  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
5380  {
5381  get();
5382  check_eof();
5383  result.append(1, static_cast<char>(current));
5384  }
5385  return result;
5386  }
5387 
5400  std::string get_cbor_string()
5401  {
5402  check_eof();
5403 
5404  switch (current)
5405  {
5406  // UTF-8 string (0x00..0x17 bytes follow)
5407  case 0x60:
5408  case 0x61:
5409  case 0x62:
5410  case 0x63:
5411  case 0x64:
5412  case 0x65:
5413  case 0x66:
5414  case 0x67:
5415  case 0x68:
5416  case 0x69:
5417  case 0x6a:
5418  case 0x6b:
5419  case 0x6c:
5420  case 0x6d:
5421  case 0x6e:
5422  case 0x6f:
5423  case 0x70:
5424  case 0x71:
5425  case 0x72:
5426  case 0x73:
5427  case 0x74:
5428  case 0x75:
5429  case 0x76:
5430  case 0x77:
5431  {
5432  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x1f);
5433  return get_string(len);
5434  }
5435 
5436  case 0x78: // UTF-8 string (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
5437  {
5438  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint8_t>());
5439  return get_string(len);
5440  }
5441 
5442  case 0x79: // UTF-8 string (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
5443  {
5444  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
5445  return get_string(len);
5446  }
5447 
5448  case 0x7a: // UTF-8 string (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
5449  {
5450  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
5451  return get_string(len);
5452  }
5453 
5454  case 0x7b: // UTF-8 string (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
5455  {
5456  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint64_t>());
5457  return get_string(len);
5458  }
5459 
5460  case 0x7f: // UTF-8 string (indefinite length)
5461  {
5462  std::string result;
5463  while (get() != 0xff)
5464  {
5465  check_eof();
5466  result.append(1, static_cast<char>(current));
5467  }
5468  return result;
5469  }
5470 
5471  default:
5472  {
5473  std::stringstream ss;
5474  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
5475  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(113, chars_read, "expected a CBOR string; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
5476  }
5477  }
5478  }
5479 
5491  std::string get_msgpack_string()
5492  {
5493  check_eof();
5494 
5495  switch (current)
5496  {
5497  // fixstr
5498  case 0xa0:
5499  case 0xa1:
5500  case 0xa2:
5501  case 0xa3:
5502  case 0xa4:
5503  case 0xa5:
5504  case 0xa6:
5505  case 0xa7:
5506  case 0xa8:
5507  case 0xa9:
5508  case 0xaa:
5509  case 0xab:
5510  case 0xac:
5511  case 0xad:
5512  case 0xae:
5513  case 0xaf:
5514  case 0xb0:
5515  case 0xb1:
5516  case 0xb2:
5517  case 0xb3:
5518  case 0xb4:
5519  case 0xb5:
5520  case 0xb6:
5521  case 0xb7:
5522  case 0xb8:
5523  case 0xb9:
5524  case 0xba:
5525  case 0xbb:
5526  case 0xbc:
5527  case 0xbd:
5528  case 0xbe:
5529  case 0xbf:
5530  {
5531  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(current & 0x1f);
5532  return get_string(len);
5533  }
5534 
5535  case 0xd9: // str 8
5536  {
5537  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint8_t>());
5538  return get_string(len);
5539  }
5540 
5541  case 0xda: // str 16
5542  {
5543  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint16_t>());
5544  return get_string(len);
5545  }
5546 
5547  case 0xdb: // str 32
5548  {
5549  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(get_number<uint32_t>());
5550  return get_string(len);
5551  }
5552 
5553  default:
5554  {
5555  std::stringstream ss;
5556  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
5557  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(113, chars_read,
5558  "expected a MessagePack string; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
5559  }
5560  }
5561  }
5562 
5567  void check_eof() const
5568  {
5569  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(current == std::char_traits<char>::eof()))
5570  {
5571  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(110, chars_read, "unexpected end of input"));
5572  }
5573  }
5574 
5575  private:
5577  input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
5578 
5580  int current = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
5581 
5583  std::size_t chars_read = 0;
5584 
5586  const bool is_little_endian = little_endianess();
5587 };
5588 
5592 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CharType>
5593 class binary_writer
5594 {
5595  public:
5601  explicit binary_writer(output_adapter_t<CharType> adapter) : oa(adapter)
5602  {
5603  assert(oa);
5604  }
5605 
5609  void write_cbor(const BasicJsonType& j)
5610  {
5611  switch (j.type())
5612  {
5613  case value_t::null:
5614  {
5615  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xf6));
5616  break;
5617  }
5618 
5619  case value_t::boolean:
5620  {
5621  oa->write_character(j.m_value.boolean
5622  ? static_cast<CharType>(0xf5)
5623  : static_cast<CharType>(0xf4));
5624  break;
5625  }
5626 
5627  case value_t::number_integer:
5628  {
5629  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= 0)
5630  {
5631  // CBOR does not differentiate between positive signed
5632  // integers and unsigned integers. Therefore, we used the
5633  // code from the value_t::number_unsigned case here.
5634  if (j.m_value.number_integer <= 0x17)
5635  {
5636  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5637  }
5638  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
5639  {
5640  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x18));
5641  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5642  }
5643  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
5644  {
5645  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x19));
5646  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5647  }
5648  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
5649  {
5650  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x1a));
5651  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5652  }
5653  else
5654  {
5655  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x1b));
5656  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5657  }
5658  }
5659  else
5660  {
5661  // The conversions below encode the sign in the first
5662  // byte, and the value is converted to a positive number.
5663  const auto positive_number = -1 - j.m_value.number_integer;
5664  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= -24)
5665  {
5666  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x20 + positive_number));
5667  }
5668  else if (positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
5669  {
5670  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x38));
5671  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(positive_number));
5672  }
5673  else if (positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
5674  {
5675  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x39));
5676  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(positive_number));
5677  }
5678  else if (positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
5679  {
5680  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x3a));
5681  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(positive_number));
5682  }
5683  else
5684  {
5685  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x3b));
5686  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(positive_number));
5687  }
5688  }
5689  break;
5690  }
5691 
5692  case value_t::number_unsigned:
5693  {
5694  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= 0x17)
5695  {
5696  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
5697  }
5698  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
5699  {
5700  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x18));
5701  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
5702  }
5703  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
5704  {
5705  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x19));
5706  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
5707  }
5708  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
5709  {
5710  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x1a));
5711  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
5712  }
5713  else
5714  {
5715  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x1b));
5716  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
5717  }
5718  break;
5719  }
5720 
5721  case value_t::number_float:
5722  {
5723  // Double-Precision Float
5724  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xfb));
5725  write_number(j.m_value.number_float);
5726  break;
5727  }
5728 
5729  case value_t::string:
5730  {
5731  // step 1: write control byte and the string length
5732  const auto N = j.m_value.string->size();
5733  if (N <= 0x17)
5734  {
5735  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x60 + N));
5736  }
5737  else if (N <= 0xff)
5738  {
5739  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x78));
5740  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
5741  }
5742  else if (N <= 0xffff)
5743  {
5744  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x79));
5745  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
5746  }
5747  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
5748  {
5749  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x7a));
5750  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
5751  }
5752  // LCOV_EXCL_START
5753  else if (N <= 0xffffffffffffffff)
5754  {
5755  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x7b));
5756  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
5757  }
5758  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
5759 
5760  // step 2: write the string
5761  oa->write_characters(
5762  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(j.m_value.string->c_str()),
5763  j.m_value.string->size());
5764  break;
5765  }
5766 
5767  case value_t::array:
5768  {
5769  // step 1: write control byte and the array size
5770  const auto N = j.m_value.array->size();
5771  if (N <= 0x17)
5772  {
5773  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 + N));
5774  }
5775  else if (N <= 0xff)
5776  {
5777  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x98));
5778  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
5779  }
5780  else if (N <= 0xffff)
5781  {
5782  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x99));
5783  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
5784  }
5785  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
5786  {
5787  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x9a));
5788  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
5789  }
5790  // LCOV_EXCL_START
5791  else if (N <= 0xffffffffffffffff)
5792  {
5793  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x9b));
5794  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
5795  }
5796  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
5797 
5798  // step 2: write each element
5799  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.array)
5800  {
5801  write_cbor(el);
5802  }
5803  break;
5804  }
5805 
5806  case value_t::object:
5807  {
5808  // step 1: write control byte and the object size
5809  const auto N = j.m_value.object->size();
5810  if (N <= 0x17)
5811  {
5812  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0xa0 + N));
5813  }
5814  else if (N <= 0xff)
5815  {
5816  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xb8));
5817  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
5818  }
5819  else if (N <= 0xffff)
5820  {
5821  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xb9));
5822  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
5823  }
5824  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
5825  {
5826  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xba));
5827  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
5828  }
5829  // LCOV_EXCL_START
5830  else if (N <= 0xffffffffffffffff)
5831  {
5832  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xbb));
5833  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
5834  }
5835  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
5836 
5837  // step 2: write each element
5838  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.object)
5839  {
5840  write_cbor(el.first);
5841  write_cbor(el.second);
5842  }
5843  break;
5844  }
5845 
5846  default:
5847  {
5848  break;
5849  }
5850  }
5851  }
5852 
5856  void write_msgpack(const BasicJsonType& j)
5857  {
5858  switch (j.type())
5859  {
5860  case value_t::null:
5861  {
5862  // nil
5863  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xc0));
5864  break;
5865  }
5866 
5867  case value_t::boolean:
5868  {
5869  // true and false
5870  oa->write_character(j.m_value.boolean
5871  ? static_cast<CharType>(0xc3)
5872  : static_cast<CharType>(0xc2));
5873  break;
5874  }
5875 
5876  case value_t::number_integer:
5877  {
5878  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= 0)
5879  {
5880  // MessagePack does not differentiate between positive
5881  // signed integers and unsigned integers. Therefore, we used
5882  // the code from the value_t::number_unsigned case here.
5883  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned < 128)
5884  {
5885  // positive fixnum
5886  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5887  }
5888  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
5889  {
5890  // uint 8
5891  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xcc));
5892  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5893  }
5894  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
5895  {
5896  // uint 16
5897  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xcd));
5898  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5899  }
5900  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
5901  {
5902  // uint 32
5903  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xce));
5904  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5905  }
5906  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
5907  {
5908  // uint 64
5909  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xcf));
5910  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5911  }
5912  }
5913  else
5914  {
5915  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= -32)
5916  {
5917  // negative fixnum
5918  write_number(static_cast<int8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5919  }
5920  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::min)() and
5921  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::max)())
5922  {
5923  // int 8
5924  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xd0));
5925  write_number(static_cast<int8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5926  }
5927  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::min)() and
5928  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::max)())
5929  {
5930  // int 16
5931  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xd1));
5932  write_number(static_cast<int16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5933  }
5934  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::min)() and
5935  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max)())
5936  {
5937  // int 32
5938  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xd2));
5939  write_number(static_cast<int32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5940  }
5941  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min)() and
5942  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max)())
5943  {
5944  // int 64
5945  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xd3));
5946  write_number(static_cast<int64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5947  }
5948  }
5949  break;
5950  }
5951 
5952  case value_t::number_unsigned:
5953  {
5954  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned < 128)
5955  {
5956  // positive fixnum
5957  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5958  }
5959  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
5960  {
5961  // uint 8
5962  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xcc));
5963  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5964  }
5965  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
5966  {
5967  // uint 16
5968  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xcd));
5969  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5970  }
5971  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
5972  {
5973  // uint 32
5974  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xce));
5975  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5976  }
5977  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
5978  {
5979  // uint 64
5980  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xcf));
5981  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5982  }
5983  break;
5984  }
5985 
5986  case value_t::number_float:
5987  {
5988  // float 64
5989  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xcb));
5990  write_number(j.m_value.number_float);
5991  break;
5992  }
5993 
5994  case value_t::string:
5995  {
5996  // step 1: write control byte and the string length
5997  const auto N = j.m_value.string->size();
5998  if (N <= 31)
5999  {
6000  // fixstr
6001  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0xa0 | N));
6002  }
6003  else if (N <= 255)
6004  {
6005  // str 8
6006  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xd9));
6007  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
6008  }
6009  else if (N <= 65535)
6010  {
6011  // str 16
6012  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xda));
6013  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
6014  }
6015  else if (N <= 4294967295)
6016  {
6017  // str 32
6018  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xdb));
6019  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
6020  }
6021 
6022  // step 2: write the string
6023  oa->write_characters(
6024  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(j.m_value.string->c_str()),
6025  j.m_value.string->size());
6026  break;
6027  }
6028 
6029  case value_t::array:
6030  {
6031  // step 1: write control byte and the array size
6032  const auto N = j.m_value.array->size();
6033  if (N <= 15)
6034  {
6035  // fixarray
6036  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x90 | N));
6037  }
6038  else if (N <= 0xffff)
6039  {
6040  // array 16
6041  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xdc));
6042  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
6043  }
6044  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
6045  {
6046  // array 32
6047  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xdd));
6048  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
6049  }
6050 
6051  // step 2: write each element
6052  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.array)
6053  {
6054  write_msgpack(el);
6055  }
6056  break;
6057  }
6058 
6059  case value_t::object:
6060  {
6061  // step 1: write control byte and the object size
6062  const auto N = j.m_value.object->size();
6063  if (N <= 15)
6064  {
6065  // fixmap
6066  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 | (N & 0xf)));
6067  }
6068  else if (N <= 65535)
6069  {
6070  // map 16
6071  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xde));
6072  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
6073  }
6074  else if (N <= 4294967295)
6075  {
6076  // map 32
6077  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xdf));
6078  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
6079  }
6080 
6081  // step 2: write each element
6082  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.object)
6083  {
6084  write_msgpack(el.first);
6085  write_msgpack(el.second);
6086  }
6087  break;
6088  }
6089 
6090  default:
6091  {
6092  break;
6093  }
6094  }
6095  }
6096 
6097  private:
6098  /*
6099  @brief write a number to output input
6100 
6101  @param[in] n number of type @a NumberType
6102  @tparam NumberType the type of the number
6103 
6104  @note This function needs to respect the system's endianess, because bytes
6105  in CBOR and MessagePack are stored in network order (big endian) and
6106  therefore need reordering on little endian systems.
6107  */
6108  template<typename NumberType> void write_number(NumberType n)
6109  {
6110  // step 1: write number to array of length NumberType
6111  std::array<CharType, sizeof(NumberType)> vec;
6112  std::memcpy(vec.data(), &n, sizeof(NumberType));
6113 
6114  // step 2: write array to output (with possible reordering)
6115  if (is_little_endian)
6116  {
6117  // reverse byte order prior to conversion if necessary
6118  std::reverse(vec.begin(), vec.end());
6119  }
6120 
6121  oa->write_characters(vec.data(), sizeof(NumberType));
6122  }
6123 
6124  private:
6126  const bool is_little_endian = binary_reader<BasicJsonType>::little_endianess();
6127 
6129  output_adapter_t<CharType> oa = nullptr;
6130 };
6131 
6133 // serialization //
6135 
6136 template<typename BasicJsonType>
6137 class serializer
6138 {
6139  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
6140  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
6141  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
6142  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
6143  public:
6148  serializer(output_adapter_t<char> s, const char ichar)
6149  : o(s), loc(std::localeconv()),
6150  thousands_sep(loc->thousands_sep == nullptr ? '\0' : loc->thousands_sep[0]),
6151  decimal_point(loc->decimal_point == nullptr ? '\0' : loc->decimal_point[0]),
6152  indent_char(ichar), indent_string(512, indent_char) {}
6153 
6154  // delete because of pointer members
6155  serializer(const serializer&) = delete;
6156  serializer& operator=(const serializer&) = delete;
6157 
6175  void dump(const BasicJsonType& val, const bool pretty_print,
6176  const bool ensure_ascii,
6177  const unsigned int indent_step,
6178  const unsigned int current_indent = 0)
6179  {
6180  switch (val.m_type)
6181  {
6182  case value_t::object:
6183  {
6184  if (val.m_value.object->empty())
6185  {
6186  o->write_characters("{}", 2);
6187  return;
6188  }
6189 
6190  if (pretty_print)
6191  {
6192  o->write_characters("{\n", 2);
6193 
6194  // variable to hold indentation for recursive calls
6195  const auto new_indent = current_indent + indent_step;
6196  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(indent_string.size() < new_indent))
6197  {
6198  indent_string.resize(indent_string.size() * 2, ' ');
6199  }
6200 
6201  // first n-1 elements
6202  auto i = val.m_value.object->cbegin();
6203  for (std::size_t cnt = 0; cnt < val.m_value.object->size() - 1; ++cnt, ++i)
6204  {
6205  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6206  o->write_character('\"');
6207  dump_escaped(i->first, ensure_ascii);
6208  o->write_characters("\": ", 3);
6209  dump(i->second, true, ensure_ascii, indent_step, new_indent);
6210  o->write_characters(",\n", 2);
6211  }
6212 
6213  // last element
6214  assert(i != val.m_value.object->cend());
6215  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6216  o->write_character('\"');
6217  dump_escaped(i->first, ensure_ascii);
6218  o->write_characters("\": ", 3);
6219  dump(i->second, true, ensure_ascii, indent_step, new_indent);
6220 
6221  o->write_character('\n');
6222  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), current_indent);
6223  o->write_character('}');
6224  }
6225  else
6226  {
6227  o->write_character('{');
6228 
6229  // first n-1 elements
6230  auto i = val.m_value.object->cbegin();
6231  for (std::size_t cnt = 0; cnt < val.m_value.object->size() - 1; ++cnt, ++i)
6232  {
6233  o->write_character('\"');
6234  dump_escaped(i->first, ensure_ascii);
6235  o->write_characters("\":", 2);
6236  dump(i->second, false, ensure_ascii, indent_step, current_indent);
6237  o->write_character(',');
6238  }
6239 
6240  // last element
6241  assert(i != val.m_value.object->cend());
6242  o->write_character('\"');
6243  dump_escaped(i->first, ensure_ascii);
6244  o->write_characters("\":", 2);
6245  dump(i->second, false, ensure_ascii, indent_step, current_indent);
6246 
6247  o->write_character('}');
6248  }
6249 
6250  return;
6251  }
6252 
6253  case value_t::array:
6254  {
6255  if (val.m_value.array->empty())
6256  {
6257  o->write_characters("[]", 2);
6258  return;
6259  }
6260 
6261  if (pretty_print)
6262  {
6263  o->write_characters("[\n", 2);
6264 
6265  // variable to hold indentation for recursive calls
6266  const auto new_indent = current_indent + indent_step;
6267  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(indent_string.size() < new_indent))
6268  {
6269  indent_string.resize(indent_string.size() * 2, ' ');
6270  }
6271 
6272  // first n-1 elements
6273  for (auto i = val.m_value.array->cbegin();
6274  i != val.m_value.array->cend() - 1; ++i)
6275  {
6276  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6277  dump(*i, true, ensure_ascii, indent_step, new_indent);
6278  o->write_characters(",\n", 2);
6279  }
6280 
6281  // last element
6282  assert(not val.m_value.array->empty());
6283  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6284  dump(val.m_value.array->back(), true, ensure_ascii, indent_step, new_indent);
6285 
6286  o->write_character('\n');
6287  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), current_indent);
6288  o->write_character(']');
6289  }
6290  else
6291  {
6292  o->write_character('[');
6293 
6294  // first n-1 elements
6295  for (auto i = val.m_value.array->cbegin();
6296  i != val.m_value.array->cend() - 1; ++i)
6297  {
6298  dump(*i, false, ensure_ascii, indent_step, current_indent);
6299  o->write_character(',');
6300  }
6301 
6302  // last element
6303  assert(not val.m_value.array->empty());
6304  dump(val.m_value.array->back(), false, ensure_ascii, indent_step, current_indent);
6305 
6306  o->write_character(']');
6307  }
6308 
6309  return;
6310  }
6311 
6312  case value_t::string:
6313  {
6314  o->write_character('\"');
6315  dump_escaped(*val.m_value.string, ensure_ascii);
6316  o->write_character('\"');
6317  return;
6318  }
6319 
6320  case value_t::boolean:
6321  {
6322  if (val.m_value.boolean)
6323  {
6324  o->write_characters("true", 4);
6325  }
6326  else
6327  {
6328  o->write_characters("false", 5);
6329  }
6330  return;
6331  }
6332 
6333  case value_t::number_integer:
6334  {
6335  dump_integer(val.m_value.number_integer);
6336  return;
6337  }
6338 
6339  case value_t::number_unsigned:
6340  {
6341  dump_integer(val.m_value.number_unsigned);
6342  return;
6343  }
6344 
6345  case value_t::number_float:
6346  {
6347  dump_float(val.m_value.number_float);
6348  return;
6349  }
6350 
6351  case value_t::discarded:
6352  {
6353  o->write_characters("<discarded>", 11);
6354  return;
6355  }
6356 
6357  case value_t::null:
6358  {
6359  o->write_characters("null", 4);
6360  return;
6361  }
6362  }
6363  }
6364 
6365  private:
6372  static constexpr std::size_t bytes_following(const uint8_t u)
6373  {
6374  return ((0 <= u and u <= 127) ? 0
6375  : ((192 <= u and u <= 223) ? 1
6376  : ((224 <= u and u <= 239) ? 2
6377  : ((240 <= u and u <= 247) ? 3 : std::string::npos))));
6378  }
6379 
6390  static std::size_t extra_space(const string_t& s,
6391  const bool ensure_ascii) noexcept
6392  {
6393  std::size_t res = 0;
6394 
6395  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < s.size(); ++i)
6396  {
6397  switch (s[i])
6398  {
6399  // control characters that can be escaped with a backslash
6400  case '"':
6401  case '\\':
6402  case '\b':
6403  case '\f':
6404  case '\n':
6405  case '\r':
6406  case '\t':
6407  {
6408  // from c (1 byte) to \x (2 bytes)
6409  res += 1;
6410  break;
6411  }
6412 
6413  // control characters that need \uxxxx escaping
6414  case 0x00:
6415  case 0x01:
6416  case 0x02:
6417  case 0x03:
6418  case 0x04:
6419  case 0x05:
6420  case 0x06:
6421  case 0x07:
6422  case 0x0b:
6423  case 0x0e:
6424  case 0x0f:
6425  case 0x10:
6426  case 0x11:
6427  case 0x12:
6428  case 0x13:
6429  case 0x14:
6430  case 0x15:
6431  case 0x16:
6432  case 0x17:
6433  case 0x18:
6434  case 0x19:
6435  case 0x1a:
6436  case 0x1b:
6437  case 0x1c:
6438  case 0x1d:
6439  case 0x1e:
6440  case 0x1f:
6441  {
6442  // from c (1 byte) to \uxxxx (6 bytes)
6443  res += 5;
6444  break;
6445  }
6446 
6447  default:
6448  {
6449  if (ensure_ascii and (s[i] & 0x80 or s[i] == 0x7F))
6450  {
6451  const auto bytes = bytes_following(static_cast<uint8_t>(s[i]));
6452  if (bytes == std::string::npos)
6453  {
6454  // invalid characters are treated as is, so no
6455  // additional space will be used
6456  break;
6457  }
6458 
6459  if (bytes == 3)
6460  {
6461  // codepoints that need 4 bytes (i.e., 3 additional
6462  // bytes) in UTF-8 needs a surrogate pair when \u
6463  // escaping is used: from 4 bytes to \uxxxx\uxxxx
6464  // (12 bytes)
6465  res += (12 - bytes - 1);
6466  }
6467  else
6468  {
6469  // from x bytes to \uxxxx (6 bytes)
6470  res += (6 - bytes - 1);
6471  }
6472 
6473  // skip the additional bytes
6474  i += bytes;
6475  }
6476  break;
6477  }
6478  }
6479  }
6480 
6481  return res;
6482  }
6483 
6484  static void escape_codepoint(int codepoint, string_t& result, size_t& pos)
6485  {
6486  // expecting a proper codepoint
6487  assert(0x00 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0x10FFFF);
6488 
6489  // the last written character was the backslash before the 'u'
6490  assert(result[pos] == '\\');
6491 
6492  // write the 'u'
6493  result[++pos] = 'u';
6494 
6495  // convert a number 0..15 to its hex representation (0..f)
6496  static const std::array<char, 16> hexify =
6497  {
6498  {
6499  '0', '1', '2', '3', '4', '5', '6', '7',
6500  '8', '9', 'a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f'
6501  }
6502  };
6503 
6504  if (codepoint < 0x10000)
6505  {
6506  // codepoints U+0000..U+FFFF can be represented as \uxxxx.
6507  result[++pos] = hexify[(codepoint >> 12) & 0x0F];
6508  result[++pos] = hexify[(codepoint >> 8) & 0x0F];
6509  result[++pos] = hexify[(codepoint >> 4) & 0x0F];
6510  result[++pos] = hexify[codepoint & 0x0F];
6511  }
6512  else
6513  {
6514  // codepoints U+10000..U+10FFFF need a surrogate pair to be
6515  // represented as \uxxxx\uxxxx.
6516  // http://www.unicode.org/faq/utf_bom.html#utf16-4
6517  codepoint -= 0x10000;
6518  const int high_surrogate = 0xD800 | ((codepoint >> 10) & 0x3FF);
6519  const int low_surrogate = 0xDC00 | (codepoint & 0x3FF);
6520  result[++pos] = hexify[(high_surrogate >> 12) & 0x0F];
6521  result[++pos] = hexify[(high_surrogate >> 8) & 0x0F];
6522  result[++pos] = hexify[(high_surrogate >> 4) & 0x0F];
6523  result[++pos] = hexify[high_surrogate & 0x0F];
6524  ++pos; // backslash is already in output
6525  result[++pos] = 'u';
6526  result[++pos] = hexify[(low_surrogate >> 12) & 0x0F];
6527  result[++pos] = hexify[(low_surrogate >> 8) & 0x0F];
6528  result[++pos] = hexify[(low_surrogate >> 4) & 0x0F];
6529  result[++pos] = hexify[low_surrogate & 0x0F];
6530  }
6531 
6532  ++pos;
6533  }
6534 
6549  void dump_escaped(const string_t& s, const bool ensure_ascii) const
6550  {
6551  const auto space = extra_space(s, ensure_ascii);
6552  if (space == 0)
6553  {
6554  o->write_characters(s.c_str(), s.size());
6555  return;
6556  }
6557 
6558  // create a result string of necessary size
6559  string_t result(s.size() + space, '\\');
6560  std::size_t pos = 0;
6561 
6562  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < s.size(); ++i)
6563  {
6564  switch (s[i])
6565  {
6566  // quotation mark (0x22)
6567  case '"':
6568  {
6569  result[pos + 1] = '"';
6570  pos += 2;
6571  break;
6572  }
6573 
6574  // reverse solidus (0x5c)
6575  case '\\':
6576  {
6577  // nothing to change
6578  pos += 2;
6579  break;
6580  }
6581 
6582  // backspace (0x08)
6583  case '\b':
6584  {
6585  result[pos + 1] = 'b';
6586  pos += 2;
6587  break;
6588  }
6589 
6590  // formfeed (0x0c)
6591  case '\f':
6592  {
6593  result[pos + 1] = 'f';
6594  pos += 2;
6595  break;
6596  }
6597 
6598  // newline (0x0a)
6599  case '\n':
6600  {
6601  result[pos + 1] = 'n';
6602  pos += 2;
6603  break;
6604  }
6605 
6606  // carriage return (0x0d)
6607  case '\r':
6608  {
6609  result[pos + 1] = 'r';
6610  pos += 2;
6611  break;
6612  }
6613 
6614  // horizontal tab (0x09)
6615  case '\t':
6616  {
6617  result[pos + 1] = 't';
6618  pos += 2;
6619  break;
6620  }
6621 
6622  default:
6623  {
6624  // escape control characters (0x00..0x1F) or, if
6625  // ensure_ascii parameter is used, non-ASCII characters
6626  if ((0x00 <= s[i] and s[i] <= 0x1F) or
6627  (ensure_ascii and (s[i] & 0x80 or s[i] == 0x7F)))
6628  {
6629  const auto bytes = bytes_following(static_cast<uint8_t>(s[i]));
6630  if (bytes == std::string::npos)
6631  {
6632  // copy invalid character as is
6633  result[pos++] = s[i];
6634  break;
6635  }
6636 
6637  // check that the additional bytes are present
6638  assert(i + bytes < s.size());
6639 
6640  // to use\uxxxx escaping, we first need to caluclate
6641  // the codepoint from the UTF-8 bytes
6642  int codepoint = 0;
6643 
6644  assert(0 <= bytes and bytes <= 3);
6645  switch (bytes)
6646  {
6647  case 0:
6648  {
6649  codepoint = s[i] & 0xFF;
6650  break;
6651  }
6652 
6653  case 1:
6654  {
6655  codepoint = ((s[i] & 0x3F) << 6)
6656  + (s[i + 1] & 0x7F);
6657  break;
6658  }
6659 
6660  case 2:
6661  {
6662  codepoint = ((s[i] & 0x1F) << 12)
6663  + ((s[i + 1] & 0x7F) << 6)
6664  + (s[i + 2] & 0x7F);
6665  break;
6666  }
6667 
6668  case 3:
6669  {
6670  codepoint = ((s[i] & 0xF) << 18)
6671  + ((s[i + 1] & 0x7F) << 12)
6672  + ((s[i + 2] & 0x7F) << 6)
6673  + (s[i + 3] & 0x7F);
6674  break;
6675  }
6676  }
6677 
6678  escape_codepoint(codepoint, result, pos);
6679  i += bytes;
6680  }
6681  else
6682  {
6683  // all other characters are added as-is
6684  result[pos++] = s[i];
6685  }
6686  break;
6687  }
6688  }
6689  }
6690 
6691  assert(pos == result.size());
6692  o->write_characters(result.c_str(), result.size());
6693  }
6694 
6704  template <
6705  typename NumberType,
6706  detail::enable_if_t<std::is_same<NumberType, number_unsigned_t>::value or
6707  std::is_same<NumberType, number_integer_t>::value,
6708  int> = 0 >
6709  void dump_integer(NumberType x)
6710  {
6711  // special case for "0"
6712  if (x == 0)
6713  {
6714  o->write_character('0');
6715  return;
6716  }
6717 
6718  const bool is_negative = x < 0;
6719  std::size_t i = 0;
6720 
6721  // spare 1 byte for '\0'
6722  while (x != 0 and i < number_buffer.size() - 1)
6723  {
6724  const auto digit = std::labs(static_cast<long>(x % 10));
6725  number_buffer[i++] = static_cast<char>('0' + digit);
6726  x /= 10;
6727  }
6728 
6729  // make sure the number has been processed completely
6730  assert(x == 0);
6731 
6732  if (is_negative)
6733  {
6734  // make sure there is capacity for the '-'
6735  assert(i < number_buffer.size() - 2);
6736  number_buffer[i++] = '-';
6737  }
6738 
6739  std::reverse(number_buffer.begin(), number_buffer.begin() + i);
6740  o->write_characters(number_buffer.data(), i);
6741  }
6742 
6751  void dump_float(number_float_t x)
6752  {
6753  // NaN / inf
6754  if (not std::isfinite(x) or std::isnan(x))
6755  {
6756  o->write_characters("null", 4);
6757  return;
6758  }
6759 
6760  // special case for 0.0 and -0.0
6761  if (x == 0)
6762  {
6763  if (std::signbit(x))
6764  {
6765  o->write_characters("-0.0", 4);
6766  }
6767  else
6768  {
6769  o->write_characters("0.0", 3);
6770  }
6771  return;
6772  }
6773 
6774  // get number of digits for a text -> float -> text round-trip
6775  static constexpr auto d = std::numeric_limits<number_float_t>::digits10;
6776 
6777  // the actual conversion
6778  std::ptrdiff_t len = snprintf(number_buffer.data(), number_buffer.size(), "%.*g", d, x);
6779 
6780  // negative value indicates an error
6781  assert(len > 0);
6782  // check if buffer was large enough
6783  assert(static_cast<size_t>(len) < number_buffer.size());
6784 
6785  // erase thousands separator
6786  if (thousands_sep != '\0')
6787  {
6788  const auto end = std::remove(number_buffer.begin(),
6789  number_buffer.begin() + len, thousands_sep);
6790  std::fill(end, number_buffer.end(), '\0');
6791  assert((end - number_buffer.begin()) <= len);
6792  len = (end - number_buffer.begin());
6793  }
6794 
6795  // convert decimal point to '.'
6796  if (decimal_point != '\0' and decimal_point != '.')
6797  {
6798  for (auto& c : number_buffer)
6799  {
6800  if (c == decimal_point)
6801  {
6802  c = '.';
6803  break;
6804  }
6805  }
6806  }
6807 
6808  o->write_characters(number_buffer.data(), static_cast<size_t>(len));
6809 
6810  // determine if need to append ".0"
6811  const bool value_is_int_like =
6812  std::none_of(number_buffer.begin(), number_buffer.begin() + len + 1,
6813  [](char c)
6814  {
6815  return (c == '.' or c == 'e');
6816  });
6817 
6818  if (value_is_int_like)
6819  {
6820  o->write_characters(".0", 2);
6821  }
6822  }
6823 
6824  private:
6826  output_adapter_t<char> o = nullptr;
6827 
6829  std::array<char, 64> number_buffer{{}};
6830 
6832  const std::lconv* loc = nullptr;
6834  const char thousands_sep = '\0';
6836  const char decimal_point = '\0';
6837 
6839  const char indent_char;
6840 
6842  string_t indent_string;
6843 };
6844 
6845 template<typename BasicJsonType>
6846 class json_ref
6847 {
6848  public:
6849  using value_type = BasicJsonType;
6850 
6851  json_ref(value_type&& value)
6852  : owned_value(std::move(value)),
6853  value_ref(&owned_value),
6854  is_rvalue(true)
6855  {}
6856 
6857  json_ref(const value_type& value)
6858  : value_ref(const_cast<value_type*>(&value)),
6859  is_rvalue(false)
6860  {}
6861 
6862  json_ref(std::initializer_list<json_ref> init)
6863  : owned_value(init),
6864  value_ref(&owned_value),
6865  is_rvalue(true)
6866  {}
6867 
6868  template <class... Args>
6869  json_ref(Args... args)
6870  : owned_value(std::forward<Args>(args)...),
6871  value_ref(&owned_value),
6872  is_rvalue(true)
6873  {}
6874 
6875  // class should be movable only
6876  json_ref(json_ref&&) = default;
6877  json_ref(const json_ref&) = delete;
6878  json_ref& operator=(const json_ref&) = delete;
6879 
6880  value_type moved_or_copied() const
6881  {
6882  if (is_rvalue)
6883  {
6884  return std::move(*value_ref);
6885  }
6886  else
6887  {
6888  return *value_ref;
6889  }
6890  }
6891 
6892  value_type const& operator*() const
6893  {
6894  return *static_cast<value_type const*>(value_ref);
6895  }
6896 
6897  value_type const* operator->() const
6898  {
6899  return static_cast<value_type const*>(value_ref);
6900  }
6901 
6902  private:
6903  mutable value_type owned_value = nullptr;
6904  value_type* value_ref = nullptr;
6905  const bool is_rvalue;
6906 };
6907 
6908 } // namespace detail
6909 
6911 namespace
6912 {
6913 constexpr const auto& to_json = detail::static_const<detail::to_json_fn>::value;
6914 constexpr const auto& from_json = detail::static_const<detail::from_json_fn>::value;
6915 }
6916 
6917 
6925 template<typename, typename>
6926 struct adl_serializer
6927 {
6937  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ValueType>
6938  static void from_json(BasicJsonType&& j, ValueType& val) noexcept(
6939  noexcept(::nlohmann::from_json(std::forward<BasicJsonType>(j), val)))
6940  {
6941  ::nlohmann::from_json(std::forward<BasicJsonType>(j), val);
6942  }
6943 
6953  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ValueType>
6954  static void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, ValueType&& val) noexcept(
6955  noexcept(::nlohmann::to_json(j, std::forward<ValueType>(val))))
6956  {
6957  ::nlohmann::to_json(j, std::forward<ValueType>(val));
6958  }
6959 };
6960 
6972 class json_pointer
6973 {
6975  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
6976  friend class basic_json;
6977 
6978  public:
7000  explicit json_pointer(const std::string& s = "") : reference_tokens(split(s)) {}
7001 
7017  std::string to_string() const noexcept
7018  {
7019  return std::accumulate(reference_tokens.begin(), reference_tokens.end(),
7020  std::string{},
7021  [](const std::string & a, const std::string & b)
7022  {
7023  return a + "/" + escape(b);
7024  });
7025  }
7026 
7028  operator std::string() const
7029  {
7030  return to_string();
7031  }
7032 
7033  private:
7038  std::string pop_back()
7039  {
7040  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(is_root()))
7041  {
7042  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(405, "JSON pointer has no parent"));
7043  }
7044 
7045  auto last = reference_tokens.back();
7046  reference_tokens.pop_back();
7047  return last;
7048  }
7049 
7051  bool is_root() const
7052  {
7053  return reference_tokens.empty();
7054  }
7055 
7056  json_pointer top() const
7057  {
7058  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(is_root()))
7059  {
7060  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(405, "JSON pointer has no parent"));
7061  }
7062 
7063  json_pointer result = *this;
7064  result.reference_tokens = {reference_tokens[0]};
7065  return result;
7066  }
7067 
7068 
7077  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
7078  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& get_and_create(NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& j) const;
7079 
7099  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
7100  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& get_unchecked(NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const;
7101
