7108  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
7109  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& get_checked(NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const;
7110 
7124  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
7125  const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& get_unchecked(const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const;
7126 
7133  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
7134  const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& get_checked(const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const;
7135 
7145  static std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string& reference_string)
7146  {
7147  std::vector<std::string> result;
7148 
7149  // special case: empty reference string -> no reference tokens
7150  if (reference_string.empty())
7151  {
7152  return result;
7153  }
7154 
7155  // check if nonempty reference string begins with slash
7156  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_string[0] != '/'))
7157  {
7158  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(107, 1,
7159  "JSON pointer must be empty or begin with '/' - was: '" +
7160  reference_string + "'"));
7161  }
7162 
7163  // extract the reference tokens:
7164  // - slash: position of the last read slash (or end of string)
7165  // - start: position after the previous slash
7166  for (
7167  // search for the first slash after the first character
7168  std::size_t slash = reference_string.find_first_of('/', 1),
7169  // set the beginning of the first reference token
7170  start = 1;
7171  // we can stop if start == string::npos+1 = 0
7172  start != 0;
7173  // set the beginning of the next reference token
7174  // (will eventually be 0 if slash == std::string::npos)
7175  start = slash + 1,
7176  // find next slash
7177  slash = reference_string.find_first_of('/', start))
7178  {
7179  // use the text between the beginning of the reference token
7180  // (start) and the last slash (slash).
7181  auto reference_token = reference_string.substr(start, slash - start);
7182 
7183  // check reference tokens are properly escaped
7184  for (std::size_t pos = reference_token.find_first_of('~');
7185  pos != std::string::npos;
7186  pos = reference_token.find_first_of('~', pos + 1))
7187  {
7188  assert(reference_token[pos] == '~');
7189 
7190  // ~ must be followed by 0 or 1
7191  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos == reference_token.size() - 1 or
7192  (reference_token[pos + 1] != '0' and
7193  reference_token[pos + 1] != '1')))
7194  {
7195  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(108, 0, "escape character '~' must be followed with '0' or '1'"));
7196  }
7197  }
7198 
7199  // finally, store the reference token
7200  unescape(reference_token);
7201  result.push_back(reference_token);
7202  }
7203 
7204  return result;
7205  }
7206 
7220  static void replace_substring(std::string& s, const std::string& f,
7221  const std::string& t)
7222  {
7223  assert(not f.empty());
7224  for (auto pos = s.find(f); // find first occurrence of f
7225  pos != std::string::npos; // make sure f was found
7226  s.replace(pos, f.size(), t), // replace with t, and
7227  pos = s.find(f, pos + t.size())) // find next occurrence of f
7228  {}
7229  }
7230 
7232  static std::string escape(std::string s)
7233  {
7234  replace_substring(s, "~", "~0");
7235  replace_substring(s, "/", "~1");
7236  return s;
7237  }
7238 
7240  static void unescape(std::string& s)
7241  {
7242  replace_substring(s, "~1", "/");
7243  replace_substring(s, "~0", "~");
7244  }
7245 
7253  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
7254  static void flatten(const std::string& reference_string,
7255  const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& value,
7256  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& result);
7257 
7268  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
7269  static NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL
7270  unflatten(const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& value);
7271 
7272  friend bool operator==(json_pointer const& lhs,
7273  json_pointer const& rhs) noexcept;
7274 
7275  friend bool operator!=(json_pointer const& lhs,
7276  json_pointer const& rhs) noexcept;
7277 
7279  std::vector<std::string> reference_tokens;
7280 };
7281 
7363 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
7364 class basic_json
7365 {
7366  private:
7367  template<detail::value_t> friend struct detail::external_constructor;
7368  friend ::nlohmann::json_pointer;
7369  friend ::nlohmann::detail::parser<basic_json>;
7370  friend ::nlohmann::detail::serializer<basic_json>;
7371  template<typename BasicJsonType>
7372  friend class ::nlohmann::detail::iter_impl;
7373  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CharType>
7374  friend class ::nlohmann::detail::binary_writer;
7376  using basic_json_t = NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL;
7377 
7378  // convenience aliases for types residing in namespace detail;
7379  using lexer = ::nlohmann::detail::lexer<basic_json>;
7380  using parser = ::nlohmann::detail::parser<basic_json>;
7381 
7382  using primitive_iterator_t = ::nlohmann::detail::primitive_iterator_t;
7383  template<typename BasicJsonType>
7384  using internal_iterator = ::nlohmann::detail::internal_iterator<BasicJsonType>;
7385  template<typename BasicJsonType>
7386  using iter_impl = ::nlohmann::detail::iter_impl<BasicJsonType>;
7387  template<typename Iterator>
7388  using iteration_proxy = ::nlohmann::detail::iteration_proxy<Iterator>;
7389  template<typename Base> using json_reverse_iterator = ::nlohmann::detail::json_reverse_iterator<Base>;
7390 
7391  template<typename CharType>
7392  using output_adapter_t = ::nlohmann::detail::output_adapter_t<CharType>;
7393 
7394  using binary_reader = ::nlohmann::detail::binary_reader<basic_json>;
7395  template<typename CharType> using binary_writer = ::nlohmann::detail::binary_writer<basic_json, CharType>;
7396 
7397  using serializer = ::nlohmann::detail::serializer<basic_json>;
7398 
7399  public:
7400  using value_t = detail::value_t;
7401  // forward declarations
7402  using json_pointer = ::nlohmann::json_pointer;
7403  template<typename T, typename SFINAE>
7404  using json_serializer = JSONSerializer<T, SFINAE>;
7405 
7406  using initializer_list_t = std::initializer_list<detail::json_ref<basic_json>>;
7407 
7409  // exceptions //
7411 
7415 
7417  using exception = detail::exception;
7419  using parse_error = detail::parse_error;
7421  using invalid_iterator = detail::invalid_iterator;
7423  using type_error = detail::type_error;
7425  using out_of_range = detail::out_of_range;
7427  using other_error = detail::other_error;
7428 
7430 
7431 
7433  // container types //
7435 
7440 
7442  using value_type = basic_json;
7443 
7445  using reference = value_type&;
7447  using const_reference = const value_type&;
7448 
7450  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
7452  using size_type = std::size_t;
7453 
7455  using allocator_type = AllocatorType<basic_json>;
7456 
7458  using pointer = typename std::allocator_traits<allocator_type>::pointer;
7460  using const_pointer = typename std::allocator_traits<allocator_type>::const_pointer;
7461 
7463  using iterator = iter_impl<basic_json>;
7465  using const_iterator = iter_impl<const basic_json>;
7467  using reverse_iterator = json_reverse_iterator<typename basic_json::iterator>;
7469  using const_reverse_iterator = json_reverse_iterator<typename basic_json::const_iterator>;
7470 
7472 
7473 
7477  static allocator_type get_allocator()
7478  {
7479  return allocator_type();
7480  }
7481 
7505  static basic_json meta()
7506  {
7507  basic_json result;
7508 
7509  result["copyright"] = "(C) 2013-2017 Niels Lohmann";
7510  result["name"] = "JSON for Modern C++";
7511  result["url"] = "https://github.com/nlohmann/json";
7512  result["version"] =
7513  {
7514  {"string", "2.1.1"}, {"major", 2}, {"minor", 1}, {"patch", 1}
7515  };
7516 
7517 #ifdef _WIN32
7518  result["platform"] = "win32";
7519 #elif defined __linux__
7520  result["platform"] = "linux";
7521 #elif defined __APPLE__
7522  result["platform"] = "apple";
7523 #elif defined __unix__
7524  result["platform"] = "unix";
7525 #else
7526  result["platform"] = "unknown";
7527 #endif
7528 
7529 #if defined(__clang__)
7530  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "clang"}, {"version", __clang_version__}};
7531 #elif defined(__ICC) || defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
7532  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "icc"}, {"version", __INTEL_COMPILER}};
7533 #elif defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
7534  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "gcc"}, {"version", std::to_string(__GNUC__) + "." + std::to_string(__GNUC_MINOR__) + "." + std::to_string(__GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__)}};
7535 #elif defined(__HP_cc) || defined(__HP_aCC)
7536  result["compiler"] = "hp"
7537 #elif defined(__IBMCPP__)
7538  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "ilecpp"}, {"version", __IBMCPP__}};
7539 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
7540  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "msvc"}, {"version", _MSC_VER}};
7541 #elif defined(__PGI)
7542  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "pgcpp"}, {"version", __PGI}};
7543 #elif defined(__SUNPRO_CC)
7544  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "sunpro"}, {"version", __SUNPRO_CC}};
7545 #else
7546  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "unknown"}, {"version", "unknown"}};
7547 #endif
7548 
7549 #ifdef __cplusplus
7550  result["compiler"]["c++"] = std::to_string(__cplusplus);
7551 #else
7552  result["compiler"]["c++"] = "unknown";
7553 #endif
7554  return result;
7555  }
7556 
7557 
7559  // JSON value data types //
7561 
7566 
7650  using object_t = ObjectType<StringType,
7651  basic_json,
7652  std::less<StringType>,
7653  AllocatorType<std::pair<const StringType,
7654  basic_json>>>;
7655 
7700  using array_t = ArrayType<basic_json, AllocatorType<basic_json>>;
7701 
7753  using string_t = StringType;
7754 
7779  using boolean_t = BooleanType;
7780 
7851  using number_integer_t = NumberIntegerType;
7852 
7922  using number_unsigned_t = NumberUnsignedType;
7923 
7990  using number_float_t = NumberFloatType;
7991 
7993 
7994  private:
7995 
7997  template<typename T, typename... Args>
7998  static T* create(Args&& ... args)
7999  {
8000  AllocatorType<T> alloc;
8001  auto deleter = [&](T * object)
8002  {
8003  alloc.deallocate(object, 1);
8004  };
8005  std::unique_ptr<T, decltype(deleter)> object(alloc.allocate(1), deleter);
8006  alloc.construct(object.get(), std::forward<Args>(args)...);
8007  assert(object != nullptr);
8008  return object.release();
8009  }
8010 
8012  // JSON value storage //
8014 
8039  union json_value
8040  {
8042  object_t* object;
8044  array_t* array;
8046  string_t* string;
8048  boolean_t boolean;
8050  number_integer_t number_integer;
8052  number_unsigned_t number_unsigned;
8054  number_float_t number_float;
8055 
8057  json_value() = default;
8059  json_value(boolean_t v) noexcept : boolean(v) {}
8061  json_value(number_integer_t v) noexcept : number_integer(v) {}
8063  json_value(number_unsigned_t v) noexcept : number_unsigned(v) {}
8065  json_value(number_float_t v) noexcept : number_float(v) {}
8067  json_value(value_t t)
8068  {
8069  switch (t)
8070  {
8071  case value_t::object:
8072  {
8073  object = create<object_t>();
8074  break;
8075  }
8076 
8077  case value_t::array:
8078  {
8079  array = create<array_t>();
8080  break;
8081  }
8082 
8083  case value_t::string:
8084  {
8085  string = create<string_t>("");
8086  break;
8087  }
8088 
8089  case value_t::boolean:
8090  {
8091  boolean = boolean_t(false);
8092  break;
8093  }
8094 
8095  case value_t::number_integer:
8096  {
8097  number_integer = number_integer_t(0);
8098  break;
8099  }
8100 
8101  case value_t::number_unsigned:
8102  {
8103  number_unsigned = number_unsigned_t(0);
8104  break;
8105  }
8106 
8107  case value_t::number_float:
8108  {
8109  number_float = number_float_t(0.0);
8110  break;
8111  }
8112 
8113  case value_t::null:
8114  {
8115  break;
8116  }
8117 
8118  default:
8119  {
8120  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(t == value_t::null))
8121  {
8122  JSON_THROW(other_error::create(500, "961c151d2e87f2686a955a9be24d316f1362bf21 2.1.1")); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8123  }
8124  break;
8125  }
8126  }
8127  }
8128 
8130  json_value(const string_t& value)
8131  {
8132  string = create<string_t>(value);
8133  }
8134 
8136  json_value(string_t&& value)
8137  {
8138  string = create<string_t>(std::move(value));
8139  }
8140 
8142  json_value(const object_t& value)
8143  {
8144  object = create<object_t>(value);
8145  }
8146 
8148  json_value(object_t&& value)
8149  {
8150  object = create<object_t>(std::move(value));
8151  }
8152 
8154  json_value(const array_t& value)
8155  {
8156  array = create<array_t>(value);
8157  }
8158 
8160  json_value(array_t&& value)
8161  {
8162  array = create<array_t>(std::move(value));
8163  }
8164 
8165  void destroy(value_t t)
8166  {
8167  switch (t)
8168  {
8169  case value_t::object:
8170  {
8171  AllocatorType<object_t> alloc;
8172  alloc.destroy(object);
8173  alloc.deallocate(object, 1);
8174  break;
8175  }
8176 
8177  case value_t::array:
8178  {
8179  AllocatorType<array_t> alloc;
8180  alloc.destroy(array);
8181  alloc.deallocate(array, 1);
8182  break;
8183  }
8184 
8185  case value_t::string:
8186  {
8187  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
8188  alloc.destroy(string);
8189  alloc.deallocate(string, 1);
8190  break;
8191  }
8192 
8193  default:
8194  {
8195  break;
8196  }
8197  }
8198  }
8199  };
8200 
8210  void assert_invariant() const
8211  {
8212  assert(m_type != value_t::object or m_value.object != nullptr);
8213  assert(m_type != value_t::array or m_value.array != nullptr);
8214  assert(m_type != value_t::string or m_value.string != nullptr);
8215  }
8216 
8217  public:
8219  // JSON parser callback //
8221 
8222  using parse_event_t = typename parser::parse_event_t;
8223 
8276  using parser_callback_t = typename parser::parser_callback_t;
8277 
8278 
8280  // constructors //
8282 
8287 
8312  basic_json(const value_t v)
8313  : m_type(v), m_value(v)
8314  {
8315  assert_invariant();
8316  }
8317 
8336  basic_json(std::nullptr_t = nullptr) noexcept
8337  : basic_json(value_t::null)
8338  {
8339  assert_invariant();
8340  }
8341 
8395  template<typename CompatibleType, typename U = detail::uncvref_t<CompatibleType>,
8396  detail::enable_if_t<not std::is_base_of<std::istream, U>::value and
8397  not std::is_same<U, basic_json_t>::value and
8398  not detail::is_basic_json_nested_type<
8399  basic_json_t, U>::value and
8400  detail::has_to_json<basic_json, U>::value,
8401  int> = 0>
8402  basic_json(CompatibleType && val) noexcept(noexcept(JSONSerializer<U>::to_json(
8403  std::declval<basic_json_t&>(), std::forward<CompatibleType>(val))))
8404  {
8405  JSONSerializer<U>::to_json(*this, std::forward<CompatibleType>(val));
8406  assert_invariant();
8407  }
8408 
8480  basic_json(initializer_list_t init,
8481  bool type_deduction = true,
8482  value_t manual_type = value_t::array)
8483  {
8484  // check if each element is an array with two elements whose first
8485  // element is a string
8486  bool is_an_object = std::all_of(init.begin(), init.end(),
8487  [](const detail::json_ref<basic_json>& element_ref)
8488  {
8489  return (element_ref->is_array() and element_ref->size() == 2 and (*element_ref)[0].is_string());
8490  });
8491 
8492  // adjust type if type deduction is not wanted
8493  if (not type_deduction)
8494  {
8495  // if array is wanted, do not create an object though possible
8496  if (manual_type == value_t::array)
8497  {
8498  is_an_object = false;
8499  }
8500 
8501  // if object is wanted but impossible, throw an exception
8502  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(manual_type == value_t::object and not is_an_object))
8503  {
8504  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(301, "cannot create object from initializer list"));
8505  }
8506  }
8507 
8508  if (is_an_object)
8509  {
8510  // the initializer list is a list of pairs -> create object
8511  m_type = value_t::object;
8512  m_value = value_t::object;
8513 
8514  std::for_each(init.begin(), init.end(), [this](const detail::json_ref<basic_json>& element_ref)
8515  {
8516  auto element = element_ref.moved_or_copied();
8517  m_value.object->emplace(
8518  std::move(*((*element.m_value.array)[0].m_value.string)),
8519  std::move((*element.m_value.array)[1]));
8520  });
8521  }
8522  else
8523  {
8524  // the initializer list describes an array -> create array
8525  m_type = value_t::array;
8526  m_value.array = create<array_t>(init.begin(), init.end());
8527  }
8528 
8529  assert_invariant();
8530  }
8531 
8566  static basic_json array(initializer_list_t init = {})
8567  {
8568  return basic_json(init, false, value_t::array);
8569  }
8570 
8606  static basic_json object(initializer_list_t init = {})
8607  {
8608  return basic_json(init, false, value_t::object);
8609  }
8610 
8629  basic_json(size_type cnt, const basic_json& val)
8630  : m_type(value_t::array)
8631  {
8632  m_value.array = create<array_t>(cnt, val);
8633  assert_invariant();
8634  }
8635 
8678  template<class InputIT, typename std::enable_if<
8679  std::is_same<InputIT, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
8680  std::is_same<InputIT, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value, int>::type = 0>
8681  basic_json(InputIT first, InputIT last)
8682  {
8683  assert(first.m_object != nullptr);
8684  assert(last.m_object != nullptr);
8685 
8686  // make sure iterator fits the current value
8687  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object != last.m_object))
8688  {
8689  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(201, "iterators are not compatible"));
8690  }
8691 
8692  // copy type from first iterator
8693  m_type = first.m_object->m_type;
8694 
8695  // check if iterator range is complete for primitive values
8696  switch (m_type)
8697  {
8698  case value_t::boolean:
8699  case value_t::number_float:
8700  case value_t::number_integer:
8701  case value_t::number_unsigned:
8702  case value_t::string:
8703  {
8704  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not first.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()
8705  or not last.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_end()))
8706  {
8707  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(204, "iterators out of range"));
8708  }
8709  break;
8710  }
8711 
8712  default:
8713  {
8714  break;
8715  }
8716  }
8717 
8718  switch (m_type)
8719  {
8720  case value_t::number_integer:
8721  {
8722  m_value.number_integer = first.m_object->m_value.number_integer;
8723  break;
8724  }
8725 
8726  case value_t::number_unsigned:
8727  {
8728  m_value.number_unsigned = first.m_object->m_value.number_unsigned;
8729  break;
8730  }
8731 
8732  case value_t::number_float:
8733  {
8734  m_value.number_float = first.m_object->m_value.number_float;
8735  break;
8736  }
8737 
8738  case value_t::boolean:
8739  {
8740  m_value.boolean = first.m_object->m_value.boolean;
8741  break;
8742  }
8743 
8744  case value_t::string:
8745  {
8746  m_value = *first.m_object->m_value.string;
8747  break;
8748  }
8749 
8750  case value_t::object:
8751  {
8752  m_value.object = create<object_t>(first.m_it.object_iterator,
8753  last.m_it.object_iterator);
8754  break;
8755  }
8756 
8757  case value_t::array:
8758  {
8759  m_value.array = create<array_t>(first.m_it.array_iterator,
8760  last.m_it.array_iterator);
8761  break;
8762  }
8763 
8764  default:
8765  {
8766  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(206, "cannot construct with iterators from " +
8767  std::string(first.m_object->type_name())));
8768  }
8769  }
8770 
8771  assert_invariant();
8772  }
8773 
8774 
8776  // other constructors and destructor //
8778 
8779  basic_json(const detail::json_ref<basic_json>& ref)
8780  : basic_json(ref.moved_or_copied())
8781  {}
8782 
8803  basic_json(const basic_json& other)
8804  : m_type(other.m_type)
8805  {
8806  // check of passed value is valid
8807  other.assert_invariant();
8808 
8809  switch (m_type)
8810  {
8811  case value_t::object:
8812  {
8813  m_value = *other.m_value.object;
8814  break;
8815  }
8816 
8817  case value_t::array:
8818  {
8819  m_value = *other.m_value.array;
8820  break;
8821  }
8822 
8823  case value_t::string:
8824  {
8825  m_value = *other.m_value.string;
8826  break;
8827  }
8828 
8829  case value_t::boolean:
8830  {
8831  m_value = other.m_value.boolean;
8832  break;
8833  }
8834 
8835  case value_t::number_integer:
8836  {
8837  m_value = other.m_value.number_integer;
8838  break;
8839  }
8840 
8841  case value_t::number_unsigned:
8842  {
8843  m_value = other.m_value.number_unsigned;
8844  break;
8845  }
8846 
8847  case value_t::number_float:
8848  {
8849  m_value = other.m_value.number_float;
8850  break;
8851  }
8852 
8853  default:
8854  {
8855  break;
8856  }
8857  }
8858 
8859  assert_invariant();
8860  }
8861 
8880  basic_json(basic_json&& other) noexcept
8881  : m_type(std::move(other.m_type)),
8882  m_value(std::move(other.m_value))
8883  {
8884  // check that passed value is valid
8885  other.assert_invariant();
8886 
8887  // invalidate payload
8888  other.m_type = value_t::null;
8889  other.m_value = {};
8890 
8891  assert_invariant();
8892  }
8893 
8917  reference& operator=(basic_json other) noexcept (
8918  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<value_t>::value and
8919  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<value_t>::value and
8920  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<json_value>::value and
8921  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<json_value>::value
8922  )
8923  {
8924  // check that passed value is valid
8925  other.assert_invariant();
8926 
8927  using std::swap;
8928  swap(m_type, other.m_type);
8929  swap(m_value, other.m_value);
8930 
8931  assert_invariant();
8932  return *this;
8933  }
8934 
8950  ~basic_json()
8951  {
8952  assert_invariant();
8953  m_value.destroy(m_type);
8954  }
8955 
8957 
8958  public:
8960  // object inspection //
8962 
8966 
8995  string_t dump(const int indent = -1, const char indent_char = ' ',
8996  const bool ensure_ascii = false) const
8997  {
8998  string_t result;
8999  serializer s(detail::output_adapter<char>(result), indent_char);
9000 
9001  if (indent >= 0)
9002  {
9003  s.dump(*this, true, ensure_ascii, static_cast<unsigned int>(indent));
9004  }
9005  else
9006  {
9007  s.dump(*this, false, ensure_ascii, 0);
9008  }
9009 
9010  return result;
9011  }
9012 
9031  constexpr value_t type() const noexcept
9032  {
9033  return m_type;
9034  }
9035 
9061  constexpr bool is_primitive() const noexcept
9062  {
9063  return is_null() or is_string() or is_boolean() or is_number();
9064  }
9065 
9088  constexpr bool is_structured() const noexcept
9089  {
9090  return is_array() or is_object();
9091  }
9092 
9110  constexpr bool is_null() const noexcept
9111  {
9112  return (m_type == value_t::null);
9113  }
9114 
9132  constexpr bool is_boolean() const noexcept
9133  {
9134  return (m_type == value_t::boolean);
9135  }
9136 
9162  constexpr bool is_number() const noexcept
9163  {
9164  return is_number_integer() or is_number_float();
9165  }
9166 
9191  constexpr bool is_number_integer() const noexcept
9192  {
9193  return (m_type == value_t::number_integer or m_type == value_t::number_unsigned);
9194  }
9195 
9219  constexpr bool is_number_unsigned() const noexcept
9220  {
9221  return (m_type == value_t::number_unsigned);
9222  }
9223 
9247  constexpr bool is_number_float() const noexcept
9248  {
9249  return (m_type == value_t::number_float);
9250  }
9251 
9269  constexpr bool is_object() const noexcept
9270  {
9271  return (m_type == value_t::object);
9272  }
9273 
9291  constexpr bool is_array() const noexcept
9292  {
9293  return (m_type == value_t::array);
9294  }
9295 
9313  constexpr bool is_string() const noexcept
9314  {
9315  return (m_type == value_t::string);
9316  }
9317 
9340  constexpr bool is_discarded() const noexcept
9341  {
9342  return (m_type == value_t::discarded);
9343  }
9344 
9363  constexpr operator value_t() const noexcept
9364  {
9365  return m_type;
9366  }
9367 
9369 
9370  private:
9372  // value access //
9374 
9376  boolean_t get_impl(boolean_t* /*unused*/) const
9377  {
9378  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_boolean()))
9379  {
9380  return m_value.boolean;
9381  }
9382 
9383  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be boolean, but is " + std::string(type_name())));
9384  }
9385 
9387  object_t* get_impl_ptr(object_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
9388  {
9389  return is_object() ? m_value.object : nullptr;
9390  }
9391 
9393  constexpr const object_t* get_impl_ptr(const object_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
9394  {
9395  return is_object() ? m_value.object : nullptr;
9396  }
9397 
9399  array_t* get_impl_ptr(array_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
9400  {
9401  return is_array() ? m_value.array : nullptr;
9402  }
9403 
9405  constexpr const array_t* get_impl_ptr(const array_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
9406  {
9407  return is_array() ? m_value.array : nullptr;
9408  }
9409 
9411  string_t* get_impl_ptr(string_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
9412  {
9413  return is_string() ? m_value.string : nullptr;
9414  }
9415 
9417  constexpr const string_t* get_impl_ptr(const string_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
9418  {
9419  return is_string() ? m_value.string : nullptr;
9420  }
9421 
9423  boolean_t* get_impl_ptr(boolean_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
9424  {
9425  return is_boolean() ? &m_value.boolean : nullptr;
9426  }
9427 
9429  constexpr const boolean_t* get_impl_ptr(const boolean_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
9430  {
9431  return is_boolean() ? &m_value.boolean : nullptr;
9432  }
9433 
9435  number_integer_t* get_impl_ptr(number_integer_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
9436  {
9437  return is_number_integer() ? &m_value.number_integer : nullptr;
9438  }
9439 
9441  constexpr const number_integer_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_integer_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
9442  {
9443  return is_number_integer() ? &m_value.number_integer : nullptr;
9444  }
9445 
9447  number_unsigned_t* get_impl_ptr(number_unsigned_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
9448  {
9449  return is_number_unsigned() ? &m_value.number_unsigned : nullptr;
9450  }
9451 
9453  constexpr const number_unsigned_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_unsigned_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
9454  {
9455  return is_number_unsigned() ? &m_value.number_unsigned : nullptr;
9456  }
9457 
9459  number_float_t* get_impl_ptr(number_float_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
9460  {
9461  return is_number_float() ? &m_value.number_float : nullptr;
9462  }
9463 
9465  constexpr const number_float_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_float_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
9466  {
9467  return is_number_float() ? &m_value.number_float : nullptr;
9468  }
9469 
9481  template<typename ReferenceType, typename ThisType>
9482  static ReferenceType get_ref_impl(ThisType& obj)
9483  {
9484  // delegate the call to get_ptr<>()
9485  auto ptr = obj.template get_ptr<typename std::add_pointer<ReferenceType>::type>();
9486 
9487  if (JSON_LIKELY(ptr != nullptr))
9488  {
9489  return *ptr;
9490  }
9491 
9492  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(303, "incompatible ReferenceType for get_ref, actual type is " + std::string(obj.type_name())));
9493  }
9494 
9495  public:
9499 
9514  template <
9515  typename BasicJsonType,
9516  detail::enable_if_t<std::is_same<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type,
9517  basic_json_t>::value,
9518  int> = 0 >
9519  basic_json get() const
9520  {
9521  return *this;
9522  }
9523 
9563  template <
9564  typename ValueTypeCV,
9565  typename ValueType = detail::uncvref_t<ValueTypeCV>,
9566  detail::enable_if_t <
9567  not std::is_same<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
9568  detail::has_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
9569  not detail::has_non_default_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value,
9570  int > = 0 >
9571  ValueType get() const noexcept(noexcept(
9572  JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(std::declval<const basic_json_t&>(), std::declval<ValueType&>())))
9573  {
9574  // we cannot static_assert on ValueTypeCV being non-const, because
9575  // there is support for get<const basic_json_t>(), which is why we
9576  // still need the uncvref
9577  static_assert(not std::is_reference<ValueTypeCV>::value,
9578  "get() cannot be used with reference types, you might want to use get_ref()");
9579  static_assert(std::is_default_constructible<ValueType>::value,
9580  "types must be DefaultConstructible when used with get()");
9581 
9582  ValueType ret;
9583  JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(*this, ret);
9584  return ret;
9585  }
9586 
9618  template <
9619  typename ValueTypeCV,
9620  typename ValueType = detail::uncvref_t<ValueTypeCV>,
9621  detail::enable_if_t<not std::is_same<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
9622  detail::has_non_default_from_json<basic_json_t,
9623  ValueType>::value, int> = 0 >
9624  ValueType get() const noexcept(noexcept(
9625  JSONSerializer<ValueTypeCV>::from_json(std::declval<const basic_json_t&>())))
9626  {
9627  static_assert(not std::is_reference<ValueTypeCV>::value,
9628  "get() cannot be used with reference types, you might want to use get_ref()");
9629  return JSONSerializer<ValueTypeCV>::from_json(*this);
9630  }
9631 
9659  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
9660  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
9661  PointerType get() noexcept
9662  {
9663  // delegate the call to get_ptr
9664  return get_ptr<PointerType>();
9665  }
9666 
9671  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
9672  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
9673  constexpr const PointerType get() const noexcept
9674  {
9675  // delegate the call to get_ptr
9676  return get_ptr<PointerType>();
9677  }
9678 
9705  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
9706  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
9707  PointerType get_ptr() noexcept
9708  {
9709  // get the type of the PointerType (remove pointer and const)
9710  using pointee_t = typename std::remove_const<typename
9711  std::remove_pointer<typename
9712  std::remove_const<PointerType>::type>::type>::type;
9713  // make sure the type matches the allowed types
9714  static_assert(
9715  std::is_same<object_t, pointee_t>::value
9716  or std::is_same<array_t, pointee_t>::value
9717  or std::is_same<string_t, pointee_t>::value
9718  or std::is_same<boolean_t, pointee_t>::value
9719  or std::is_same<number_integer_t, pointee_t>::value
9720  or std::is_same<number_unsigned_t, pointee_t>::value
9721  or std::is_same<number_float_t, pointee_t>::value
9722  , "incompatible pointer type");
9723 
9724  // delegate the call to get_impl_ptr<>()
9725  return get_impl_ptr(static_cast<PointerType>(nullptr));
9726  }
9727 
9732  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
9733  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value and
9734  std::is_const<typename std::remove_pointer<PointerType>::type>::value, int>::type = 0>
9735  constexpr const PointerType get_ptr() const noexcept
9736  {
9737  // get the type of the PointerType (remove pointer and const)
9738  using pointee_t = typename std::remove_const<typename
9739  std::remove_pointer<typename
9740  std::remove_const<PointerType>::type>::type>::type;
9741  // make sure the type matches the allowed types
9742  static_assert(
9743  std::is_same<object_t, pointee_t>::value
9744  or std::is_same<array_t, pointee_t>::value
9745  or std::is_same<string_t, pointee_t>::value
9746  or std::is_same<boolean_t, pointee_t>::value
9747  or std::is_same<number_integer_t, pointee_t>::value
9748  or std::is_same<number_unsigned_t, pointee_t>::value
9749  or std::is_same<number_float_t, pointee_t>::value
9750  , "incompatible pointer type");
9751 
9752  // delegate the call to get_impl_ptr<>() const
9753  return get_impl_ptr(static_cast<const PointerType>(nullptr));
9754  }
9755 
9782  template<typename ReferenceType, typename std::enable_if<
9783  std::is_reference<ReferenceType>::value, int>::type = 0>
9784  ReferenceType get_ref()
9785  {
9786  // delegate call to get_ref_impl
9787  return get_ref_impl<ReferenceType>(*this);
9788  }
9789 
9794  template<typename ReferenceType, typename std::enable_if<
9795  std::is_reference<ReferenceType>::value and
9796  std::is_const<typename std::remove_reference<ReferenceType>::type>::value, int>::type = 0>
9797  ReferenceType get_ref() const
9798  {
9799  // delegate call to get_ref_impl
9800  return get_ref_impl<ReferenceType>(*this);
9801  }
9802 
9832  template < typename ValueType, typename std::enable_if <
9833  not std::is_pointer<ValueType>::value and
9834  not std::is_same<ValueType, detail::json_ref<basic_json>>::value and
9835  not std::is_same<ValueType, typename string_t::value_type>::value
9836 #ifndef _MSC_VER // fix for issue #167 operator<< ambiguity under VS2015
9837  and not std::is_same<ValueType, std::initializer_list<typename string_t::value_type>>::value
9838 #endif
9839 #if (defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201703L) || (defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >1900 && defined(_HAS_CXX17) && _HAS_CXX17 == 1) // fix for issue #464
9840  and not std::is_same<ValueType, typename std::string_view>::value
9841 #endif
9842  , int >::type = 0 >
9843  operator ValueType() const
9844  {
9845  // delegate the call to get<>() const
9846  return get<ValueType>();
9847  }
9848 
9850 
9851 
9853  // element access //
9855 
9859 
9886  reference at(size_type idx)
9887  {
9888  // at only works for arrays
9889  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
9890  {
9891  JSON_TRY
9892  {
9893  return m_value.array->at(idx);
9894  }
9895  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
9896  {
9897  // create better exception explanation
9898  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
9899  }
9900  }
9901  else
9902  {
9903  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
9904  }
9905  }
9906 
9933  const_reference at(size_type idx) const
9934  {
9935  // at only works for arrays
9936  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
9937  {
9938  JSON_TRY
9939  {
9940  return m_value.array->at(idx);
9941  }
9942  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
9943  {
9944  // create better exception explanation
9945  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
9946  }
9947  }
9948  else
9949  {
9950  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
9951  }
9952  }
9953 
9984  reference at(const typename object_t::key_type& key)
9985  {
9986  // at only works for objects
9987  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
9988  {
9989  JSON_TRY
9990  {
9991  return m_value.object->at(key);
9992  }
9993  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
9994  {
9995  // create better exception explanation
9996  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + key + "' not found"));
9997  }
9998  }
9999  else
10000  {
10001  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10002  }
10003  }
10004 
10035  const_reference at(const typename object_t::key_type& key) const
10036  {
10037  // at only works for objects
10038  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10039  {
10040  JSON_TRY
10041  {
10042  return m_value.object->at(key);
10043  }
10044  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
10045  {
10046  // create better exception explanation
10047  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + key + "' not found"));
10048  }
10049  }
10050  else
10051  {
10052  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10053  }
10054  }
10055 
10081  reference operator[](size_type idx)
10082  {
10083  // implicitly convert null value to an empty array
10084  if (is_null())
10085  {
10086  m_type = value_t::array;
10087  m_value.array = create<array_t>();
10088  assert_invariant();
10089  }
10090 
10091  // operator[] only works for arrays
10092  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
10093  {
10094  // fill up array with null values if given idx is outside range
10095  if (idx >= m_value.array->size())
10096  {
10097  m_value.array->insert(m_value.array->end(),
10098  idx - m_value.array->size() + 1,
10099  basic_json());
10100  }
10101 
10102  return m_value.array->operator[](idx);
10103  }
10104 
10105  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
10106  }
10107 
10127  const_reference operator[](size_type idx) const
10128  {
10129  // const operator[] only works for arrays
10130  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
10131  {
10132  return m_value.array->operator[](idx);
10133  }
10134 
10135  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
10136  }
10137 
10165  reference operator[](const typename object_t::key_type& key)
10166  {
10167  // implicitly convert null value to an empty object
10168  if (is_null())
10169  {
10170  m_type = value_t::object;
10171  m_value.object = create<object_t>();
10172  assert_invariant();
10173  }
10174 
10175  // operator[] only works for objects
10176  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10177  {
10178  return m_value.object->operator[](key);
10179  }
10180 
10181  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
10182  }
10183 
10214  const_reference operator[](const typename object_t::key_type& key) const
10215  {
10216  // const operator[] only works for objects
10217  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10218  {
10219  assert(m_value.object->find(key) != m_value.object->end());
10220  return m_value.object->find(key)->second;
10221  }
10222 
10223  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
10224  }
10225 
10253  template<typename T>
10254  reference operator[](T* key)
10255  {
10256  // implicitly convert null to object
10257  if (is_null())
10258  {
10259  m_type = value_t::object;
10260  m_value = value_t::object;
10261  assert_invariant();
10262  }
10263 
10264  // at only works for objects
10265  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10266  {
10267  return m_value.object->operator[](key);
10268  }
10269 
10270  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
10271  }
10272 
10303  template<typename T>
10304  const_reference operator[](T* key) const
10305  {
10306  // at only works for objects
10307  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10308  {
10309  assert(m_value.object->find(key) != m_value.object->end());
10310  return m_value.object->find(key)->second;
10311  }
10312 
10313  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
10314  }
10315 
10364  template<class ValueType, typename std::enable_if<
10365  std::is_convertible<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value, int>::type = 0>
10366  ValueType value(const typename object_t::key_type& key, ValueType default_value) const
10367  {
10368  // at only works for objects
10369  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10370  {
10371  // if key is found, return value and given default value otherwise
10372  const auto it = find(key);
10373  if (it != end())
10374  {
10375  return *it;
10376  }
10377 
10378  return default_value;
10379  }
10380  else
10381  {
10382  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(306, "cannot use value() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10383  }
10384  }
10385 
10390  string_t value(const typename object_t::key_type& key, const char* default_value) const
10391  {
10392  return value(key, string_t(default_value));
10393  }
10394 
10436  template<class ValueType, typename std::enable_if<
10437  std::is_convertible<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value, int>::type = 0>
10438  ValueType value(const json_pointer& ptr, ValueType default_value) const
10439  {
10440  // at only works for objects
10441  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10442  {
10443  // if pointer resolves a value, return it or use default value
10444  JSON_TRY
10445  {
10446  return ptr.get_checked(this);
10447  }
10448  JSON_CATCH (out_of_range&)
10449  {
10450  return default_value;
10451  }
10452  }
10453 
10454  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(306, "cannot use value() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10455  }
10456 
10461  string_t value(const json_pointer& ptr, const char* default_value) const
10462  {
10463  return value(ptr, string_t(default_value));
10464  }
10465 
10491  reference front()
10492  {
10493  return *begin();
10494  }
10495 
10499  const_reference front() const
10500  {
10501  return *cbegin();
10502  }
10503 
10535  reference back()
10536  {
10537  auto tmp = end();
10538  --tmp;
10539  return *tmp;
10540  }
10541 
10545  const_reference back() const
10546  {
10547  auto tmp = cend();
10548  --tmp;
10549  return *tmp;
10550  }
10551 
10598  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
10599  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
10600  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value, int>::type
10601  = 0>
10602  IteratorType erase(IteratorType pos)
10603  {
10604  // make sure iterator fits the current value
10605  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(this != pos.m_object))
10606  {
10607  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
10608  }
10609 
10610  IteratorType result = end();
10611 
10612  switch (m_type)
10613  {
10614  case value_t::boolean:
10615  case value_t::number_float:
10616  case value_t::number_integer:
10617  case value_t::number_unsigned:
10618  case value_t::string:
10619  {
10620  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not pos.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()))
10621  {
10622  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(205, "iterator out of range"));
10623  }
10624 
10625  if (is_string())
10626  {
10627  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
10628  alloc.destroy(m_value.string);
10629  alloc.deallocate(m_value.string, 1);
10630  m_value.string = nullptr;
10631  }
10632 
10633  m_type = value_t::null;
10634  assert_invariant();
10635  break;
10636  }
10637 
10638  case value_t::object:
10639  {
10640  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->erase(pos.m_it.object_iterator);
10641  break;
10642  }
10643 
10644  case value_t::array:
10645  {
10646  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->erase(pos.m_it.array_iterator);
10647  break;
10648  }
10649 
10650  default:
10651  {
10652  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10653  }
10654  }
10655 
10656  return result;
10657  }
10658 
10705  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
10706  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
10707  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value, int>::type
10708  = 0>
10709  IteratorType erase(IteratorType first, IteratorType last)
10710  {
10711  // make sure iterator fits the current value
10712  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(this != first.m_object or this != last.m_object))
10713  {
10714  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(203, "iterators do not fit current value"));
10715  }
10716 
10717  IteratorType result = end();
10718 
10719  switch (m_type)
10720  {
10721  case value_t::boolean:
10722  case value_t::number_float:
10723  case value_t::number_integer:
10724  case value_t::number_unsigned:
10725  case value_t::string:
10726  {
10727  if (JSON_LIKELY(not first.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()
10728  or not last.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_end()))
10729  {
10730  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(204, "iterators out of range"));
10731  }
10732 
10733  if (is_string())
10734  {
10735  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
10736  alloc.destroy(m_value.string);
10737  alloc.deallocate(m_value.string, 1);
10738  m_value.string = nullptr;
10739  }
10740 
10741  m_type = value_t::null;
10742  assert_invariant();
10743  break;
10744  }
10745 
10746  case value_t::object:
10747  {
10748  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->erase(first.m_it.object_iterator,
10749  last.m_it.object_iterator);
10750  break;
10751  }
10752 
10753  case value_t::array:
10754  {
10755  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->erase(first.m_it.array_iterator,
10756  last.m_it.array_iterator);
10757  break;
10758  }
10759 
10760  default:
10761  {
10762  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10763  }
10764  }
10765 
10766  return result;
10767  }
10768 
10798  size_type erase(const typename object_t::key_type& key)
10799  {
10800  // this erase only works for objects
10801  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10802  {
10803  return m_value.object->erase(key);
10804  }
10805 
10806  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10807  }
10808 
10833  void erase(const size_type idx)
10834  {
10835  // this erase only works for arrays
10836  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
10837  {
10838  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(idx >= size()))
10839  {
10840  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
10841  }
10842 
10843  m_value.array->erase(m_value.array->begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(idx));
10844  }
10845  else
10846  {
10847  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10848  }
10849  }
10850 
10852 
10853 
10855  // lookup //
10857 
10860 
10883  iterator find(typename object_t::key_type key)
10884  {
10885  auto result = end();
10886 
10887  if (is_object())
10888  {
10889  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->find(key);
10890  }
10891 
10892  return result;
10893  }
10894 
10899  const_iterator find(typename object_t::key_type key) const
10900  {
10901  auto result = cend();
10902 
10903  if (is_object())
10904  {
10905  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->find(key);
10906  }
10907 
10908  return result;
10909  }
10910 
10932  size_type count(typename object_t::key_type key) const
10933  {
10934  // return 0 for all nonobject types
10935  return is_object() ? m_value.object->count(key) : 0;
10936  }
