10942  // iterators //
10944 
10947 
10972  iterator begin() noexcept
10973  {
10974  iterator result(this);
10975  result.set_begin();
10976  return result;
10977  }
10978 
10982  const_iterator begin() const noexcept
10983  {
10984  return cbegin();
10985  }
10986 
11012  const_iterator cbegin() const noexcept
11013  {
11014  const_iterator result(this);
11015  result.set_begin();
11016  return result;
11017  }
11018 
11043  iterator end() noexcept
11044  {
11045  iterator result(this);
11046  result.set_end();
11047  return result;
11048  }
11049 
11053  const_iterator end() const noexcept
11054  {
11055  return cend();
11056  }
11057 
11083  const_iterator cend() const noexcept
11084  {
11085  const_iterator result(this);
11086  result.set_end();
11087  return result;
11088  }
11089 
11113  reverse_iterator rbegin() noexcept
11114  {
11115  return reverse_iterator(end());
11116  }
11117 
11121  const_reverse_iterator rbegin() const noexcept
11122  {
11123  return crbegin();
11124  }
11125 
11150  reverse_iterator rend() noexcept
11151  {
11152  return reverse_iterator(begin());
11153  }
11154 
11158  const_reverse_iterator rend() const noexcept
11159  {
11160  return crend();
11161  }
11162 
11187  const_reverse_iterator crbegin() const noexcept
11188  {
11189  return const_reverse_iterator(cend());
11190  }
11191 
11216  const_reverse_iterator crend() const noexcept
11217  {
11218  return const_reverse_iterator(cbegin());
11219  }
11220 
11221  public:
11235  static iteration_proxy<iterator> iterator_wrapper(reference cont)
11236  {
11237  return iteration_proxy<iterator>(cont);
11238  }
11239 
11243  static iteration_proxy<const_iterator> iterator_wrapper(const_reference cont)
11244  {
11245  return iteration_proxy<const_iterator>(cont);
11246  }
11247 
11249 
11250 
11252  // capacity //
11254 
11257 
11295  bool empty() const noexcept
11296  {
11297  switch (m_type)
11298  {
11299  case value_t::null:
11300  {
11301  // null values are empty
11302  return true;
11303  }
11304 
11305  case value_t::array:
11306  {
11307  // delegate call to array_t::empty()
11308  return m_value.array->empty();
11309  }
11310 
11311  case value_t::object:
11312  {
11313  // delegate call to object_t::empty()
11314  return m_value.object->empty();
11315  }
11316 
11317  default:
11318  {
11319  // all other types are nonempty
11320  return false;
11321  }
11322  }
11323  }
11324 
11363  size_type size() const noexcept
11364  {
11365  switch (m_type)
11366  {
11367  case value_t::null:
11368  {
11369  // null values are empty
11370  return 0;
11371  }
11372 
11373  case value_t::array:
11374  {
11375  // delegate call to array_t::size()
11376  return m_value.array->size();
11377  }
11378 
11379  case value_t::object:
11380  {
11381  // delegate call to object_t::size()
11382  return m_value.object->size();
11383  }
11384 
11385  default:
11386  {
11387  // all other types have size 1
11388  return 1;
11389  }
11390  }
11391  }
11392 
11429  size_type max_size() const noexcept
11430  {
11431  switch (m_type)
11432  {
11433  case value_t::array:
11434  {
11435  // delegate call to array_t::max_size()
11436  return m_value.array->max_size();
11437  }
11438 
11439  case value_t::object:
11440  {
11441  // delegate call to object_t::max_size()
11442  return m_value.object->max_size();
11443  }
11444 
11445  default:
11446  {
11447  // all other types have max_size() == size()
11448  return size();
11449  }
11450  }
11451  }
11452 
11454 
11455 
11457  // modifiers //
11459 
11462 
11485  void clear() noexcept
11486  {
11487  switch (m_type)
11488  {
11489  case value_t::number_integer:
11490  {
11491  m_value.number_integer = 0;
11492  break;
11493  }
11494 
11495  case value_t::number_unsigned:
11496  {
11497  m_value.number_unsigned = 0;
11498  break;
11499  }
11500 
11501  case value_t::number_float:
11502  {
11503  m_value.number_float = 0.0;
11504  break;
11505  }
11506 
11507  case value_t::boolean:
11508  {
11509  m_value.boolean = false;
11510  break;
11511  }
11512 
11513  case value_t::string:
11514  {
11515  m_value.string->clear();
11516  break;
11517  }
11518 
11519  case value_t::array:
11520  {
11521  m_value.array->clear();
11522  break;
11523  }
11524 
11525  case value_t::object:
11526  {
11527  m_value.object->clear();
11528  break;
11529  }
11530 
11531  default:
11532  {
11533  break;
11534  }
11535  }
11536  }
11537 
11558  void push_back(basic_json&& val)
11559  {
11560  // push_back only works for null objects or arrays
11561  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_array())))
11562  {
11563  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11564  }
11565 
11566  // transform null object into an array
11567  if (is_null())
11568  {
11569  m_type = value_t::array;
11570  m_value = value_t::array;
11571  assert_invariant();
11572  }
11573 
11574  // add element to array (move semantics)
11575  m_value.array->push_back(std::move(val));
11576  // invalidate object
11577  val.m_type = value_t::null;
11578  }
11579 
11584  reference operator+=(basic_json&& val)
11585  {
11586  push_back(std::move(val));
11587  return *this;
11588  }
11589 
11594  void push_back(const basic_json& val)
11595  {
11596  // push_back only works for null objects or arrays
11597  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_array())))
11598  {
11599  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11600  }
11601 
11602  // transform null object into an array
11603  if (is_null())
11604  {
11605  m_type = value_t::array;
11606  m_value = value_t::array;
11607  assert_invariant();
11608  }
11609 
11610  // add element to array
11611  m_value.array->push_back(val);
11612  }
11613 
11618  reference operator+=(const basic_json& val)
11619  {
11620  push_back(val);
11621  return *this;
11622  }
11623 
11644  void push_back(const typename object_t::value_type& val)
11645  {
11646  // push_back only works for null objects or objects
11647  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_object())))
11648  {
11649  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11650  }
11651 
11652  // transform null object into an object
11653  if (is_null())
11654  {
11655  m_type = value_t::object;
11656  m_value = value_t::object;
11657  assert_invariant();
11658  }
11659 
11660  // add element to array
11661  m_value.object->insert(val);
11662  }
11663 
11668  reference operator+=(const typename object_t::value_type& val)
11669  {
11670  push_back(val);
11671  return *this;
11672  }
11673 
11699  void push_back(initializer_list_t init)
11700  {
11701  if (is_object() and init.size() == 2 and (*init.begin())->is_string())
11702  {
11703  basic_json&& key = init.begin()->moved_or_copied();
11704  push_back(typename object_t::value_type(
11705  std::move(key.get_ref<string_t&>()), (init.begin() + 1)->moved_or_copied()));
11706  }
11707  else
11708  {
11709  push_back(basic_json(init));
11710  }
11711  }
11712 
11717  reference operator+=(initializer_list_t init)
11718  {
11719  push_back(init);
11720  return *this;
11721  }
11722 
11744  template<class... Args>
11745  void emplace_back(Args&& ... args)
11746  {
11747  // emplace_back only works for null objects or arrays
11748  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_array())))
11749  {
11750  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(311, "cannot use emplace_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11751  }
11752 
11753  // transform null object into an array
11754  if (is_null())
11755  {
11756  m_type = value_t::array;
11757  m_value = value_t::array;
11758  assert_invariant();
11759  }
11760 
11761  // add element to array (perfect forwarding)
11762  m_value.array->emplace_back(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
11763  }
11764 
11792  template<class... Args>
11793  std::pair<iterator, bool> emplace(Args&& ... args)
11794  {
11795  // emplace only works for null objects or arrays
11796  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_object())))
11797  {
11798  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(311, "cannot use emplace() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11799  }
11800 
11801  // transform null object into an object
11802  if (is_null())
11803  {
11804  m_type = value_t::object;
11805  m_value = value_t::object;
11806  assert_invariant();
11807  }
11808 
11809  // add element to array (perfect forwarding)
11810  auto res = m_value.object->emplace(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
11811  // create result iterator and set iterator to the result of emplace
11812  auto it = begin();
11813  it.m_it.object_iterator = res.first;
11814 
11815  // return pair of iterator and boolean
11816  return {it, res.second};
11817  }
11818 
11841  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, const basic_json& val)
11842  {
11843  // insert only works for arrays
11844  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
11845  {
11846  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
11847  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
11848  {
11849  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
11850  }
11851 
11852  // insert to array and return iterator
11853  iterator result(this);
11854  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, val);
11855  return result;
11856  }
11857 
11858  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11859  }
11860 
11865  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, basic_json&& val)
11866  {
11867  return insert(pos, val);
11868  }
11869 
11894  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, size_type cnt, const basic_json& val)
11895  {
11896  // insert only works for arrays
11897  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
11898  {
11899  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
11900  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
11901  {
11902  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
11903  }
11904 
11905  // insert to array and return iterator
11906  iterator result(this);
11907  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, cnt, val);
11908  return result;
11909  }
11910 
11911  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11912  }
11913 
11944  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, const_iterator first, const_iterator last)
11945  {
11946  // insert only works for arrays
11947  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_array()))
11948  {
11949  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11950  }
11951 
11952  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
11953  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
11954  {
11955  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
11956  }
11957 
11958  // check if range iterators belong to the same JSON object
11959  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object != last.m_object))
11960  {
11961  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(210, "iterators do not fit"));
11962  }
11963 
11964  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object == this or last.m_object == this))
11965  {
11966  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(211, "passed iterators may not belong to container"));
11967  }
11968 
11969  // insert to array and return iterator
11970  iterator result(this);
11971  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(
11972  pos.m_it.array_iterator,
11973  first.m_it.array_iterator,
11974  last.m_it.array_iterator);
11975  return result;
11976  }
11977 
12002  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, initializer_list_t ilist)
12003  {
12004  // insert only works for arrays
12005  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_array()))
12006  {
12007  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12008  }
12009 
12010  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
12011  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
12012  {
12013  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
12014  }
12015 
12016  // insert to array and return iterator
12017  iterator result(this);
12018  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, ilist.begin(), ilist.end());
12019  return result;
12020  }
12021 
12045  void insert(const_iterator first, const_iterator last)
12046  {
12047  // insert only works for objects
12048  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_object()))
12049  {
12050  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12051  }
12052 
12053  // check if range iterators belong to the same JSON object
12054  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object != last.m_object))
12055  {
12056  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(210, "iterators do not fit"));
12057  }
12058 
12059  // passed iterators must belong to objects
12060  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not first.m_object->is_object()
12061  or not first.m_object->is_object()))
12062  {
12063  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterators first and last must point to objects"));
12064  }
12065 
12066  m_value.object->insert(first.m_it.object_iterator, last.m_it.object_iterator);
12067  }
12068 
12086  void swap(reference other) noexcept (
12087  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<value_t>::value and
12088  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<value_t>::value and
12089  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<json_value>::value and
12090  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<json_value>::value
12091  )
12092  {
12093  std::swap(m_type, other.m_type);
12094  std::swap(m_value, other.m_value);
12095  assert_invariant();
12096  }
12097 
12118  void swap(array_t& other)
12119  {
12120  // swap only works for arrays
12121  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
12122  {
12123  std::swap(*(m_value.array), other);
12124  }
12125  else
12126  {
12127  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12128  }
12129  }
12130 
12151  void swap(object_t& other)
12152  {
12153  // swap only works for objects
12154  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
12155  {
12156  std::swap(*(m_value.object), other);
12157  }
12158  else
12159  {
12160  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12161  }
12162  }
12163 
12184  void swap(string_t& other)
12185  {
12186  // swap only works for strings
12187  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_string()))
12188  {
12189  std::swap(*(m_value.string), other);
12190  }
12191  else
12192  {
12193  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12194  }
12195  }
12196 
12198 
12199  public:
12201  // lexicographical comparison operators //
12203 
12206 
12231  friend bool operator==(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12232  {
12233  const auto lhs_type = lhs.type();
12234  const auto rhs_type = rhs.type();
12235 
12236  if (lhs_type == rhs_type)
12237  {
12238  switch (lhs_type)
12239  {
12240  case value_t::array:
12241  {
12242  return (*lhs.m_value.array == *rhs.m_value.array);
12243  }
12244  case value_t::object:
12245  {
12246  return (*lhs.m_value.object == *rhs.m_value.object);
12247  }
12248  case value_t::null:
12249  {
12250  return true;
12251  }
12252  case value_t::string:
12253  {
12254  return (*lhs.m_value.string == *rhs.m_value.string);
12255  }
12256  case value_t::boolean:
12257  {
12258  return (lhs.m_value.boolean == rhs.m_value.boolean);
12259  }
12260  case value_t::number_integer:
12261  {
12262  return (lhs.m_value.number_integer == rhs.m_value.number_integer);
12263  }
12264  case value_t::number_unsigned:
12265  {
12266  return (lhs.m_value.number_unsigned == rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
12267  }
12268  case value_t::number_float:
12269  {
12270  return (lhs.m_value.number_float == rhs.m_value.number_float);
12271  }
12272  default:
12273  {
12274  return false;
12275  }
12276  }
12277  }
12278  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
12279  {
12280  return (static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_integer) == rhs.m_value.number_float);
12281  }
12282  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
12283  {
12284  return (lhs.m_value.number_float == static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_integer));
12285  }
12286  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
12287  {
12288  return (static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) == rhs.m_value.number_float);
12289  }
12290  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
12291  {
12292  return (lhs.m_value.number_float == static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned));
12293  }
12294  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
12295  {
12296  return (static_cast<number_integer_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) == rhs.m_value.number_integer);
12297  }
12298  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
12299  {
12300  return (lhs.m_value.number_integer == static_cast<number_integer_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned));
12301  }
12302 
12303  return false;
12304  }
12305 
12310  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12311  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12312  friend bool operator==(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
12313  {
12314  return (lhs == basic_json(rhs));
12315  }
12316 
12321  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12322  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12323  friend bool operator==(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12324  {
12325  return (basic_json(lhs) == rhs);
12326  }
12327 
12344  friend bool operator!=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12345  {
12346  return not (lhs == rhs);
12347  }
12348 
12353  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12354  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12355  friend bool operator!=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
12356  {
12357  return (lhs != basic_json(rhs));
12358  }
12359 
12364  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12365  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12366  friend bool operator!=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12367  {
12368  return (basic_json(lhs) != rhs);
12369  }
12370 
12395  friend bool operator<(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12396  {
12397  const auto lhs_type = lhs.type();
12398  const auto rhs_type = rhs.type();
12399 
12400  if (lhs_type == rhs_type)
12401  {
12402  switch (lhs_type)
12403  {
12404  case value_t::array:
12405  {
12406  return (*lhs.m_value.array) < (*rhs.m_value.array);
12407  }
12408  case value_t::object:
12409  {
12410  return *lhs.m_value.object < *rhs.m_value.object;
12411  }
12412  case value_t::null:
12413  {
12414  return false;
12415  }
12416  case value_t::string:
12417  {
12418  return *lhs.m_value.string < *rhs.m_value.string;
12419  }
12420  case value_t::boolean:
12421  {
12422  return lhs.m_value.boolean < rhs.m_value.boolean;
12423  }
12424  case value_t::number_integer:
12425  {
12426  return lhs.m_value.number_integer < rhs.m_value.number_integer;
12427  }
12428  case value_t::number_unsigned:
12429  {
12430  return lhs.m_value.number_unsigned < rhs.m_value.number_unsigned;
12431  }
12432  case value_t::number_float:
12433  {
12434  return lhs.m_value.number_float < rhs.m_value.number_float;
12435  }
12436  default:
12437  {
12438  return false;
12439  }
12440  }
12441  }
12442  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
12443  {
12444  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_integer) < rhs.m_value.number_float;
12445  }
12446  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
12447  {
12448  return lhs.m_value.number_float < static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_integer);
12449  }
12450  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
12451  {
12452  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) < rhs.m_value.number_float;
12453  }
12454  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
12455  {
12456  return lhs.m_value.number_float < static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
12457  }
12458  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
12459  {
12460  return lhs.m_value.number_integer < static_cast<number_integer_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
12461  }
12462  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
12463  {
12464  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) < rhs.m_value.number_integer;
12465  }
12466 
12467  // We only reach this line if we cannot compare values. In that case,
12468  // we compare types. Note we have to call the operator explicitly,
12469  // because MSVC has problems otherwise.
12470  return operator<(lhs_type, rhs_type);
12471  }
12472 
12477  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12478  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12479  friend bool operator<(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
12480  {
12481  return (lhs < basic_json(rhs));
12482  }
12483 
12488  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12489  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12490  friend bool operator<(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12491  {
12492  return (basic_json(lhs) < rhs);
12493  }
12494 
12512  friend bool operator<=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12513  {
12514  return not (rhs < lhs);
12515  }
12516 
12521  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12522  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12523  friend bool operator<=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
12524  {
12525  return (lhs <= basic_json(rhs));
12526  }
12527 
12532  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12533  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12534  friend bool operator<=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12535  {
12536  return (basic_json(lhs) <= rhs);
12537  }
12538 
12556  friend bool operator>(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12557  {
12558  return not (lhs <= rhs);
12559  }
12560 
12565  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12566  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12567  friend bool operator>(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
12568  {
12569  return (lhs > basic_json(rhs));
12570  }
12571 
12576  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12577  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12578  friend bool operator>(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12579  {
12580  return (basic_json(lhs) > rhs);
12581  }
12582 
12600  friend bool operator>=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12601  {
12602  return not (lhs < rhs);
12603  }
12604 
12609  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12610  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12611  friend bool operator>=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
12612  {
12613  return (lhs >= basic_json(rhs));
12614  }
12615 
12620  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12621  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12622  friend bool operator>=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12623  {
12624  return (basic_json(lhs) >= rhs);
12625  }
12626 
12628 
12630  // serialization //
12632 
12635 
12664  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& o, const basic_json& j)
12665  {
12666  // read width member and use it as indentation parameter if nonzero
12667  const bool pretty_print = (o.width() > 0);
12668  const auto indentation = (pretty_print ? o.width() : 0);
12669 
12670  // reset width to 0 for subsequent calls to this stream
12671  o.width(0);
12672 
12673  // do the actual serialization
12674  serializer s(detail::output_adapter<char>(o), o.fill());
12675  s.dump(j, pretty_print, false, static_cast<unsigned int>(indentation));
12676  return o;
12677  }
12678 
12686  JSON_DEPRECATED
12687  friend std::ostream& operator>>(const basic_json& j, std::ostream& o)
12688  {
12689  return o << j;
12690  }
12691 
12693 
12694 
12696  // deserialization //
12698 
12701 
12764  static basic_json parse(detail::input_adapter i,
12765  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
12766  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
12767  {
12768  basic_json result;
12769  parser(i, cb, allow_exceptions).parse(true, result);
12770  return result;
12771  }
12772 
12776  static basic_json parse(detail::input_adapter& i,
12777  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
12778  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
12779  {
12780  basic_json result;
12781  parser(i, cb, allow_exceptions).parse(true, result);
12782  return result;
12783  }
12784 
12785  static bool accept(detail::input_adapter i)
12786  {
12787  return parser(i).accept(true);
12788  }
12789 
12790  static bool accept(detail::input_adapter& i)
12791  {
12792  return parser(i).accept(true);
12793  }
12794 
12840  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
12841  std::is_base_of<
12842  std::random_access_iterator_tag,
12843  typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category>::value, int>::type = 0>
12844  static basic_json parse(IteratorType first, IteratorType last,
12845  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
12846  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
12847  {
12848  basic_json result;
12849  parser(detail::input_adapter(first, last), cb, allow_exceptions).parse(true, result);
12850  return result;
12851  }
12852 
12853  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
12854  std::is_base_of<
12855  std::random_access_iterator_tag,
12856  typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category>::value, int>::type = 0>
12857  static bool accept(IteratorType first, IteratorType last)
12858  {
12859  return parser(detail::input_adapter(first, last)).accept(true);
12860  }
12861 
12869  JSON_DEPRECATED
12870  friend std::istream& operator<<(basic_json& j, std::istream& i)
12871  {
12872  return operator>>(i, j);
12873  }
12874 
12900  friend std::istream& operator>>(std::istream& i, basic_json& j)
12901  {
12902  parser(detail::input_adapter(i)).parse(false, j);
12903  return i;
12904  }
12905 
12907 
12909  // convenience functions //
12911 
12927  const char* type_name() const
12928  {
12929  {
12930  switch (m_type)
12931  {
12932  case value_t::null:
12933  return "null";
12934  case value_t::object:
12935  return "object";
12936  case value_t::array:
12937  return "array";
12938  case value_t::string:
12939  return "string";
12940  case value_t::boolean:
12941  return "boolean";
12942  case value_t::discarded:
12943  return "discarded";
12944  default:
12945  return "number";
12946  }
12947  }
12948  }
12949 
12950 
12951  private:
12953  // member variables //
12955 
12957  value_t m_type = value_t::null;
12958 
12960  json_value m_value = {};
12961 
12963  // binary serialization/deserialization //
12965 
12968 
12969  public:
13052  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_cbor(const basic_json& j)
13053  {
13054  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
13055  to_cbor(j, result);
13056  return result;
13057  }
13058 
13059  static void to_cbor(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<uint8_t> o)
13060  {
13061  binary_writer<uint8_t>(o).write_cbor(j);
13062  }
13063 
13064  static void to_cbor(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<char> o)
13065  {
13066  binary_writer<char>(o).write_cbor(j);
13067  }
13068 
13143  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_msgpack(const basic_json& j)
13144  {
13145  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
13146  to_msgpack(j, result);
13147  return result;
13148  }
13149 
13150  static void to_msgpack(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<uint8_t> o)
13151  {
13152  binary_writer<uint8_t>(o).write_msgpack(j);
13153  }
13154 
13155  static void to_msgpack(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<char> o)
13156  {
13157  binary_writer<char>(o).write_msgpack(j);
13158  }
13159 
13247  static basic_json from_cbor(const std::vector<uint8_t>& v,
13248  const std::size_t start_index = 0)
13249  {
13250  binary_reader br(detail::input_adapter(v.begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(start_index), v.end()));
13251  return br.parse_cbor();
13252  }
13253 
13254  static basic_json from_cbor(detail::input_adapter i)
13255  {
13256  return binary_reader(i).parse_cbor();
13257  }
13258 
13259 
13327  static basic_json from_msgpack(const std::vector<uint8_t>& v,
13328  const std::size_t start_index = 0)
13329  {
13330  binary_reader br(detail::input_adapter(v.begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(start_index), v.end()));
13331  return br.parse_msgpack();
13332  }
13333 
13334  static basic_json from_msgpack(detail::input_adapter i)
13335  {
13336  return binary_reader(i).parse_msgpack();
13337  }
13338 
13340 
13342  // JSON Pointer support //
13344 
13347 
13381  reference operator[](const json_pointer& ptr)
13382  {
13383  return ptr.get_unchecked(this);
13384  }
13385 
13409  const_reference operator[](const json_pointer& ptr) const
13410  {
13411  return ptr.get_unchecked(this);
13412  }
13413 
13449  reference at(const json_pointer& ptr)
13450  {
13451  return ptr.get_checked(this);
13452  }
13453 
13489  const_reference at(const json_pointer& ptr) const
13490  {
13491  return ptr.get_checked(this);
13492  }
13493 
13516  basic_json flatten() const
13517  {
13518  basic_json result(value_t::object);
13519  json_pointer::flatten("", *this, result);
13520  return result;
13521  }
13522 
13553  basic_json unflatten() const
13554  {
13555  return json_pointer::unflatten(*this);
13556  }
13557 
13559 
13561  // JSON Patch functions //
13563 
13566 
13614  basic_json patch(const basic_json& json_patch) const
13615  {
13616  // make a working copy to apply the patch to
13617  basic_json result = *this;
13618 
13619  // the valid JSON Patch operations
13620  enum class patch_operations {add, remove, replace, move, copy, test, invalid};
13621 
13622  const auto get_op = [](const std::string & op)
13623  {
13624  if (op == "add")
13625  {
13626  return patch_operations::add;
13627  }
13628  if (op == "remove")
13629  {
13630  return patch_operations::remove;
13631  }
13632  if (op == "replace")
13633  {
13634  return patch_operations::replace;
13635  }
13636  if (op == "move")
13637  {
13638  return patch_operations::move;
13639  }
13640  if (op == "copy")
13641  {
13642  return patch_operations::copy;
13643  }
13644  if (op == "test")
13645  {
13646  return patch_operations::test;
13647  }
13648 
13649  return patch_operations::invalid;
13650  };
13651 
13652  // wrapper for "add" operation; add value at ptr
13653  const auto operation_add = [&result](json_pointer & ptr, basic_json val)
13654  {
13655  // adding to the root of the target document means replacing it
13656  if (ptr.is_root())
13657  {
13658  result = val;
13659  }
13660  else
13661  {
13662  // make sure the top element of the pointer exists
13663  json_pointer top_pointer = ptr.top();
13664  if (top_pointer != ptr)
13665  {
13666  result.at(top_pointer);
13667  }
13668 
13669  // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
13670  const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
13671  basic_json& parent = result[ptr];
13672 
13673  switch (parent.m_type)
13674  {
13675  case value_t::null:
13676  case value_t::object:
13677  {
13678  // use operator[] to add value
13679  parent[last_path] = val;
13680  break;
13681  }
13682 
13683  case value_t::array:
13684  {
13685  if (last_path == "-")
13686  {
13687  // special case: append to back
13688  parent.push_back(val);
13689  }
13690  else
13691  {
13692  const auto idx = std::stoi(last_path);
13693  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(static_cast<size_type>(idx) > parent.size()))
13694  {
13695  // avoid undefined behavior
13696  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
13697  }
13698  else
13699  {
13700  // default case: insert add offset
13701  parent.insert(parent.begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(idx), val);
13702  }
13703  }
13704  break;
13705  }
13706 
13707  default:
13708  {
13709  // if there exists a parent it cannot be primitive
13710  assert(false); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
13711  }
13712  }
13713  }
13714  };
13715 
13716  // wrapper for "remove" operation; remove value at ptr
13717  const auto operation_remove = [&result](json_pointer & ptr)
13718  {
13719  // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
13720  const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
13721  basic_json& parent = result.at(ptr);
13722 
13723  // remove child
13724  if (parent.is_object())
13725  {
13726  // perform range check
13727  auto it = parent.find(last_path);
13728  if (JSON_LIKELY(it != parent.end()))
13729  {
13730  parent.erase(it);
13731  }
13732  else
13733  {
13734  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + last_path + "' not found"));
13735  }
13736  }
13737  else if (parent.is_array())
13738  {
13739  // note erase performs range check
13740  parent.erase(static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(last_path)));
13741  }
13742  };
13743 
13744  // type check: top level value must be an array
13745  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not json_patch.is_array()))
13746  {
13747  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(104, 0, "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
13748  }
13749 
13750  // iterate and apply the operations
13751  for (const auto& val : json_patch)
13752  {
13753  // wrapper to get a value for an operation
13754  const auto get_value = [&val](const std::string & op,
13755  const std::string & member,
13756  bool string_type) -> basic_json&
13757  {
13758  // find value
13759  auto it = val.m_value.object->find(member);
13760 
13761  // context-sensitive error message
13762  const auto error_msg = (op == "op") ? "operation" : "operation '" + op + "'";
13763 
13764  // check if desired value is present
13765  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(it == val.m_value.object->end()))
13766  {
13767  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, error_msg + " must have member '" + member + "'"));
13768  }
13769 
13770  // check if result is of type string
13771  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(string_type and not it->second.is_string()))
13772  {
13773  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, error_msg + " must have string member '" + member + "'"));
13774  }
13775 
13776  // no error: return value
13777  return it->second;
13778  };
13779 
13780  // type check: every element of the array must be an object
13781  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not val.is_object()))
13782  {
13783  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(104, 0, "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
13784  }
13785 
13786  // collect mandatory members
13787  const std::string op = get_value("op", "op", true);
13788  const std::string path = get_value(op, "path", true);
13789  json_pointer ptr(path);
13790 
13791  switch (get_op(op))
13792  {
13793  case patch_operations::add:
13794  {
13795  operation_add(ptr, get_value("add", "value", false));
13796  break;
13797  }
13798 
13799  case patch_operations::remove:
13800  {
13801  operation_remove(ptr);
13802  break;
13803  }
13804 
13805  case patch_operations::replace:
13806  {
13807  // the "path" location must exist - use at()
13808  result.at(ptr) = get_value("replace", "value", false);
13809  break;
13810  }
13811 
13812  case patch_operations::move:
13813  {
13814  const std::string from_path = get_value("move", "from", true);
13815  json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
13816 
13817  // the "from" location must exist - use at()
13818  basic_json v = result.at(from_ptr);
13819 
13820  // The move operation is functionally identical to a
13821  // "remove" operation on the "from" location, followed
13822  // immediately by an "add" operation at the target
13823  // location with the value that was just removed.
13824  operation_remove(from_ptr);
13825  operation_add(ptr, v);
13826  break;
13827  }
13828 
13829  case patch_operations::copy:
13830  {
13831  const std::string from_path = get_value("copy", "from", true);
13832  const json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
13833 
13834  // the "from" location must exist - use at()
13835  result[ptr] = result.at(from_ptr);
13836  break;
13837  }
13838 
13839  case patch_operations::test:
13840  {
13841  bool success = false;
13842  JSON_TRY
13843  {
13844  // check if "value" matches the one at "path"
13845  // the "path" location must exist - use at()
13846  success = (result.at(ptr) == get_value("test", "value", false));
13847  }
13848  JSON_CATCH (out_of_range&)
13849  {
13850  // ignore out of range errors: success remains false
13851  }
13852 
13853  // throw an exception if test fails
13854  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not success))
13855  {
13856  JSON_THROW(other_error::create(501, "unsuccessful: " + val.dump()));
13857  }
13858 
13859  break;
13860  }
13861 
13862  case patch_operations::invalid:
13863  {
13864  // op must be "add", "remove", "replace", "move", "copy", or
13865  // "test"
13866  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, "operation value '" + op + "' is invalid"));
13867  }
13868  }
13869  }
13870 
13871  return result;
13872  }
13873 
13906  static basic_json diff(const basic_json& source, const basic_json& target,
13907  const std::string& path = "")
13908  {
13909  // the patch
13910  basic_json result(value_t::array);
13911 
13912  // if the values are the same, return empty patch
13913  if (source == target)
13914  {
13915  return result;
13916  }
13917 
13918  if (source.type() != target.type())
13919  {
13920  // different types: replace value
13921  result.push_back(
13922  {
13923  {"op", "replace"}, {"path", path}, {"value", target}
13924  });
13925  }
13926  else
13927  {
13928  switch (source.type())
13929  {
13930  case value_t::array:
13931  {
13932  // first pass: traverse common elements
13933  std::size_t i = 0;
13934  while (i < source.size() and i < target.size())
13935  {
13936  // recursive call to compare array values at index i
13937  auto temp_diff = diff(source[i], target[i], path + "/" + std::to_string(i));
13938  result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(), temp_diff.end());
13939  ++i;
13940  }
13941 
13942  // i now reached the end of at least one array
13943  // in a second pass, traverse the remaining elements
13944 
13945  // remove my remaining elements
13946  const auto end_index = static_cast<difference_type>(result.size());
13947  while (i < source.size())
13948  {
13949  // add operations in reverse order to avoid invalid
13950  // indices
13951  result.insert(result.begin() + end_index, object(
13952  {
13953  {"op", "remove"},
13954  {"path", path + "/" + std::to_string(i)}
13955  }));
13956  ++i;
13957  }
13958 
13959  // add other remaining elements
13960  while (i < target.size())
13961  {
13962  result.push_back(
13963  {
13964  {"op", "add"},
13965  {"path", path + "/" + std::to_string(i)},
13966  {"value", target[i]}
13967  });
13968  ++i;
13969  }
13970 
13971  break;
13972  }
13973 
13974  case value_t::object:
13975  {
13976  // first pass: traverse this object's elements
13977  for (auto it = source.begin(); it != source.end(); ++it)
13978  {
13979  // escape the key name to be used in a JSON patch
13980  const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
13981 
13982  if (target.find(it.key()) != target.end())
13983  {
13984  // recursive call to compare object values at key it
13985  auto temp_diff = diff(it.value(), target[it.key()], path + "/" + key);
13986  result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(), temp_diff.end());
13987  }
13988  else
13989  {
13990  // found a key that is not in o -> remove it
13991  result.push_back(object(
13992  {
13993  {"op", "remove"}, {"path", path + "/" + key}
13994  }));
13995  }
13996  }
13997 
13998  // second pass: traverse other object's elements
13999  for (auto it = target.begin(); it != target.end(); ++it)
14000  {
14001  if (source.find(it.key()) == source.end())
14002  {
14003  // found a key that is not in this -> add it
14004  const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
14005  result.push_back(
14006  {
14007  {"op", "add"}, {"path", path + "/" + key},
14008  {"value", it.value()}
14009  });
14010  }
14011  }
14012 
14013  break;
14014  }
14015 
14016  default:
14017  {
14018  // both primitive type: replace value
14019  result.push_back(
14020  {
14021  {"op", "replace"}, {"path", path}, {"value", target}
14022  });
14023  break;
14024  }
14025  }
14026  }
14027 
14028  return result;
14029  }
14030 
14032 };
14033 
14035 // presets //
14037 
14046 using json = basic_json<>;
14047 
14049 // json_pointer //
14051 
14052 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
14053 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL&
14054 json_pointer::get_and_create(NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& j) const
14055 {
14056  using size_type = typename NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL::size_type;
14057  auto result = &j;
14058 
14059  // in case no reference tokens exist, return a reference to the JSON value
14060  // j which will be overwritten by a primitive value
14061  for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
14062  {
14063  switch (result->m_type)
14064  {
14065  case detail::value_t::null:
14066  {
14067  if (reference_token == "0")
14068  {
14069  // start a new array if reference token is 0
14070  result = &result->operator[](0);
14071  }
14072  else
14073  {
14074  // start a new object otherwise
14075  result = &result->operator[](reference_token);
14076  }
14077  break;
14078  }
14079 
14080  case detail::value_t::object:
14081  {
14082  // create an entry in the object
14083  result = &result->operator[](reference_token);
14084  break;
14085  }
14086 
14087  case detail::value_t::array:
14088  {
14089  // create an entry in the array
14090  JSON_TRY
14091  {
14092  result = &result->operator[](static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
14093  }
14094  JSON_CATCH(std::invalid_argument&)
14095  {
14096  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
14097  }
14098  break;
14099  }
14100 
14101  /*
14102  The following code is only reached if there exists a reference
14103  token _and_ the current value is primitive. In this case, we have
14104  an error situation, because primitive values may only occur as
14105  single value; that is, with an empty list of reference tokens.
14106  */
14107  default:
14108  {
14109  JSON_THROW(detail::type_error::create(313, "invalid value to unflatten"));
14110  }
14111  }
14112  }
14113 
14114  return *result;
14115 }
14116 
14117 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
14118 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL&
14119 json_pointer::get_unchecked(NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const
14120 {
14121  using size_type = typename NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL::size_type;
14122  for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
14123  {
14124  // convert null values to arrays or objects before continuing
14125  if (ptr->m_type == detail::value_t::null)
14126  {
14127  // check if reference token is a number
14128  const bool nums =
14129  std::all_of(reference_token.begin(), reference_token.end(),
14130  [](const char x)
14131  {
14132  return (x >= '0' and x <= '9');
14133  });
14134 
14135  // change value to array for numbers or "-" or to object otherwise
14136  *ptr = (nums or reference_token == "-")
14137  ? detail::value_t::array
14138  : detail::value_t::object;
14139  }
14140 
14141  switch (ptr->m_type)
14142  {
14143  case detail::value_t::object:
14144  {
14145  // use unchecked object access
14146  ptr = &ptr->operator[](reference_token);
14147  break;
14148  }
14149 
14150  case detail::value_t::array:
14151  {
14152  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
14153  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0'))
14154  {
14155  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(106, 0,
14156  "array index '" + reference_token +
14157  "' must not begin with '0'"));
14158  }
14159 
14160  if (reference_token == "-")
14161  {
14162  // explicitly treat "-" as index beyond the end
14163  ptr = &ptr->operator[](ptr->m_value.array->size());
14164  }
14165  else
14166  {
14167  // convert array index to number; unchecked access
14168  JSON_TRY
14169  {
14170  ptr = &ptr->operator[](
14171  static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
14172  }
14173  JSON_CATCH(std::invalid_argument&)
14174  {
14175  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
14176  }
14177  }
14178  break;
14179  }
14180 
14181  default:
14182  {
14183  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
14184  }
14185  }
14186  }
14187 
14188  return *ptr;
14189 }
14190 
14191 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
14192 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL&
14193 json_pointer::get_checked(NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const
14194 {
14195  using size_type = typename NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL::size_type;
14196  for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
14197  {
14198  switch (ptr->m_type)
14199  {
14200  case detail::value_t::object:
14201  {
14202  // note: at performs range check
14203  ptr = &ptr->at(reference_token);
14204  break;
14205  }
14206 
14207  case detail::value_t::array:
14208  {
14209  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_token == "-"))
14210  {
14211  // "-" always fails the range check
14212  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(402,
14213  "array index '-' (" + std::to_string(ptr->m_value.array->size()) +
14214  ") is out of range"));
14215  }
14216 
14217  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
14218  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0'))
14219  {
14220  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(106, 0,
14221  "array index '" + reference_token +
14222  "' must not begin with '0'"));
14223  }
14224 
14225  // note: at performs range check
14226  JSON_TRY
14227  {
14228  ptr = &ptr->at(static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
14229  }
14230  JSON_CATCH(std::invalid_argument&)
14231  {
14232  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
14233  }
14234  break;
14235  }
14236 
14237  default:
14238  {
14239  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
14240  }
14241  }
14242  }
14243 
14244  return *ptr;
14245 }
14246 
14247 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
14248 const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL&
14249 json_pointer::get_unchecked(const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const
14250 {
14251  using size_type = typename NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL::size_type;
14252  for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
14253  {
14254  switch (ptr->m_type)
14255  {
14256  case detail::value_t::object:
14257  {
14258  // use unchecked object access
14259  ptr = &ptr->operator[](reference_token);
14260  break;
14261  }
14262 
14263  case detail::value_t::array:
14264  {
14265  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_token == "-"))
14266  {
14267  // "-" cannot be used for const access
14268  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(402,
14269  "array index '-' (" + std::to_string(ptr->m_value.array->size()) +
14270  ") is out of range"));
14271  }
14272 
14273  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
14274  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0'))
14275  {
14276  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(106, 0,
14277  "array index '" + reference_token +
14278  "' must not begin with '0'"));
14279  }
14280 
14281  // use unchecked array access
14282  JSON_TRY
14283  {
14284  ptr = &ptr->operator[](
14285  static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
14286  }
14287  JSON_CATCH(std::invalid_argument&)
14288  {
14289  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
14290  }
14291  break;
14292  }
14293 
14294  default:
14295  {
14296  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
14297  }
14298  }
14299  }
14300 
14301  return *ptr;
14302 }
14303 
14304 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
14305 const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL&
14306 json_pointer::get_checked(const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const
14307 {
14308  using size_type = typename NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL::size_type;
14309  for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
14310  {
14311  switch (ptr->m_type)
14312  {
14313  case detail::value_t::object:
14314  {
14315  // note: at performs range check
14316  ptr = &ptr->at(reference_token);
14317  break;
14318  }
14319 
14320  case detail::value_t::array:
14321  {
14322  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_token == "-"))
14323  {
14324  // "-" always fails the range check
14325  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(402,
14326  "array index '-' (" + std::to_string(ptr->m_value.array->size()) +
14327  ") is out of range"));
14328  }
14329 
14330  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
14331  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0'))
14332  {
14333  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(106, 0,
14334  "array index '" + reference_token +
14335  "' must not begin with '0'"));
14336  }
14337 
14338  // note: at performs range check
14339  JSON_TRY
14340  {
14341  ptr = &ptr->at(static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
14342  }
14343  JSON_CATCH(std::invalid_argument&)
14344  {
14345  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
14346  }
14347  break;
14348  }
14349 
14350  default:
14351  {
14352  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
14353  }
14354  }
14355  }
14356 
14357  return *ptr;
14358 }
14359 
14360 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
14361 void json_pointer::flatten(const std::string& reference_string,
14362  const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& value,
14363  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& result)
14364 {
14365  switch (value.m_type)
14366  {
14367  case detail::value_t::array:
14368  {
14369  if (value.m_value.array->empty())
14370  {
14371  // flatten empty array as null
14372  result[reference_string] = nullptr;
14373  }
14374  else
14375  {
14376  // iterate array and use index as reference string
14377  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < value.m_value.array->size(); ++i)
14378  {
14379  flatten(reference_string + "/" + std::to_string(i),
14380  value.m_value.array->operator[](i), result);
14381  }
14382  }
14383  break;
14384  }
14385 
14386  case detail::value_t::object:
14387  {
14388  if (value.m_value.object->empty())
14389  {
14390  // flatten empty object as null
14391  result[reference_string] = nullptr;
14392  }
14393  else
14394  {
14395  // iterate object and use keys as reference string
14396  for (const auto& element : *value.m_value.object)
14397  {
14398  flatten(reference_string + "/" + escape(element.first), element.second, result);
14399  }
14400  }
14401  break;
14402  }
14403 
14404  default:
14405  {
14406  // add primitive value with its reference string
14407  result[reference_string] = value;
14408  break;
14409  }
14410  }
14411 }
14412 
14413 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
14414 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL
14415 json_pointer::unflatten(const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& value)
14416 {
14417  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not value.is_object()))
14418  {
14419  JSON_THROW(detail::type_error::create(314, "only objects can be unflattened"));
14420  }
14421 
14422  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL result;
14423 
14424  // iterate the JSON object values
14425  for (const auto& element : *value.m_value.object)
14426  {
14427  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not element.second.is_primitive()))
14428  {
14429  JSON_THROW(detail::type_error::create(315, "values in object must be primitive"));
14430  }
14431 
14432  // assign value to reference pointed to by JSON pointer; Note that if
14433  // the JSON pointer is "" (i.e., points to the whole value), function
14434  // get_and_create returns a reference to result itself. An assignment
14435  // will then create a primitive value.
14436  json_pointer(element.first).get_and_create(result) = element.second;
14437  }
14438 
14439  return result;
14440 }
14441 
14442 inline bool operator==(json_pointer const& lhs, json_pointer const& rhs) noexcept
14443 {
14444  return (lhs.reference_tokens == rhs.reference_tokens);
14445 }
14446 
14447 inline bool operator!=(json_pointer const& lhs, json_pointer const& rhs) noexcept
14448 {
14449  return not (lhs == rhs);
14450 }
14451 } // namespace nlohmann
14452 
14453 
14455 // nonmember support //
14457 
14458 // specialization of std::swap, and std::hash
14459 namespace std
14460 {
14466 template<>
14467 inline void swap(nlohmann::json& j1,
14468  nlohmann::json& j2) noexcept(
14469  is_nothrow_move_constructible<nlohmann::json>::value and
14470  is_nothrow_move_assignable<nlohmann::json>::value
14471  )
14472 {
14473  j1.swap(j2);
14474 }
14475 
14477 template<>
14478 struct hash<nlohmann::json>
14479 {
14485  std::size_t operator()(const nlohmann::json& j) const
14486  {
14487  // a naive hashing via the string representation
14488  const auto& h = hash<nlohmann::json::string_t>();
14489  return h(j.dump());
14490  }
14491 };
14492 
14494 template<>
14495 struct less<::nlohmann::detail::value_t>
14496 {
14501  bool operator()(nlohmann::detail::value_t lhs,
14502  nlohmann::detail::value_t rhs) const noexcept
14503  {
14504  return nlohmann::detail::operator<(lhs, rhs);
14505  }
14506 };
14507 
14508 } // namespace std
14509 
14523 inline nlohmann::json operator "" _json(const char* s, std::size_t n)
14524 {
14525  return nlohmann::json::parse(s, s + n);
14526 }
14527 
14541 inline nlohmann::json::json_pointer operator "" _json_pointer(const char* s, std::size_t n)
14542 {
14543  return nlohmann::json::json_pointer(std::string(s, n));
14544 }

14549 #endif

14552 #endif
